analyzed: rgyud rnams thams cad kyi rdo rje'i tshig gi dbang du gyur pa /

original: rgyud gzhan gyi rjes su 'brangs nas rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan gyi rjes su 'brangs nas rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood by following other tantras.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rin po che'i za ma tog kha bye ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rin po che'i za ma tog kha bye ba /
translated: It is the opening of the casket of the jewel of the Buddha.

original: lo ka dang lo ka las 'das pa'i bden pa la brten pa mngon par byang chub pa bzhi dang / rdo rje bzhi yongs su dag pa dang / sku bzhi dang / rigs drug dang / bden pa bcu gnyis dang / de kho na nyid bcu drug dang /
analyzed: lo ka dang lo ka las 'das pa'i bden pa la brten pa mngon par byang chub pa bzhi dang / rdo rje bzhi yongs su dag pa dang / sku bzhi dang / rigs drug dang / bden pa bcu gnyis dang / de kho na nyid bcu drug dang /
translated: It is the four manifest awakenings based on the truths of the mundane and supramundane, the complete purity of the four vajras, the four bodies, the six families, the twelve truths, and the sixteen realities.🔽It is the sixteen emptinesses, the nature of the sixteen compassions, the ten mundane initiations, and the eleven supramundane initiations.

original: stong pa nyid bcu drug dang / snying rje bcu drug gi bdag nyid dang / lo ka pa'i dbang bcu dang / lo ka las 'das pa'i dbang bcu gcig pa gsal bar dbang bskur ba dang / dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang / las kyi phyag rgya dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid bcu drug dang / snying rje bcu drug gi bdag nyid dang / lo ka pa'i dbang bcu dang / lo ka las 'das pa'i dbang bcu gcig pa gsal bar dbang bskur ba dang / dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang / las kyi phyag rgya dang /
translated: It is the clear conferral of the initiations, the pledge seal, the action seal,🔽the wisdom seal, and the great seal.

original: ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang / phyag rgya chen pos lo ka dang lo ka las 'das pa'i sgrub pa ni /
analyzed: ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang / phyag rgya chen pos lo ka dang lo ka las 'das pa'i sgrub pa ni /
translated: It is the mundane and supramundane practice.

original: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i le'u bcu bzhir gnas pa ni brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i le'u bcu bzhir gnas pa ni brjod par bya'o //
translated: The fourteen chapters of the Litany of Names are to be recited.

original: 'dir rjod par byed pa ni le'u bcu bzhi'i tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs su gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir rjod par byed pa ni le'u bcu bzhi'i tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs su gnas pa'o //
translated: Here, the recitation is the collection of words and syllables of the fourteen chapters.

original: yang brjod par bya ba ni dang po sangs rgyas rgyu med pa'o //
analyzed: yang brjod par bya ba ni dang po sangs rgyas rgyu med pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the object of recitation is the primordial Buddhahood without cause.

original: rjod par byed pa yang de skad brjod pa'o //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa yang de skad brjod pa'o //
translated: The recitation is the expression of that.

original: yang na brjod par bya ba ni ye shes kyi sku /
analyzed: yang na brjod par bya ba ni ye shes kyi sku /
translated: Alternatively, the object of recitation is the body of wisdom.

original: rjod par byed pa ni de'i tshig ge tshogs so //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa ni de'i tshig ge tshogs so //
translated: The recitation is the collection of words of that.

original: brjod bya dang rjod byed kyi mtshan nyid kyi brjod bya rjod byed kyi 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: brjod bya dang rjod byed kyi mtshan nyid kyi brjod bya rjod byed kyi 'brel pa'o //
translated: The connection between the object of recitation and the recitation is the characteristic of the object of recitation and the recitation.

original: 'dir dang po dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa dang / lo ka pa'i dbang byin nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi chogs kyis sems can gyi don byed pa ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir dang po dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa dang / lo ka pa'i dbang byin nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi chogs kyis sems can gyi don byed pa ni dgos pa'o //
translated: Here, the purpose is to benefit sentient beings by the accumulation of merit and wisdom, after entering the mandala and bestowing the mundane empowerment.

original: shes rab chen po bzhi pa lo ka las 'das pa'i dbang bskur nas rgyu med pa'i phyag rgya @187a * //
analyzed: shes rab chen po bzhi pa lo ka las 'das pa'i dbang bskur nas rgyu med pa'i phyag rgya @187a * //
translated: After the fourth great wisdom empowerment, which is supramundane, the seal without cause is bestowed.

original: chen po'i dngos grub thob par bya ba'i phyir bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis sems can gyi don byed pa ni dgos ba'i yang dgos pa'o //
analyzed: chen po'i dngos grub thob par bya ba'i phyir bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis sems can gyi don byed pa ni dgos ba'i yang dgos pa'o //
translated: The ultimate purpose is the attainment of the great siddhi, the benefit of sentient beings through the accumulation of merit and knowledge.

original: de dag gis ni de nyid brjod par bya ba'i mtshan nyid du yang dag par gzigs nas /
analyzed: de dag gis ni de nyid brjod par bya ba'i mtshan nyid du yang dag par gzigs nas /
translated: Having seen that this is the characteristic of the object to be expressed,

original: gdul bya'i skye bo nges pa dang bral ba rnams kyi sems zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i nyan thos kyi sdom pa la bya ste /
analyzed: gdul bya'i skye bo nges pa dang bral ba rnams kyi sems zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i nyan thos kyi sdom pa la bya ste /
translated: the minds of those to be tamed who are free from certainty are called the certainty of the śrāvakas.

original: 'dod pa'i longs spyod lnga la nges par longs spyod pa dang bral ba'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i longs spyod lnga la nges par longs spyod pa dang bral ba'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The saṃvara of morality is free from the enjoyment of the five desired objects.

original: de dang bral ba ni nges pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de dang bral ba ni nges pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Being free from that is being free from certainty.

original: de rnams kyi rang gi sems kyi bsam pa ni nges pa'i longs spyod la nges par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang gi sems kyi bsam pa ni nges pa'i longs spyod la nges par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Their own minds' intentions are the desire for certain enjoyment.

original: de bzhin du dbang po gnyis kyi bde ba chen po 'dod pa'i rang gi sems kyi bsam pa ni nges pa dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po gnyis kyi bde ba chen po 'dod pa'i rang gi sems kyi bsam pa ni nges pa dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the own mind's intention that desires the great bliss of the two organs is called free from certainty.

original: rang gi sems kyi bsam pas skye ba 'di nyid la sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu ster bas zhes bya ste /🔽'dir skye ba ni mi'i skya ba 'di nyid la sangs rgyas ster ba rgyud kyi rgyal por ro //
analyzed: rang gi sems kyi bsam pas skye ba 'di nyid la sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu ster bas zhes bya ste / 'dir skye ba ni mi'i skya ba 'di nyid la sangs rgyas ster ba rgyud kyi rgyal por ro //
translated: Because of the thought of one's own mind, the result of Buddhahood is given in this very lifetime.

original: lha la sogs pa'i 'gre ba lnga'i skye ba rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lha la sogs pa'i 'gre ba lnga'i skye ba rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the result of Buddhahood is given in this very human lifetime, not in the lifetimes of the five classes of beings such as gods.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: las med pa'i sar skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las med pa'i sar skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is born in a realm without karma.

original: 'dir lha la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang mir skye ba thob nas sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu nges par thob par 'gyur zhes bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir lha la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang mir skye ba thob nas sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu nges par thob par 'gyur zhes bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
translated: Here, the Bhagavān's definitive statement is that even gods and so forth, having obtained a human birth, will definitely attain the result of Buddhahood.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis khams drug gi bdag nyid kyi skyes bu chen po'i gang zag gis shes bzhin du las ngan pa'i skye ba 'dir sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu ster bar 'gyur pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis khams drug gi bdag nyid kyi skyes bu chen po'i gang zag gis shes bzhin du las ngan pa'i skye ba 'dir sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu ster bar 'gyur pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i
translated: The Tathāgata's definitive statement is that the result of Buddhahood is not given in this lifetime of evil karma by a person with the nature of the six elements who has accumulated the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: nges pa'o // des na 'dir sngags kyi theg pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nges pa'o // des na 'dir sngags kyi theg pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, here in the mantra vehicle, the Bhagavān has taught this:

original: rigs dan smyig ma mkhan la sogs //
analyzed: rigs dan smyig ma mkhan la sogs //
translated: Even those of the bamboo weaver caste and so on

original: mtshams med lnga po byed pa dag / sngags kyi spyod pa rjes spyang pas //
analyzed: mtshams med lnga po byed pa dag / sngags kyi spyod pa rjes spyang pas //
translated: who have committed the five heinous actions

original: tshe 'di nyid la sangs rgyas 'gyur //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la sangs rgyas 'gyur //
translated: will become buddhas in this lifetime🔽by engaging in the conduct of mantra.

original: zhes gsungs pa ni bden te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa ni bden te /
translated: That is true.

original: gang sngon du byas pa'i mtshams med pa la sogs pa ma rungs pa'i las te /
analyzed: gang sngon du byas pa'i mtshams med pa la sogs pa ma rungs pa'i las te /
translated: However, the heinous actions and so on that were previously committed

original: skye ba 'dir sngags kyi theg pa'i phyir phyag rgya chen po mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba'i don gyis bcom pa nyid de /
analyzed: skye ba 'dir sngags kyi theg pa'i phyir phyag rgya chen po mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba'i don gyis bcom pa nyid de /
translated: are destroyed in this life by the meaning of the unchanging bliss of mahāmudrā for the purpose of the mantra vehicle.

original: gzhan glo bur gyi mi dge ba la mi 'jug pa'i phyir rdo rje chos @187b 'byung gyi  khang par bdud bzhi'i bgegs la sogs pa 'jug pa'i sgo rnams su /
analyzed: gzhan glo bur gyi mi dge ba la mi 'jug pa'i phyir rdo rje chos @187b 'byung gyi  khang par bdud bzhi'i bgegs la sogs pa 'jug pa'i sgo rnams su /
translated: Since one does not engage in other adventitious nonvirtues, the doors of entry of the four māra obstructors, and so on, are blocked in the house of the vajra-source.

original: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms la sogs pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi sgo glegs bcug nas /
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms la sogs pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi sgo glegs bcug nas /
translated: Having closed the door with the factors of enlightenment such as love, compassion, joy, and equanimity,

original: der rdo rje sems dpa' bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: der rdo rje sems dpa' bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to accomplish Vajrasattva,

original: phyag rgya chen po dang lhan cig pa'i mtshams med pa byas pa yang /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po dang lhan cig pa'i mtshams med pa byas pa yang /
translated: even one who has committed the five acts of immediate retribution together with the great seal will🔽attain the fruit of buddhahood in this very lifetime.

original: skye ba 'di nyid la sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu rnyed par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba 'di nyid la sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu rnyed par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the definitive statement of the Tathāgata.

original: yang sngags kyi theg par zhugs pa tsam gyis ni mtshams med pa lnga la sogs pa ma rungs pa'i las byas pa yang skye ba 'di nyid la sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu rnyed par zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa ma yin
analyzed: yang sngags kyi theg par zhugs pa tsam gyis ni mtshams med pa lnga la sogs pa ma rungs pa'i las byas pa yang skye ba 'di nyid la sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu rnyed par zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa ma yin
translated: Moreover, it is not the intention of the Bhagavān Buddha that merely by entering the vehicle of mantra, even one who has committed terrible actions such as the five acts of immediate retribution will attain the fruit of buddhahood in this very lifetime.

original: no // 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis theg pa gsum gyi don mi shes par gsungs pa /
analyzed: no // 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis theg pa gsum gyi don mi shes par gsungs pa /
translated: Here the Bhagavān states that one who does not understand the meaning of the three vehicles

original: theg pa gsum ni bcom ldan 'das kyis thog mar dge ba bar du dge ba tha mar dge bar gsungs so //
analyzed: theg pa gsum ni bcom ldan 'das kyis thog mar dge ba bar du dge ba tha mar dge bar gsungs so //
translated: The three vehicles were first taught by the Blessed One, and are virtuous in the beginning, virtuous in the middle, and virtuous in the end.

original: sngags kyi theg par zhugs nas sdig pa mi byed pa ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu rnyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi theg par zhugs nas sdig pa mi byed pa ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu rnyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: Having entered the Mantra Vehicle, one should not commit evil, and one will attain the fruit of Buddhahood itself. This is the Tathāgata’s decree.

original: sngags pas sha mi bza' ba'o //
analyzed: sngags pas sha mi bza' ba'o //
translated: The mantrin should not eat meat.

original: za ba yod na gsod pa yod pas so //
analyzed: za ba yod na gsod pa yod pas so //
translated: If there is eating, there is killing.

original: rin gyis nyos na yang de'i don du gsod pa'i phyir na sha sngags pas bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: rin gyis nyos na yang de'i don du gsod pa'i phyir na sha sngags pas bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: Even if bought with money, because it is killed for that purpose, the mantrin should not eat meat.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams sha ma bkag pa ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i ba lang dang khyi la sogs pa rang gi las kyis shi ba rnams so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams sha ma bkag pa ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i ba lang dang khyi la sogs pa rang gi las kyis shi ba rnams so //
translated: The prohibition of meat for yogins is for those cows, dogs, and so on, who die by their own actions without fault.

original: go ku la sogs pa lnga dang rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa lnga rnams /
analyzed: go ku la sogs pa lnga dang rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa lnga rnams /
translated: The five, cow, dog, and so on, and the five, Vairocana, and so on,

original: yungs kar gyi tshad tsam nyin re bzhin du dam tshig gi don du bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: yungs kar gyi tshad tsam nyin re bzhin du dam tshig gi don du bsten par bya'o //
translated: should be relied upon in the measure of a mustard seed, every day, for the purpose of the commitments.

original: rtag tu kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bud med dang chang ni bsgom pa ma rmongs pa'i chos su gsungs so //
analyzed: rtag tu kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bud med dang chang ni bsgom pa ma rmongs pa'i chos su gsungs so //
translated: Always without fault, women and alcohol are taught as the Dharma of undeluded meditation.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud las bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud las bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: In the Root Tantra, the Bhagavān said:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:🔽The god Kubera, one’s parents,

original: lha nor 'dzin dang pha ma dang // yid 'dod sgrub don 'tshong ba gang //
analyzed: lha nor 'dzin dang pha ma dang // yid 'dod sgrub don 'tshong ba gang //
translated: and one who sells what is desired for the sake of money,

original: sems can skyon med bsad pa gang //
analyzed: sems can skyon med bsad pa gang //
translated: and one who kills a faultless sentient being,

original: gdug pa sdig pa byed rnams kyis //
analyzed: gdug pa sdig pa byed rnams kyis //
translated: and those who are wicked and sinful,

original: kha na ma tho byas pa'i sha //

original: srog chags du ma yi ni sha //
analyzed: srog chags du ma yi ni sha //
translated: The meat of many living beings

original: mi gcig gis ni mi bza' ba'o //
analyzed: mi gcig gis ni mi bza' ba'o //
translated: is not to be eaten by a single person.

original: snying rje bskyed par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: snying rje bskyed par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to generate compassion,

original: rnal 'byor ldan pas bza' bar byed //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ldan pas bza' bar byed //
translated: the one endowed with yoga should eat it.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa yi sems //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa yi sems //
translated: The mind that is nonconceptual

original: kha na ma tho med gzhan med //
analyzed: kha na ma tho med gzhan med //
translated: is without fault and is not another.

original: rigs kyi zhen pa bzlog pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rigs kyi zhen pa bzlog pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to avert attachment to caste,

original: bza' ba btung ba thams cad sbyin //
analyzed: bza' ba btung ba thams cad sbyin //
translated: give all food and drink.

original: rigs ngan bo la bgrod pa brjod //
analyzed: rigs ngan bo la bgrod pa brjod //

original: rdo rje 'chang gi nge nyid bstan //

original: ces pas theg pa gsum gyi don shes par bya ste 'dir mang po ma spros so //
analyzed: ces pas theg pa gsum gyi don shes par bya ste 'dir mang po ma spros so //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the three vehicles should be understood. Here, I will not elaborate much.

original: rgyas par 'grel pa chen po las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par 'grel pa chen po las shes par bya'o //

translated: Those who do not become supreme in the vehicles of the hearers, the perfections, and mantra

analyzed: snying por bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa mtshan yang dag par brjod par de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa /
translated: are taught by the Tathāgata in the Essence, the Blessed Vajradhara's Nāmasaṃgīti.

analyzed: sems can nyams par byed pa ste nyams par byed pa'i phyir rtsa ba'i rgyud du rnam pa lnga'i ye shes kyi bstod par tshigs su bcad pa lngas ye shes lnga bsgom pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The root tantra, the Praise of Five Aspects of Wisdom, states in five verses that the Bhagavān taught the meditation on the five wisdoms, as follows:

translated: the nirmāṇakāya appears to benefit sentient beings.

original: mkhas pa sgyu 'phrul chen po 'chang //
analyzed: mkhas pa sgyu 'phrul chen po 'chang //
translated: The wise one is the wielder of the great magic.

original: sgyu 'phrul chen po'i mig 'phrul can //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul chen po'i mig 'phrul can //
translated: He is the one with the great magic eye.

original: zhes pas / 'phags pa'i yul lumbi'i tshal du sh'akya'i rigs mi'i dbang po zas gtsang gi lha mo sgyu 'phrul ma chen mo'i lhums nas yang dag par 'byung ba'i don grub gzhon nu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pas / 'phags pa'i yul lumbi'i tshal du sh'akya'i rigs mi'i dbang po zas gtsang gi lha mo sgyu 'phrul ma chen mo'i lhums nas yang dag par 'byung ba'i don grub gzhon nu zhes bya'o //
translated: In the noble land, in the Lumbini Grove, from the womb of the great illusory queen of the lord of men of the Shakya lineage, the one called Siddhārtha Kumāra truly emerged.

original: des dka' ba rnam spyad nas sa bcu gnyis phyis mngon du mdzad ces bya'o //
analyzed: des dka' ba rnam spyad nas sa bcu gnyis phyis mngon du mdzad ces bya'o //
translated: It is said that after he practiced austerities, he later actualized the twelfth stage.

original: de bzhin du shambhala'i yul ka l'a pa'i grong khyer du lha mo nyi mi'i 'od rnam par rgyal ma'i mngal nas yang dag par byung ba'i sa bcu'i dbang phyug phyag na rdo rje zla ba bzang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shambhala'i yul ka l'a pa'i grong khyer du lha mo nyi mi'i 'od rnam par rgyal ma'i mngal nas yang dag par byung ba'i sa bcu'i dbang phyug phyag na rdo rje zla ba bzang po zhes bya'o //
translated: Similarly, in the land of Shambhala, in the city of Kalāpa, from the womb of the goddess Sūryaprabhāvijayā, the lord of the tenth stage, Vajrapāṇi, emerged as Sucandra.

original: chu bo si ta'i byang phyogs su zla ba bzang po'i gdul bya bye ba phrag dgu bcu rtsa drug gi grong khyer na gnas pa rnams dang po mchog gi rgyud kyi rgyal po yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lam thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chu bo si ta'i byang phyogs su zla ba bzang po'i gdul bya bye ba phrag dgu bcu rtsa drug gi grong khyer na gnas pa rnams dang po mchog gi rgyud kyi rgyal po yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lam thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To the north of the river Sita, in the city of the ninety-six koṭis of disciples of Sucandra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje rgyal po zla ba bzang por gyur to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje rgyal po zla ba bzang por gyur to //
translated: the Bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi became the king Sucandra in order to cause them to obtain the path of the Perfectly Awakened One, the supreme king of tantras.

original: 'di dag sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dag gis ston pa po dang zhu ba po'i 'brel ba sprul pa'i sku 'am longs spyod pa'i skus kyang rung ste snga ma dang phyi ma la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: 'di dag sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dag gis ston pa po dang zhu ba po'i 'brel ba sprul pa'i sku 'am longs spyod pa'i skus kyang rung ste snga ma dang phyi ma la 'gal ba med do //
translated: These [teachings] are related to the teacher and the questioner, whether they are Buddhas or Bodhisattvas, whether they are Nirmāṇakāyas or Sambhogakāyas, and there is no contradiction between the earlier and later [teachings].

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i mdzad pa la sems can gyis brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i mdzad pa la sems can gyis brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: The deeds of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas should not be investigated by sentient beings.

original: 'phags pa'i yul du bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gis dpal 'bras phung gi gtsug lag khang du rigs gsum mgon po la sogs par snang ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i yul du bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gis dpal 'bras phung gi gtsug lag khang du rigs gsum mgon po la sogs par snang ngo //
translated: In the noble land, the Blessed One Vajradhara, in the glorious temple of Dhanyakataka, revealed himself as the Lords of the three families and so forth.

original: yul shambhalar rgyal po zla ba bzang pos bram ze drang srong rnams la //
analyzed: yul shambhalar rgyal po zla ba bzang pos bram ze drang srong rnams la //
translated: In the land of Shambhala, King Sucandra revealed to the brahman sages

original: rdo rje'i tshig gsal bar mdzad pa rdo rje'i tshig gsal bar byed pa'i stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dang po mchog gi sangs rgyas yang dag par bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje'i tshig gsal bar mdzad pa rdo rje'i tshig gsal bar byed pa'i stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dang po mchog gi sangs rgyas yang dag par bstan to //
translated: the twelve thousand verses of the Clear Expression of the Vajra, which first teaches the supreme enlightenment of the supreme Buddha.

original: de las bsdus pa'i rgyud sdud par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de las bsdus pa'i rgyud sdud par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he compiled the tantra from that,

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi sprul pa rgyal po grags pa mi'i dbang po lung bstan to //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi sprul pa rgyal po grags pa mi'i dbang po lung bstan to //
translated: the emanation of noble Manjushri, King Yashodhara, was prophesied as the lord of men.

original: padma dkar po bdag kyang rgya cher 'grel pa byed pa rtsod pa'i dus gnyis par lung bstan to //
analyzed: padma dkar po bdag kyang rgya cher 'grel pa byed pa rtsod pa'i dus gnyis par lung bstan to //
translated: I, Padmakara, was also prophesied to compose a commentary in the second age of conflict.

original: de nas bdag gi rjes la gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa lung bstan to zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bdag gi rjes la gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa lung bstan to zhes bya'o //
translated: Then, after me, Yamantaka and so forth were prophesied.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The root tantra states,

original: dang po'i lo nas drug brgya'i lo //
analyzed: dang po'i lo nas drug brgya'i lo //
translated: From the first year up to six hundred years,

original: @190b shambhala zhes bya ba 'byung //
analyzed: @190b shambhala zhes bya ba 'byung //
translated: Shambhala will exist.

original: drang srong rnams ni smin don phyir //
analyzed: drang srong rnams ni smin don phyir //
translated: For the sake of ripening the sages,

original: 'jam dpal grags pa'i dbang po ste //
analyzed: 'jam dpal grags pa'i dbang po ste //
translated: Manjushri will be the lord of fame.

original: sgrol ma lha mo chen mo 'dir //
analyzed: sgrol ma lha mo chen mo 'dir //
translated: Here, Tara will be the great goddess.

original: sras po pad 'chang 'jig rten dang // zla ba bzang po de rigs bdag / sh'akya'i rigs las yang dag 'byung //
analyzed: sras po pad 'chang 'jig rten dang // zla ba bzang po de rigs bdag / sh'akya'i rigs las yang dag 'byung //
translated: Padma Holder, the son, and Chandraprabha, the lord of the family, will truly appear from the Shakya family.

original: ngag gi dbang phyug de rigs dag / de nas grags pa rdo rje'i rigs //
analyzed: ngag gi dbang phyug de rigs dag / de nas grags pa rdo rje'i rigs //
translated: The lord of speech, the family of that, and then the famous Vajra family,

original: rigs bzhi po ni rigs gcig ste //
analyzed: rigs bzhi po ni rigs gcig ste //
translated: these four families are one family.

original: rtsod dus bram ze'i rigs ma yin //
analyzed: rtsod dus bram ze'i rigs ma yin //
translated: In the age of conflict, not of the Brahmin caste.

original: zhes gsungs pas don dam par na bcom ldan 'das nyid ston pa dang sdud pa dang 'grel ba byed pa dang tha mi dad par grub po //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas don dam par na bcom ldan 'das nyid ston pa dang sdud pa dang 'grel ba byed pa dang tha mi dad par grub po //
translated: Thus, ultimately, the Bhagavat himself is established as non-different from the teacher, compiler, and commentator.

original: dam pa dang po bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs /
analyzed: dam pa dang po bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs /
translated: The first excellent one was spoken by the Bhagavat.

original: phyag na rdo rjes bsdus pa lha steng phrag drug brgya nyi shu la nyung ngu'i rgyud kyi lha rnams 'khor lo sdom pa che chung gnyis dang / rnal 'byor rig pa'i lha tshogs 'dus pa drug sgyu 'phrul dra ba gsum gyi lha rnams so //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rjes bsdus pa lha steng phrag drug brgya nyi shu la nyung ngu'i rgyud kyi lha rnams 'khor lo sdom pa che chung gnyis dang / rnal 'byor rig pa'i lha tshogs 'dus pa drug sgyu 'phrul dra ba gsum gyi lha rnams so //
translated: and the deities of the six assemblies and the three nets of the yoga-tantra class.

original: de la dpal rgyu skar gyi dkyil 'khor can zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de la dpal rgyu skar gyi dkyil 'khor can zhes pa'o //
translated: Among them, the glorious one with the maṇḍala of the lunar asterisms.

original: de rnams phyag na rdo rjes glegs bam du bris so //
analyzed: de rnams phyag na rdo rjes glegs bam du bris so //
translated: Vajrapāṇi wrote them down in a book.

original: sems can rnams the tshom med par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can rnams the tshom med par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to remove the doubts of sentient beings,

original: sngags kyi theg pa thams cad las bsdus nas /
analyzed: sngags kyi theg pa thams cad las bsdus nas /
translated: he compiled all the mantra vehicles

original: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag na rdo rje la yang dag par bstan to //
analyzed: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag na rdo rje la yang dag par bstan to //
translated: and the Bhagavān taught the Nāma-saṅgīti to Vajrapāṇi.

original: des na gang dang po mchog gi sangs rgyas kyi theg pa mi shes pa des mtshan yang dag par brjod pa mi shes so //
analyzed: des na gang dang po mchog gi sangs rgyas kyi theg pa mi shes pa des mtshan yang dag par brjod pa mi shes so //
translated: Therefore, those who do not know the supreme vehicle of the Buddha do not know the Nāma-saṅgīti.

original: gang mtshan yang dag par brjod pa mi shes pa des rdo rje 'chang gi ye shes kyi sku mi shes so //🔽gang rdo rje 'chang gi ye shes kyi sku mi shes pa des ni sngags kyi theg pa mi shes so //
analyzed: gang mtshan yang dag par brjod pa mi shes pa des rdo rje 'chang gi ye shes kyi sku mi shes so // gang rdo rje 'chang gi ye shes kyi sku mi shes pa des ni sngags kyi theg pa mi shes so //
translated: Whoever does not know the recitation of the name does not know the gnosis body of Vajradhara.🔽Whoever does not know the gnosis body of Vajradhara does not know the Mantra Vehicle.

original: gang sngags kyi theg pa mi shes pa de 'khor ba ste thams cad du bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gi lam dang bral bas so //
analyzed: gang sngags kyi theg pa mi shes pa de 'khor ba ste thams cad du bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gi lam dang bral bas so //
translated: Whoever does not know the Mantra Vehicle is in cyclic existence, because they are always separated from the path of the Bhagavat Vajradhara.

original: des na dang po mchog gi sangs rgyas thar pa'i don du slob ma mchog rnams kyis mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: des na dang po mchog gi sangs rgyas thar pa'i don du slob ma mchog rnams kyis mnyan par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the supreme disciples should listen to the first chapter for the purpose of liberation.

original: bla ma dam pas kyang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: bla ma dam pas kyang bshad par bya'o //
translated: The excellent guru should also explain it.

original: de nas le'u dang po zhus pas bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas le'u dang po zhus pas bshad par bya ste /
translated: Then, since the first chapter is requested, it should be explained.

original: sdud pa po dang / de'i grogs rdang / zhu ba'i tshul ji ltar dang / dgos pa gang gi ched du dang / yul gang la zhus pa dang / chos gang zhus pa dang / gzung bar khas blangs pa gsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: sdud pa po dang / de'i grogs rdang / zhu ba'i tshul ji ltar dang / dgos pa gang gi ched du dang / yul gang la zhus pa dang / chos gang zhus pa dang / gzung bar khas blangs pa gsal bar bya ste /
translated: The compiler, his companion Vajra, the way of requesting, the purpose for which, the object to whom it was requested, the Dharma requested, and the promise to uphold it should be clarified.

original: de nas dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang //
analyzed: de nas dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang //
translated: Then, the glorious Vajradhara.

original: @191a * // zhes pa la /
analyzed: @191a * // zhes pa la /
translated: Here, it is said:

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa la sogs pa med par /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa la sogs pa med par /
translated: Without Thus have I heard, etc.,

original: de nas zhes pa ji ltar yin zhe na bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa ji ltar yin zhe na bshad par bya ste /
translated: how is then?

original: tshig gi rjes su 'brang ba na rtsa ba'i rgyud khri drug stong ba'i sgyu 'phrul dra ba sngar gsungs pa'i rjes yin pas na de nas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshig gi rjes su 'brang ba na rtsa ba'i rgyud khri drug stong ba'i sgyu 'phrul dra ba sngar gsungs pa'i rjes yin pas na de nas zhes bya'o //
translated: It is explained: Following the words, since it is after the previous teaching of the root tantra of sixteen thousand, it is called 'then.'

original: yang 'di skad bdag gis thos pa la brtags te /
analyzed: yang 'di skad bdag gis thos pa la brtags te /
translated: Again, this is examined:

original: sangs rgyas kyis thos pa yin na sangs rgyas min te gzhan la rag las bas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis thos pa yin na sangs rgyas min te gzhan la rag las bas so //
translated: If it is heard by the Buddha, it is not the Buddha, because it depends on another.

original: sdud pa po yin na bka' bslad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdud pa po yin na bka' bslad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is the compiler, it is because the word is corrupted.

original: de yang rtsa ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa //
analyzed: de yang rtsa ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa //
translated: Moreover, it is stated in the root tantra:

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa 'dir //
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa 'dir //
translated: In this 'Thus have I heard,'

original: drang srong rnam la chos bstan pa //🔽gzhan las thos phyir kun mkhyen min //
analyzed: drang srong rnam la chos bstan pa // gzhan las thos phyir kun mkhyen min //
translated: the sage teaches the Dharma to others,

original: zhes pas so //
analyzed: zhes pas so //
translated: not omniscient because heard from another.

original: don gyi rjes su 'brang na ston pa dang sdud pa dang 'grel bar byed pa tha mi dad pa dang gang du rdo rje'i rigs su yang gsungs la /
analyzed: don gyi rjes su 'brang na ston pa dang sdud pa dang 'grel bar byed pa tha mi dad pa dang gang du rdo rje'i rigs su yang gsungs la /
translated: If one follows the meaning, the teacher, the compiler, and the commentator are not different.

original: rgyud gzhan dang gzhan du yang gsal lo //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan dang gzhan du yang gsal lo //
translated: It is also clear in other tantras.

original: 'dir brjod bya'i don la yang 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'dir brjod bya'i don la yang 'jug ste /
translated: Here, it also engages the meaning to be expressed.

original: aa tha shr'i badzra dha ra zhes pas rgyu dang lam dang 'bras bur sbyar te thog ma bar dang mthar dge ba'o //
analyzed: aa tha shr'i badzra dha ra zhes pas rgyu dang lam dang 'bras bur sbyar te thog ma bar dang mthar dge ba'o //
translated: Since atha śrīvajra-dhara is applied to the cause, the path, and the result, it is virtuous in the beginning, middle, and end.

original: rgyu las kyi sar skyes pa rnams la /
analyzed: rgyu las kyi sar skyes pa rnams la /
translated: For those born on the stage of the cause, the stage of activity,

original: de la aa tha ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin ma'i lus so //
analyzed: de la aa tha ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin ma'i lus so //
translated: the atha is the body of the mother, the nature of wisdom.

original: thas thabs kyi rang bzhin pha'i lus so //
analyzed: thas thabs kyi rang bzhin pha'i lus so //
translated: The tha is the body of the father, the nature of method.

original: shr'i ni yi ge gsum du 'gro ste ;
analyzed: shr'i ni yi ge gsum du 'gro ste ;
translated: The śrī goes to the three syllables.

original: sha shu kra'i sgras pha'i khu ba'o //
analyzed: sha shu kra'i sgras pha'i khu ba'o //
translated: The term śa is the father's semen.

original: rarkta'i  sgras ma'i khrag yin no //
analyzed: rarkta'i  sgras ma'i khrag yin no //
translated: The term ra is the mother's blood.

original: gu gu ai yin pas /
analyzed: gu gu ai yin pas /
translated: Since gu is i,

original: ai pa zhes pa wam yin no //
analyzed: ai pa zhes pa wam yin no //
translated: i pa is vam.

original: ba na b'a yu yin pas rlung ste kun gzhi rnam shes dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: ba na b'a yu yin pas rlung ste kun gzhi rnam shes dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Since ba na is vāyu, it is the vāyu along with the all-basis consciousness.

original: de bzhin tshogs pa'i sgra'i skad du dpal du 'gro ste mi'i lus su grub pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin tshogs pa'i sgra'i skad du dpal du 'gro ste mi'i lus su grub pas so //
translated: Likewise, in the language of the assembly, it is glorious, because it is established as a human body.

original: badzra ni rdo rje yin te mi'i lus la gnas nas nam mtsho'i bar du dbyer mi phyed pas rdo rje'o //
analyzed: badzra ni rdo rje yin te mi'i lus la gnas nas nam mtsho'i bar du dbyer mi phyed pas rdo rje'o //
translated: Vajra means indestructible, because it is indestructible from the navel to the ocean.

original: dha ra ni 'dzin pa 'am yang na 'chang bar 'gro bas khams drug dang ldan pa'i mi'i lus skye ba 'di rnams sangs rgyas pa'i rgyu'i lus sems su 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: dha ra ni 'dzin pa 'am yang na 'chang bar 'gro bas khams drug dang ldan pa'i mi'i lus skye ba 'di rnams sangs rgyas pa'i rgyu'i lus sems su 'grub pa'o //
translated: Dhara means holding or bearing, because it is the body of a human being endowed with the six elements, which is established as the body and mind that is the cause of buddhahood.

original: bar du dge ba'i lam yin bas ;
analyzed: bar du dge ba'i lam yin bas ;
translated: Since it is the virtuous path in the middle,

original: aa ni gtum mo'i lte ba las ye shes kyi me 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: aa ni gtum mo'i lte ba las ye shes kyi me 'bar ba'o //
translated: A means the fire of gnosis blazes from the navel of caṇḍālī.

original: tha ni spyi bo byang chub kyi sems 'dzag pa'o //
analyzed: tha ni spyi bo byang chub kyi sems 'dzag pa'o //
translated: Tha means the bodhicitta drips from the crown of the head.

original: shr'i ni dpal te bde ba rim gyis skyes pa'o //
analyzed: shr'i ni dpal te bde ba rim gyis skyes pa'o //
translated: Śrī means glory, that is, the bliss that gradually arises.

original: badzra ni dbyer mi phyed pas bde ba dang stong pa'o //
analyzed: badzra ni dbyer mi phyed pas bde ba dang stong pa'o //
translated: Vajra means indivisible, that is, bliss and emptiness.

original: dha ra ni 'dzin pa yin pas sangs rgyas pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: dha ra ni 'dzin pa yin pas sangs rgyas pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Dhara means holding, that is, up to buddhahood.

original: tha mar dge @191b ba ni sangs rgyas kyi sa bcu gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: tha mar dge @191b ba ni sangs rgyas kyi sa bcu gnyis pa ste /
translated: The virtuous at the end is the twelfth stage of buddhahood.

original: aa ni rnam par thar ba bzhi stong pa chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: aa ni rnam par thar ba bzhi stong pa chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: A is the four liberations, the emptiness of the pure realm of phenomena.

original: tha ni snying rje mthar phyin pa'i ye shes rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: tha ni snying rje mthar phyin pa'i ye shes rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Tha is the five aspects of the wisdom that has perfected compassion.

original: shr'i ni dpal te bdag dang gzhan gyi don du sku bzhi thob pa'o //
analyzed: shr'i ni dpal te bdag dang gzhan gyi don du sku bzhi thob pa'o //
translated: Śrī is glory, the attainment of the four bodies for the benefit of self and others.

original: badzra ni sku bzhi tha dad pa ma yin pa'o ;
analyzed: badzra ni sku bzhi tha dad pa ma yin pa'o ;
translated: Vajra is the four bodies not being separate.

original: / dha ra ni mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes chen po 'chang bas na rdo rje 'chang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / dha ra ni mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes chen po 'chang bas na rdo rje 'chang zhes bya'o //
translated: Dhāra is the holder of the great unchanging wisdom, thus called the holder of the vajra.

original: tshig gi rjes su 'brang na de nas zhes sngar bshad nas /
analyzed: tshig gi rjes su 'brang na de nas zhes sngar bshad nas /
translated: If one follows the words, then having explained “afterward,”

original: dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang zhes pa la 'di ni sdud pa po phyag na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang zhes pa la 'di ni sdud pa po phyag na rdo rje'o //
translated: “the glorious vajra holder” is the compiler Vajrapāṇi.

original: sems can thams cad kyi skad gzhan gyis de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos rnam kyi  sdud pa po nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi skad gzhan gyis de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos rnam kyi  sdud pa po nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because he is the compiler of the Dharma taught by the tathāgatas in the languages of all sentient beings,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snyan du gyur pas na gsang ba'i bdag po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snyan du gyur pas na gsang ba'i bdag po'o //
translated: he is the lord of secrets because he is the ear of all tathāgatas.

original: gsang ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa las /
analyzed: gsang ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa las /
translated: The secret is that it is superior to the vehicles of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.🔽

original: bla na med pa'i rdo rje'i theg pa nyid sdud pa'i phyir gsang ba'i bdag po'o //🔽de bzhin du phyi ru 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob tu gsang ba'i sgras ni gnod sbyin te /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i rdo rje'i theg pa nyid sdud pa'i phyir gsang ba'i bdag po'o // de bzhin du phyi ru 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob tu gsang ba'i sgras ni gnod sbyin te /
translated: Secret means that he is the Lord of Secrets because he gathers together the unsurpassed Vajra Vehicle from the vehicles of the Hearers and the Solitary Realizers.

original: de'i bdag po ni gsang ba'i bdag po'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag po ni gsang ba'i bdag po'o //
translated: Similarly, externally, in the world, the term secret refers to the yakshas, and their lord is the Lord of Secrets.

original: lcang lo can gyi gnas ni phyi'i lcang lo can gyi sgra ni srog nyams pa'i ro'i tshogs te /
analyzed: lcang lo can gyi gnas ni phyi'i lcang lo can gyi sgra ni srog nyams pa'i ro'i tshogs te /
translated: The Alakavati abode is the external Alakavati, the sound of which is a collection of corpses with impaired life-force.

original: de 'di la yod pa ni dur khrod kyi lcang lo can no //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pa ni dur khrod kyi lcang lo can no //
translated: It is the Alakavati of the charnel ground because it exists there.

original: gnod sbyin chen po nges sems can rnams 'tshe ba'i bgegs du ma byed do //
analyzed: gnod sbyin chen po nges sems can rnams 'tshe ba'i bgegs du ma byed do //
translated: The great yakshas are the many obstacles that harm sentient beings.

original: de dag gi gnod pa byed pas lcang lo can gyi gnas te /
analyzed: de dag gi gnod pa byed pas lcang lo can gyi gnas te /
translated: Because they harm, it is the Alakavati abode.

original: nags su ri dags kyi bdag po bzhin du lcang lo can gyi gnas su gnod sbyin chen po bdag po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nags su ri dags kyi bdag po bzhin du lcang lo can gyi gnas su gnod sbyin chen po bdag po zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as the lord of the deer is in the forest, the great yaksha lord is in the Alakavati abode.

original: nang gi lcang lo can zhes bya ba la drug brgyas lhag pa stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig gi dbugs dbyung ba dang rngub pa rnams las brgya phrag sum cu rtsa drug gis ma gang ba 'gog pa 'di la yod pa ni chos kyi sprin gyi sa ste
analyzed: nang gi lcang lo can zhes bya ba la drug brgyas lhag pa stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig gi dbugs dbyung ba dang rngub pa rnams las brgya phrag sum cu rtsa drug gis ma gang ba 'gog pa 'di la yod pa ni chos kyi sprin gyi sa ste
translated: The inner Vaijayanta has twenty-one thousand breaths, more than six hundred, and thirty-six hundred of them are blocked. This is the Cloud of Dharma level.

original: / de'i gnas lcang lo can gyi gnas te bdud dang nyon mongs pa dang shes bya dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa de gang zad par gnod par byed pa ste //
analyzed: / de'i gnas lcang lo can gyi gnas te bdud dang nyon mongs pa dang shes bya dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa de gang zad par gnod par byed pa ste //
translated: Its location is the Vaijayanta palace, which is the place where the obscurations of demons, afflictions, objects of knowledge, and meditative absorption are completely destroyed.

original: gnod sbyin gyi bdag po'o //
analyzed: gnod sbyin gyi bdag po'o //
translated: It is the lord of the yakshas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos ston pas seng ge'i sgras sems can rnams la chos ston pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos ston pas seng ge'i sgras sems can rnams la chos ston pa la /
translated: The Tathagata teaches the Dharma to sentient beings with the lion's roar.

original: phyag na rdo rjes gsol ba btab ces bya'o //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rjes gsol ba btab ces bya'o //
translated: It is said that Vajrapani made a request.

original: gdul dka' 'dul ba rnams kyi mchog /
analyzed: gdul dka' 'dul ba rnams kyi mchog /

original: @192a * // ces pa la gdul dka' ba ni phyi ru gnong sbyin yin te /
analyzed: @192a * // ces pa la gdul dka' ba ni phyi ru gnong sbyin yin te /
translated: Here, the difficult to tame externally are the yakshas.

original: nang du ni bdud dang nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nang du ni bdud dang nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Internally, they are the demons, afflictions, and so forth.

original: 'dul ba rnams kyi mchog ni sa bcu'i dbang phyug go //
analyzed: 'dul ba rnams kyi mchog ni sa bcu'i dbang phyug go //
translated: The best of the Vinaya is the Lord of the Ten Stages.

original: dpa' bo 'jig rten gsum las rgyal //
analyzed: dpa' bo 'jig rten gsum las rgyal //

original: zhes pa dpa' bo ni sku gsung thugs gzhan gyis brdzi pa dang bag tshab  mi mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa dpa' bo ni sku gsung thugs gzhan gyis brdzi pa dang bag tshab  mi mnga' ba'o //
translated: The hero is the body, speech, and mind, which are not oppressed by others and are without fear.

original: des na 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: des na 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'o //
translated: Therefore, he is the conqueror of the three worlds.

original: rdo rje dbang phyug gsang ba'i rgyal //
analyzed: rdo rje dbang phyug gsang ba'i rgyal //
translated: The secret king of the lords of the vajra.

original: zhes pa rdo rje ni rdo rje'i theg pa mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes pa rdo rje ni rdo rje'i theg pa mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The vajra is the supreme vajra vehicle, the unchanging gnosis.

original: de la dbang sgyur pa'i mngon du gyur pas na dbang phyug pa'o //
analyzed: de la dbang sgyur pa'i mngon du gyur pas na dbang phyug pa'o //
translated: Since he has mastery over that, he is the lord.

original: gsang ba ni zab pa ste /
analyzed: gsang ba ni zab pa ste /
translated: The secret is the profound.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa rtogs par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa rtogs par dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult for the śrāvakas and others to understand.

original: de la longs spyod pas rgyal ba'o //🔽padma dkar po rgyas 'dra'i spyan //
analyzed: de la longs spyod pas rgyal ba'o // padma dkar po rgyas 'dra'i spyan //
translated: Since he enjoys that, he is the conqueror.🔽His eyes are like a fully bloomed white lotus.

original: padma rgyas 'dra'i zhal mnga' ba //
analyzed: padma rgyas 'dra'i zhal mnga' ba //
translated: He has a face like a fully bloomed lotus.

original: zhes pas phyi ru spyan dang zhal gyi mdangs legs par kun gyis bkur ba dang mchod pa'i gnas su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pas phyi ru spyan dang zhal gyi mdangs legs par kun gyis bkur ba dang mchod pa'i gnas su gyur pa'o //
translated: Externally, his eyes and face are radiant, and he is an object of respect and worship by all.

original: nang du ni padma'i sgras stong pa nyid kyi don la rtag tu gnas pa ste /
analyzed: nang du ni padma'i sgras stong pa nyid kyi don la rtag tu gnas pa ste /
translated: Internally, he always abides in the meaning of emptiness, with the term “lotus” .

original: 'dir rtsa ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir rtsa ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa /
translated: Here, the Root Tantra says:

original: ae dang padma nam mkha'i dbyings //
analyzed: ae dang padma nam mkha'i dbyings //
translated: E is the space of the lotus,

original: bha ga chos 'byung chu skyes kyi //
analyzed: bha ga chos 'byung chu skyes kyi //
translated: the bhaga, the source of phenomena, the lotus.

original: seng ge'i gdan bzhugs rdo rje 'chang //
analyzed: seng ge'i gdan bzhugs rdo rje 'chang //
translated: Vajradhara sits on a lion throne,

original: rgyud gzhan du ni nga yis bshad //🔽ces pa'o // rang gi lag gis rdo rje mchog /
analyzed: rgyud gzhan du ni nga yis bshad // ces pa'o // rang gi lag gis rdo rje mchog /
translated: and I explain it in other tantras.

original: yang dang yang du gsor byed pa /
analyzed: yang dang yang du gsor byed pa /
translated: With his own hand he raises again and again the supreme vajra.

original: zhes pa phyi ru sems can rnams kyi don du sku'i phrin las kyi gdug pa can 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa phyi ru sems can rnams kyi don du sku'i phrin las kyi gdug pa can 'dul ba'o //
translated: Externally, for the sake of sentient beings, he tames the wicked with the activity of his body.

original: nang du ni rang gi lag gis ni rang gi dpal lo //
analyzed: nang du ni rang gi lag gis ni rang gi dpal lo //
translated: Internally, with his own hand he raises his own glory.

original: de gang zhe na rdo rje mchog ste //
analyzed: de gang zhe na rdo rje mchog ste //
translated: What is that? The supreme vajra.

original: stong pa dang snying rje dbyer mi phyed ba'i bde ba chen po'o //
analyzed: stong pa dang snying rje dbyer mi phyed ba'i bde ba chen po'o //
translated: It is the great bliss of the indivisible emptiness and compassion.

original: yang dang yang du gsor byed pa //
analyzed: yang dang yang du gsor byed pa //
translated: He raises it again and again.

original: thugs rdo rje lta bus sems can gyi don 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: thugs rdo rje lta bus sems can gyi don 'byung ba'o //

analyzed: de ltar sdud pa po bshad nas de dang lhan cig pa'i grogs bshad par bya ste /

original: lhan cig tu zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: lhan cig tu zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “together with” is applied.

analyzed: tshul ji ltar na lus btud rnams dang ngo //

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /

original: khro gnyer rim par ldan la sogs ;
analyzed: khro gnyer rim par ldan la sogs ;
translated: Those who have frowns and so forth,

original: / lag na rdo rje mtha' yas pa //
analyzed: / lag na rdo rje mtha' yas pa //
translated: the infinite Vajrapāṇis,

original: zhes so // khro gnyer ni smin ma bsdus pa dang mche ba gtsigs pa la sogs pa'i khro bo cha byad dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes so // khro gnyer ni smin ma bsdus pa dang mche ba gtsigs pa la sogs pa'i khro bo cha byad dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Frowns are the characteristics of wrath, such as knitted eyebrows and bared fangs.

original: sogs ni gtso bo grangs lnga brgya'o //
analyzed: sogs ni gtso bo grangs lnga brgya'o //
translated: And so forth refers to the five hundred principal ones.

original: mtha' yas pa ni lnga po de re re la yang mtha' yas pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa ni lnga po de re re la yang mtha' yas pa dang ldan pa'o //

analyzed: dpa' bo gdul @192b dka' 'dul pa po //
translated: The heroes who tame the difficult to tame,

original: zhes pa sngar bshad do //
analyzed: zhes pa sngar bshad do //

analyzed: 'jigs su rung dang dpa' byad can //

analyzed: zhes pa 'jigs su rung ba ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi nyams dgu dang ldan pa'o //

original: dpa' byad ces pa mdor bstan //
analyzed: dpa' byad ces pa mdor bstan //

analyzed: rgyas par / khro bo'i lus kyi gzugs ldan pa //
translated: In the extensive version, it is applied as:

original: zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes sbyar ro //

original: shin du gdug par gyur rnams la //
analyzed: shin du gdug par gyur rnams la //
translated: For those who are extremely wicked,

original: zhi bas phan par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: zhi bas phan par mi 'gyur te //

original: shes rab thabs kyi rnal 'byor pas //
analyzed: shes rab thabs kyi rnal 'byor pas //

original: khro bo de bzhin gshegs kun mdzad //
analyzed: khro bo de bzhin gshegs kun mdzad //

analyzed: ces pas gdug pa can tshar gcod pa'i phyir sku che ba byin pa smin pa gsus pa che ba mche ba gtsigs pa zhal rngam pa /
translated: In order to destroy the wicked, the body is great, with prominent buttocks, a large belly, bared fangs, a wrathful face,

original: dbu skra gyen du brdzes pa'o //
analyzed: dbu skra gyen du brdzes pa'o //
translated: and hair bristling upward.

analyzed: de ltar mdzad pa'i dgos pa sangs rgyas phrin las zhes pa sangs rgyas kyi phrin las kyis sems can 'khor ba las sgrol ba'o //

original: de rnams kyi phyag mtshan ni //
analyzed: de rnams kyi phyag mtshan ni //
translated: Their hand implements are

analyzed: rdo rje rtse mo rab 'phro ba //

original: rang gi lag gis gsor byed pa //
analyzed: rang gi lag gis gsor byed pa //

analyzed: zhes pa'o // rdo rje ni rtags kyi'o //

original: rab 'phro ba ni sems can gyi don du'o //
analyzed: rab 'phro ba ni sems can gyi don du'o //
translated: “Very sharp” is for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: If it is asked whether they have afflictions,

analyzed: snying rje che dang shes rab dang // thabs kyis 'gro don byed pa'i mchog / ces pas snying rje gsum dang shes rab gsum gyis sems can gyi don byed pa'i thabs la mkhas pas don byed pa'o //
translated: With great compassion, wisdom, and skill in means, he is the supreme benefactor of beings.

original: dga' mgu rangs pa'i bsam pa can //🔽zhes pa nas /
analyzed: dga' mgu rangs pa'i bsam pa can // zhes pa nas /
translated: With a mind of joy, delight, and satisfaction,🔽he is the supreme benefactor of beings.

original: dga' ba ni sems can gyi don byed pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni sems can gyi don byed pa'o //
translated: Joy is the activity of benefiting beings.

original: mgu ba dang rangs pa ni gzhan ma gus pa med par ro //
analyzed: mgu ba dang rangs pa ni gzhan ma gus pa med par ro //

analyzed: de ltar zhu ba'i grogs bshad nas su la zhu ba'i tshul ji ltar bshad na /

original: su la na /
analyzed: su la na /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bcom ldan 'das //

analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la zhes pa // mdzes pa dang gang ba dang phyin ci ma log par gshegs pa ste /
translated: the perfect Buddha.🔽He is the one who has gone in an attractive, full, and unmistaken way.

analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i dri ma spangs pas mdzes par gshegs pa'o //
translated: He has gone in an attractive way by abandoning the stains along with their traces.

original: dper na rims na dbyang pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rims na dbyang pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like a person who has recovered from a fever.

original: gang ba ni legs pa'i yon tan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: gang ba ni legs pa'i yon tan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: The full is the ornament of all good qualities.

analyzed: phyin ci ma log par gshegs pa ni de kho na nyid kyi don la gnas pa'o //
translated: The unmistakenly gone is the abiding in the meaning of thatness.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni bha ga b'a na te bcom pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni bha ga b'a na te bcom pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One is the Bhagavān, who is the one who has conquered.

analyzed: bdud bzhi bcom pa dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan drug dang ldan pa'o //

original: spangs pa ni spang bya ma lus pa spangs pas /
analyzed: spangs pa ni spang bya ma lus pa spangs pas /
translated: The abandoner is the one who has abandoned all objects to be abandoned.

original: rdzogs pa dang rgyas pas ni @193a * //
analyzed: rdzogs pa dang rgyas pas ni @193a * //
translated: The perfected and the expanded

original: thob bya ma lus pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: thob bya ma lus pa thob pa'o //
translated: are the attainment of all objects to be attained.

original: phyag 'tshal ba ni /
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba ni /
translated: The prostration

original: thal mo sbyar bar byas nas ni //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar bar byas nas ni //
translated: is the one who, having joined the palms,

original: spyan sngar 'dug ste 'di skad gsol //
analyzed: spyan sngar 'dug ste 'di skad gsol //
translated: sits in front and says this.

original: zhes pa ni zhu ba la gus par byed pa'i tshul te go sla'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni zhu ba la gus par byed pa'i tshul te go sla'o //
translated: This is the way of respecting the request, which is easy to understand.

original: de ltar zhu tshul bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar zhu tshul bstan nas /
translated: Having thus shown the way of requesting,

original: dgos pa gang gi ched du bshad par bya ste khyab bdag bdag la sman pa dang / bdag don bdag la thugs brtse'i phyir //
analyzed: dgos pa gang gi ched du bshad par bya ste khyab bdag bdag la sman pa dang / bdag don bdag la thugs brtse'i phyir //
translated: the purpose for which it is to be explained is for the sake of my own welfare and out of compassion for me, O all-pervading lord.🔽 🔽For the sake of my own welfare is the purpose of the request.

original: zhes pa / khyab bdag ni bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: zhes pa / khyab bdag ni bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: The all-pervading lord is the Bhagavat.

original: thugs rjes sems can thams cad mnyam par khyab pa'o //
analyzed: thugs rjes sems can thams cad mnyam par khyab pa'o //

original: des na thugs brtse ba'i phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des na thugs brtse ba'i phyir zhes pa'o //

analyzed: bdag la sman pa ni rang gi don du zhus pa dang / bdag don bdag la ni gzhan gyi don du zhus pa'o //

analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra bas mngon rdzogs pa'i //
translated: By the net of illusions,

original: byang chub ci nas bdag thob mdzod //
analyzed: byang chub ci nas bdag thob mdzod //
translated: may I attain enlightenment.

analyzed: ces pa sgyu 'phrul dra ba ni sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes la bzhi bzhi bcu drug gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa zhus pa ste /
translated: The net of illusions is the request to be fully enlightened by the sixteen aspects of body, speech, mind, and gnosis.

original: 'og nas de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig / ces pas lan 'debs pas 'dir ma spros so //
analyzed: 'og nas de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig / ces pas lan 'debs pas 'dir ma spros so //
translated: Since it is answered below with “knowing the sixteen aspects of reality,” it is not elaborated here.

original: des byang chub thob par zhus pa ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: des byang chub thob par zhus pa ni dgos pa'o //
translated: The request to attain enlightenment is the purpose.

original: nyon mongs pas ni sems dkrugs shing //
analyzed: nyon mongs pas ni sems dkrugs shing //
translated: The mind is disturbed by afflictions,

original: zhes pa nyon mongs pa ni drug lnga'am gsum mo //
analyzed: zhes pa nyon mongs pa ni drug lnga'am gsum mo //

original: sems dkrugs pa ni de'i bag chags kyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: sems dkrugs pa ni de'i bag chags kyi dbang gis so //
translated: The agitation of the mind is due to the power of the latent impressions of that.

analyzed: mi shes pa zhes pa rang dang po'i sangs rgyas sku bzhi'i ngo bor gnas pa ma shes pa'o //
translated: Ignorance is the non-understanding of one's own original abiding in the nature of the four buddha bodies.

original: 'dam du bying pa de ma shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dam du bying pa de ma shes pa'o //
translated: Sinking in the mud is the non-understanding of that.

original: sems can rnams ni 'khor ba na gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni 'khor ba na gnas pa rnams so //

analyzed: tshangs pa'i gsung ni snyan pa yis //

original: 'jig rten gsum po kun bkang nas //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po kun bkang nas //
translated: he fills the three worlds.

original: zhes pa 'jig rten pa lha tshangs pa gdong bzhi nas rig byed brjod pa ni ma yin te /🔽de @195a * //
analyzed: zhes pa 'jig rten pa lha tshangs pa gdong bzhi nas rig byed brjod pa ni ma yin te / de @195a * //
translated: This is not the recitation of the Vedas by the four-faced god Brahma, a worldly being.

original: bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can rnams 'khor ba las thar ba'i chos kyi sgra sgrogs pa ni tshangs pa'i gsung ngo //
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can rnams 'khor ba las thar ba'i chos kyi sgra sgrogs pa ni tshangs pa'i gsung ngo //
translated: The Tathagata's Brahma voice is the sound of the Dharma that liberates sentient beings from samsara.

original: snyan pa ni rang rang gi skad du go ba'o //
analyzed: snyan pa ni rang rang gi skad du go ba'o //
translated: Pleasant means that it is understood in each being's own language.

original: 'jig rten gsum po kun bkang nas //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po kun bkang nas //
translated: He fills the three worlds.

original: zhes pa 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'o //
translated: These are the desire, form, and formless realms.

original: kun ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: kun ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po na gnas pa'o //
translated: All refers to those who dwell in the great billionfold world system.

original: bkang nas zhes pa gsung gcig gsungs pas dus gcig la rang rang gi skad du go ba ni gsung gi cho 'phrul lo //
analyzed: bkang nas zhes pa gsung gcig gsungs pas dus gcig la rang rang gi skad du go ba ni gsung gi cho 'phrul lo //
translated: Filling refers to the miracle of speech, in which a single utterance is understood in each individual language at the same time.

original: de nas sdud pa po la legs par brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de nas sdud pa po la legs par brjod pa ni /
translated: Next, the compiler is addressed well:

original: lag na rdo rje stobs po che //
analyzed: lag na rdo rje stobs po che //
translated: O Vajrapāṇi, great strength,

original: gsang dbang la ni slar gsungs pa //
analyzed: gsang dbang la ni slar gsungs pa //
translated: you who are empowered in the secret,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so forth.

original: lag na rdo rje ni dbyibs dang chos su go bar bya'o //
analyzed: lag na rdo rje ni dbyibs dang chos su go bar bya'o //
translated: Vajrapāṇi is to be understood as shape and quality.

original: stobs po che ni bdud dang nyon mongs pa bcom pa'o //
analyzed: stobs po che ni bdud dang nyon mongs pa bcom pa'o //
translated: Great strength is the destruction of demons and afflictions.

original: gsad dbang ni sngags kyi sdud pa po'o //
analyzed: gsad dbang ni sngags kyi sdud pa po'o //
translated: Empowered in the secret is the compiler of the mantra.

original: slar gsungs pa ni len no //
analyzed: slar gsungs pa ni len no //
translated: You who are empowered in the secret is the one who receives.

original: snying rje che dang ldan gyur pas //
analyzed: snying rje che dang ldan gyur pas //
translated: Endowed with great compassion

original: zhes pa sdud pa po'i yon tan no //
analyzed: zhes pa sdud pa po'i yon tan no //
translated: is the quality of the compiler.

original: 'gro la phan pa'i don du khyod //
analyzed: 'gro la phan pa'i don du khyod //
translated: For the benefit of migrating beings,

original: ces pa dgos pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa dgos pa'o //
translated: is the purpose.

original: nga las nyan par brtson pa ni //🔽legs so dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang //
analyzed: nga las nyan par brtson pa ni // legs so dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang //
translated: You who are diligent in listening to me🔽is the one who receives.🔽Excellent, glorious Vajradhara,

original: lag na rdo rje khyod legs so //🔽zhes sbyar te //
analyzed: lag na rdo rje khyod legs so //🔽zhes sbyar te //
translated: Vajrapāṇi, you are excellent.

original: nga las nyan par brtson pa ni //
analyzed: nga las nyan par brtson pa ni //
translated: And you are striving to listen to me.

original: zhes bya ba phyag na rdo rje la le lo med kyang gzhan don du brtson par mngon pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba phyag na rdo rje la le lo med kyang gzhan don du brtson par mngon pa'o //
translated: This shows that although Vajrapani is not lazy, he is striving for the sake of others.

original: legs so gcig ni nyan pa la brjod la gcig brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: legs so gcig ni nyan pa la brjod la gcig brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'o //
translated: One [praise] is for the one who desires to listen, and one is for the one who possesses diligence.

original: gsang ba'i bdag po de phyir ngas //
analyzed: gsang ba'i bdag po de phyir ngas //
translated: Therefore, O Lord of Secrets,

original: zhes pa nyan par 'dod pa dang brtson 'grus dang ldan pas na de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa nyan par 'dod pa dang brtson 'grus dang ldan pas na de'i phyir ro //
translated: This means that because of desiring to listen and possessing diligence, [the praise] is for that reason.

original: khyod la legs par bstan par bya //
analyzed: khyod la legs par bstan par bya //
translated: I will teach it well to you.

original: zhes pa ni snod kyi rim pas don rim par bstan par bya zhes zhal gyis bzhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni snod kyi rim pas don rim par bstan par bya zhes zhal gyis bzhes pa'o //
translated: This is the promise to teach the meaning in stages according to the stages of the vessel.

original: khyod ni rtse gcig yid kyis nyon //
analyzed: khyod ni rtse gcig yid kyis nyon //
translated: You should listen with a one-pointed mind.

original: zhes pas phyag na rdo rje la thugs yeng ba med kyang ma 'ongs pa rnams la gdams pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pas phyag na rdo rje la thugs yeng ba med kyang ma 'ongs pa rnams la gdams pa'o //
translated: This is the instruction for Vajrapani, who is not distracted, for those in the future.

original: de ltar chos sdud pa la gdams nas brjod bya'i chos bstan pa ni //🔽ye shes lus can 'jam dpal gyi //
analyzed: de ltar chos sdud pa la gdams nas brjod bya'i chos bstan pa ni // ye shes lus can 'jam dpal gyi //
translated: Having thus instructed in the gathering of the Dharma, the Dharma to be expressed is taught:🔽The mere utterance of the name of Manjushri,

original: ming brjod pa ni don che ba //
analyzed: ming brjod pa ni don che ba //
translated: who has the body of wisdom, is of great meaning,

original: dag par byed cing sdig sel ba //
analyzed: dag par byed cing sdig sel ba //
translated: purifying and dispelling evil deeds.

original: zhes pa gang du ye shes kyi sku zhus pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa gang du ye shes kyi sku zhus pa'o //
translated: This is the question about the body of pristine awareness.

original: de lta ba'i lus ni 'jam dpal gyi sku'o //
analyzed: de lta ba'i lus ni 'jam dpal gyi sku'o //
translated: The body of the view is the body of Manjushri.

original: ming la brten nas don khong du chud pas na don che ba'o //
analyzed: ming la brten nas don khong du chud pas na don che ba'o //
translated: It is of great meaning because one comprehends the meaning in dependence on the name.

original: don des dag par byed pas na spang pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: don des dag par byed pas na spang pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: It is the perfection of abandonment because it purifies through that meaning.

original: sdig pa sel bas na ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa sel bas na ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: It is the perfection of pristine awareness because it removes misdeeds.

original: sdud pa pos gus par bya ba ni //
analyzed: sdud pa pos gus par bya ba ni //
translated: The compiler's respect:

original: @195b bcom ldan de ni legs zhes gsol //
analyzed: @195b bcom ldan de ni legs zhes gsol //
translated: The Bhagavan said, That is excellent!

original: zhes pa gus pas sems la 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa gus pas sems la 'dzin pa'o //
translated: This is respectfully holding it in the mind.

original: de ltar le'u gnyis pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: de ltar le'u gnyis pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the second chapter.

original: // / da ni rigs kyi dbye ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni rigs kyi dbye ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the divisions of the family will be explained.

original: rigs la gang gis gzigs pa dang / rigs gcig pa dang gnyis pa dang gsum dang lnga dang drug dang sum cu dang / drug cu dang / sum brgya drug cu dang / stong brgyad cur phye bas gsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: rigs la gang gis gzigs pa dang / rigs gcig pa dang gnyis pa dang gsum dang lnga dang drug dang sum cu dang / drug cu dang / sum brgya drug cu dang / stong brgyad cur phye bas gsal bar bya'o //
translated: The family is to be clarified by seeing with whom, the single family, the two families, the three families, the five families, the six families, the thirty families, the sixty families, the three hundred and sixty families, and the one thousand and eighty families.

original: rigs de rnams la gang la gang gis gzigs na /
analyzed: rigs de rnams la gang la gang gis gzigs na /
translated: With whom is that family seen?

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub //
translated: Then the Lord Shakyamuni🔽...

original: ces pa nas cher gzigs pa zhes par 'brel te thams cad mkhyen pas so //
analyzed: ces pa nas cher gzigs pa zhes par 'brel te thams cad mkhyen pas so //
translated: ... looked with his eyes of omniscience.

original: gsang sngags rigs chen thams cad dang // zhes pas gsang sngags ni mantra yin pas /
analyzed: gsang sngags rigs chen thams cad dang // zhes pas gsang sngags ni mantra yin pas /
translated: The great families of all the secret mantras🔽...

original: man ni yid yin /
analyzed: man ni yid yin /
translated: Mantra means mind.

original: tra ni skyob pas yid skyob pa'i rigs te /
analyzed: tra ni skyob pas yid skyob pa'i rigs te /
translated: Tra means to protect, so it is the family that protects the mind.

original: thugs kyi bdag po'i rigs gcig go //
analyzed: thugs kyi bdag po'i rigs gcig go //
translated: It is the single family of the Lord of Mind.

original: gsang sngags rig sngags 'chang ba'i rigs //
analyzed: gsang sngags rig sngags 'chang ba'i rigs //
translated: The families of the holders of secret mantras and knowledge mantras🔽...

original: zhes pa gsang sngags 'chang ba thabs kyi rigs dang // rig sngags 'chang ba shes rab kyi rigs te //
analyzed: zhes pa gsang sngags 'chang ba thabs kyi rigs dang // rig sngags 'chang ba shes rab kyi rigs te //
translated: The holders of secret mantras are the family of method, and the holders of knowledge mantras are the family of wisdom.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi rigs gnyis so //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi rigs gnyis so //
translated: These are the two families of method and wisdom.

original: rigs gsum la ni rnam par gzigs //
analyzed: rigs gsum la ni rnam par gzigs //
translated: The three families are the Vairochana family,🔽...

original: zhes pa sku gsung thugs kyi rigs gsum mo //
analyzed: zhes pa sku gsung thugs kyi rigs gsum mo //
translated: The three families are the body, speech, and mind families.

original: phyag rgya chen po'i rigs mchog dang // zhes pa mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rgyas 'debs pa'i rigs lnga'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i rigs mchog dang // zhes pa mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rgyas 'debs pa'i rigs lnga'o //
translated: The supreme family of the great seal🔽...

original: rigs mchog dang zhes pa rigs kyi bdag po dpal rdo rje 'chang dang rigs drug go //
analyzed: rigs mchog dang zhes pa rigs kyi bdag po dpal rdo rje 'chang dang rigs drug go //
translated: The supreme lineage is the lineage of the glorious Vajradhara, the lord of the lineage, and the six lineages.

original: 'jig rten 'jig rten 'das pa'i rigs //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'jig rten 'das pa'i rigs //
