analyzed: zhes pas rigs drug re re la yang lnga lngar phye bas rigs sum cu ste 'jig rten pa'i rigs so //
translated: Each of the six lineages is divided into five, making thirty lineages, which are the mundane lineages.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rigs ni rigs sum cu las thabs dang shes rab kyi phye bas rigs drug cu'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rigs ni rigs sum cu las thabs dang shes rab kyi phye bas rigs drug cu'o //
translated: The supramundane lineages are the thirty lineages divided into the sixty lineages of method and wisdom.

original: 'jig rten snang byed rigs chen dang // zhes pa rigs drug cu la pha las thob pa'i rigs gsum dang / ma las thob pa'i rigs gsum dang / drug gis phye bas rigs sum brgya drug cu'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten snang byed rigs chen dang // zhes pa rigs drug cu la pha las thob pa'i rigs gsum dang / ma las thob pa'i rigs gsum dang / drug gis phye bas rigs sum brgya drug cu'o //
translated: The great lineage is the sixty lineages divided into the three hundred and sixty lineages by the three lineages obtained from the father and the three lineages obtained from the mother.

original: rigs chen dang zhes pa ni rigs sum brgya drug cu la sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rigs gsum dang phye bas rigs stong brgyad cur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs chen dang zhes pa ni rigs sum brgya drug cu la sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rigs gsum dang phye bas rigs stong brgyad cur 'gyur ro //
translated: The great great lineage is the three hundred and sixty lineages divided into the one thousand eight hundred lineages by the three lineages of body, speech, and mind.

original: de ltar rigs kyi dbye ba mang na yang /
analyzed: de ltar rigs kyi dbye ba mang na yang /
translated: Thus, although there are many divisions of lineages,

original: rigs chen gtsug tor cher gzigs nas //
analyzed: rigs chen gtsug tor cher gzigs nas //
translated: Having seen the great uṣṇīṣa of the great family,

original: zhes pa 'dir rigs drug gtsor gzung ngo //
analyzed: zhes pa 'dir rigs drug gtsor gzung ngo //
translated: Here the six families are taken as primary.

original: de ltar le'u gsum pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: de ltar le'u gsum pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: Thus ends the explanation of the third chapter.

original: // / @196a * //  da ni sgyu 'phrul dra bas mngon par byang chub pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / @196a * //  da ni sgyu 'phrul dra bas mngon par byang chub pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the manifest enlightenment by the web of illusions should be explained.

original: tshig gi bdag pos tshigs su bcad //
analyzed: tshig gi bdag pos tshigs su bcad //
translated: The lord of words spoke in verse,

original: gsang sngags rgyal po drug ldan zhing //
analyzed: gsang sngags rgyal po drug ldan zhing //
translated: Endowed with the six kings of mantra,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gang gis gsung pa gang gsung pa de'i ngo bo dang dbyangs yig dang mtshams sbyar ba'i dod dang sngags kyi rgyal po drug rnams kyis gsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gang gis gsung pa gang gsung pa de'i ngo bo dang dbyangs yig dang mtshams sbyar ba'i dod dang sngags kyi rgyal po drug rnams kyis gsal bar bya'o //
translated: and so forth. By whom was it spoken? What was spoken? Its essence, the vowels, the substitutes for the conjunctions, and the six kings of mantra should be clarified.

original: de la tshig gi bdag po ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: de la tshig gi bdag po ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: Therein, the lord of words is the Tathāgata.

original: tshigs su bcad ces pa tsheg par bdun par 'chad pa dang // rigs mang yang drug tu nges par tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad ces pa tsheg par bdun par 'chad pa dang // rigs mang yang drug tu nges par tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: Spoken in verse is explained as having seven feet, and although there are many types, it is a verse that is definitely six feet.

original: de ni gang gis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de ni gang gis bsdus pa'o //
translated: That is what it is composed of.

original: gang gsung na /
analyzed: gang gsung na /
translated: What was spoken?

original: gsang sngags rgyal po drug ldan zhing //
analyzed: gsang sngags rgyal po drug ldan zhing //
translated: Endowed with the six kings of mantra,🔽and so forth.

original: zhes pa gsang sngags ni brjod bya'i don te //
analyzed: zhes pa gsang sngags ni brjod bya'i don te //
translated: The secret mantra is the meaning to be expressed.

original: phyi ru ni 'jig rten khams so //
analyzed: phyi ru ni 'jig rten khams so //
translated: Externally, it is the world systems.

original: nang du ni mi'i lus so //
analyzed: nang du ni mi'i lus so //
translated: Internally, it is the human body.

original: gzhan ni lam dang 'bras bu'i tshul du'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni lam dang 'bras bu'i tshul du'o //
translated: The other is in the manner of the path and result.

original: rgyal po drug ldan zhing zhes pa phyir 'byung ba lnga ye shes kyi khams dang drug las snod kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dang bcud rigs drug gi sems can no //
analyzed: rgyal po drug ldan zhing zhes pa phyir 'byung ba lnga ye shes kyi khams dang drug las snod kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dang bcud rigs drug gi sems can no //
translated: The field endowed with the six kings is the world system of the elements, which is the world system of the environment and the world system of the inhabitants, the six kinds of beings.

original: nang du ni mi'i lus kho na ste phung po drug dang khams drug dang // dbang po drug dang / yul drug dang / las kyi dbang po drug dang / las kyi dbang po'i yul drug dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: nang du ni mi'i lus kho na ste phung po drug dang khams drug dang // dbang po drug dang / yul drug dang / las kyi dbang po drug dang / las kyi dbang po'i yul drug dang ldan pas so //
translated: Internally, it is the human body alone, endowed with the six aggregates, the six elements, the six sense organs, the six sense objects, the six organs of action, and the six objects of the organs of action.

original: gzhan lam dang 'bras bu la ni spang bya nyon mongs pa lnga /
analyzed: gzhan lam dang 'bras bu la ni spang bya nyon mongs pa lnga /
translated: The other is in the manner of the path and result.

original: cha mnyam pa gcig dang drug / de'i gnyen po dkyil 'khor drug dbyibs lha drug dang gsang sngags rlung dang / chos steng dang / 'og gi rtsa drug dang / 'khor lo drug dang / khams drug dang / de bzhin sbyor ba'i yan lag drug go //
analyzed: cha mnyam pa gcig dang drug / de'i gnyen po dkyil 'khor drug dbyibs lha drug dang gsang sngags rlung dang / chos steng dang / 'og gi rtsa drug dang / 'khor lo drug dang / khams drug dang / de bzhin sbyor ba'i yan lag drug go //
translated: The six are the same as the six wheels, the six deities, the six secret mantras, the six winds, the six upper and lower channels, the six cakras, the six elements, and the six branches of union.

original: 'bras bu ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rgyal ba rigs drug tu nges par byas pa'o /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rgyal ba rigs drug tu nges par byas pa'o /
translated: The result is the enjoyment body, definitely the six families of victors.

original: de ni de rnams kyi ngo bor brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni de rnams kyi ngo bor brjod par bya ste /
translated: That is to be expressed as their essence.🔽The nondual occurrence,

original: gnyis su med par 'byung ba dang // mi skye chos can 'di gsungs pa //
analyzed: gnyis su med par 'byung ba dang // mi skye chos can 'di gsungs pa //
translated: and the nonarising phenomena, are taught.

original: zhes pa rgyu dang rkyen med pa dang // skye ba dang skye ba med pa gnyis ka med par rang byung ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa rgyu dang rkyen med pa dang // skye ba dang skye ba med pa gnyis ka med par rang byung ba ste /
translated: Without causes and conditions, both arising and nonarising do not exist, and they are self-originated.

original: sems can rnams la bag chags kyi stobs kyis so ;
analyzed: sems can rnams la bag chags kyi stobs kyis so ;
translated: They exist in sentient beings by the power of traces.

original: / lam la gnas pa ni de'i lam mo //
analyzed: / lam la gnas pa ni de'i lam mo //
translated: The path is the path of that.

original: 'bras bu la gnas pa rnams 'bras bu'i tshul du'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu la gnas pa rnams 'bras bu'i tshul du'o //
translated: Those abiding in the result are the manner of the result.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān said:

original: sgyu ma chen po grags chen mo //
analyzed: sgyu ma chen po grags chen mo //
translated: The Great Illusion, the Great Fame,

original: 'byung ba me rnams sdud byed ma //
analyzed: 'byung ba me rnams sdud byed ma //
translated: The One Who Absorbs the Fire Elements,🔽The One Who Acts by Oneself, the One Who Liberates by Oneself,

original: rang nyid byed cing rang nyid 'phrog / rang nyid rgyal po rang nyid @196b gtso ;
analyzed: rang nyid byed cing rang nyid 'phrog / rang nyid rgyal po rang nyid @196b gtso ;
translated: The King by Oneself, the Chief by Oneself.

original: / zhes bya ba ste don dam par brdzun pa nyid de //
analyzed: / zhes bya ba ste don dam par brdzun pa nyid de //
translated: This is said in the sense of ultimate truth, which is false.

original: byed pa po med pas na 'byung ba dang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byed pa po med pas na 'byung ba dang zhes bya'o //
translated: Since there is no agent, it is said to be the elements.

original: mi skye chos can 'di gsungs pa //
analyzed: mi skye chos can 'di gsungs pa //
translated: This is said to be the unborn nature.

original: zhes pa 'og tu 'byung ba'i aa rnams so //
analyzed: zhes pa 'og tu 'byung ba'i aa rnams so //
translated: The following are the vowels.

original: dbyangs yig rnams bstan pa ni /🔽aa a'a / ai a'i /
analyzed: dbyangs yig rnams bstan pa ni / aa a'a / ai a'i /
translated: The vowels are taught as:🔽a ā, i ī,🔽u ū, e ai,

original: au a'u / ae aee /🔽ao aoo / aam aa: zhes pa gong du /
analyzed: au a'u / ae aee / ao aoo / aam aa: zhes pa gong du /
translated: o au, aṃ aḥ.

original: don zab don ni rgya che zhing //
analyzed: don zab don ni rgya che zhing //
translated: The profound meaning and the vast meaning,

original: zhes pa zhus lan gyi tshigs su bcad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa zhus lan gyi tshigs su bcad pa ste /
translated: This is the verse of the question and answer.

original: aa ni brda'i rang bzhin te gnyis so //
analyzed: aa ni brda'i rang bzhin te gnyis so //
translated: A is the nature of the symbol, which is twofold.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi brda dang ngag gis brjod pa'i brda'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi brda dang ngag gis brjod pa'i brda'o //
translated: The symbol of suchness and the symbol of verbal expression.

original: aa des spros pa dang grags pa dang bral ba'i chos nyid ma bcos pa mi 'gyur pa'i ya shes su go bas zab pa'i lam bstan pa'o //
analyzed: aa des spros pa dang grags pa dang bral ba'i chos nyid ma bcos pa mi 'gyur pa'i ya shes su go bas zab pa'i lam bstan pa'o //
translated: The letter A indicates the profound path, since it is understood as the pristine awareness of the unfabricated, unchanging reality free from elaboration and renown.

original: de yang 'og na /
analyzed: de yang 'og na /
translated: And that is stated below:🔽The self without beginning, free from elaboration,

original: thog ma med pa spros med bdag / de bzhin nyid bdag dag pa'i bdag / ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: thog ma med pa spros med bdag / de bzhin nyid bdag dag pa'i bdag / ces 'byung ngo //
translated: The self of suchness, the self of purity.

original: ngag tu brjod pa'i brda ni mchu dang rkan la sogs pa'i sgra la brten nas don mtshon pa ste rgya che ba'i lan no //
analyzed: ngag tu brjod pa'i brda ni mchu dang rkan la sogs pa'i sgra la brten nas don mtshon pa ste rgya che ba'i lan no //
translated: The conventional symbol of verbal expression is the indication of meaning based on the sounds of lips, palate, and so on, which is the extensive reply.

original: de yang yi ge 'di rnams kyis theg pa thun mong pa gsung dang khyad par pa'i theg pa'i gsang sngags rnams su gnas te /
analyzed: de yang yi ge 'di rnams kyis theg pa thun mong pa gsung dang khyad par pa'i theg pa'i gsang sngags rnams su gnas te /
translated: And those letters are present in the common vehicles of speech and in the secret mantra of the special vehicle.🔽Below it says:

original: 'og nas / theg pa gsum gyi nges 'byung la //
analyzed: 'og nas / theg pa gsum gyi nges 'byung la //
translated: The renunciation of the three vehicles

original: theg pa gcig gis 'bras bur gnas //
analyzed: theg pa gcig gis 'bras bur gnas //
translated: Resides in the result of the single vehicle.

original: zhes pa'o // theg pa gsum gyi don mi shes pa ni byang chub mi thob pas nyan thos kyi theg pa mi dge ba las ldog pa dang // 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la chags pa'i dbang gis longs spyod pa las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // theg pa gsum gyi don mi shes pa ni byang chub mi thob pas nyan thos kyi theg pa mi dge ba las ldog pa dang // 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la chags pa'i dbang gis longs spyod pa las ldog pa'o //
translated: Therefore, one turns away from the unwholesome of the vehicle of the disciples and from the enjoyment of the five sense objects under the influence of attachment.

original: de med na byang chub med pas na dang po la nyan thos ni phyi rol na rdul phra mo rdzas su grub par 'dod la /
analyzed: de med na byang chub med pas na dang po la nyan thos ni phyi rol na rdul phra mo rdzas su grub par 'dod la /
translated: Since there is no enlightenment without them, first, the disciples assert that external particles are substantially established.

original: nang du gang zag gi bdag med pa'i chos bdag rtag pa dang / mi rtag par khas len par khur khur ba yod par 'dod pas na /
analyzed: nang du gang zag gi bdag med pa'i chos bdag rtag pa dang / mi rtag par khas len par khur khur ba yod par 'dod pas na /
translated: Internally, they assert the burden of accepting the self of persons and the self of phenomena as permanent or impermanent.

original: rdul phra rab 'dus pa las snod dang bcud kyi 'jig rten 'byung ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: rdul phra rab 'dus pa las snod dang bcud kyi 'jig rten 'byung ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the world of the environment and its inhabitants arises from the aggregation of subtle particles.

original: aa a'a dang po nam mkha' stong bar ro //
analyzed: aa a'a dang po nam mkha' stong bar ro //
translated: The first a ā is the empty space.

original: ai a'i ni rlung gi rdul phra mo 'dus pa las rlung gi dkyil 'khor rgya chen po'o //
analyzed: ai a'i ni rlung gi rdul phra mo 'dus pa las rlung gi dkyil 'khor rgya chen po'o //
translated: The i ī is the great maṇḍala of wind from the aggregation of subtle particles of wind.

original: ae aee ni me'i rdul phra mo 'dus pa las me'i khor yug go //
analyzed: ae aee ni me'i rdul phra mo 'dus pa las me'i khor yug go //
translated: The e ai is the ring of fire from the aggregation of subtle particles of fire.

original: de'i steng du ao aoo las sa'i rdul phra rab 'dus pa las sa'i khor yug go //
analyzed: de'i steng du ao aoo las sa'i rdul phra rab 'dus pa las sa'i khor yug go //
translated: On top of that, from O and O, the particles of earth gather, and from that the outer ring of earth.

original: de'i dbus su aam aa: ni ye shes kyi khams ri rab dang ri gzhan rnams so //
analyzed: de'i dbus su aam aa: ni ye shes kyi khams ri rab dang ri gzhan rnams so //
translated: In the middle of that, from A and A, the realm of wisdom is Mount Meru and the other mountains.

original: de nas sthi to ni gnas de na /
analyzed: de nas sthi to ni gnas de na /
translated: Then, sthito means “abiding” in that place.

original: hri di ni snying po ste bcud sems can no /
analyzed: hri di ni snying po ste bcud sems can no /
translated: Hridi means “in the heart,” the essence, the sentient beings.

original: dzny'a na m'u rti ni gdod nas ye shes can no //
analyzed: dzny'a na m'u rti ni gdod nas ye shes can no //
translated: Jnanamurti is the primordial wisdom being.

original: de su'i yin na ra ham ni nga'i yin pa'o //🔽buddho @197a * //
analyzed: de su'i yin na ra ham ni nga'i yin pa'o // buddho @197a * //
translated: Whose? Raham is “mine.”🔽Buddho.

original: buddh'a n'am ni sangs rgyas kyi snying po can /
analyzed: buddh'a n'am ni sangs rgyas kyi snying po can /
translated: Buddhanam is “endowed with the essence of buddhahood.”

original: trya dhva brti n'am ni dus gsum du bde bar gshegs pa'i snying po dang ma bral bar gnas so //
analyzed: trya dhva brti n'am ni dus gsum du bde bar gshegs pa'i snying po dang ma bral bar gnas so //
translated: Tryadhvabharti means “abiding without being separate from the essence of the sugatas of the three times.”

original: badzra t'i kshna la sogs pa'i sngags drug ni rigs drug gi sems can no //
analyzed: badzra t'i kshna la sogs pa'i sngags drug ni rigs drug gi sems can no //
translated: The six mantras beginning with vajra-tiksna are the sentient beings of the six realms.

original: yang dbyangs yig bcu gnyis ni dum bu bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: yang dbyangs yig bcu gnyis ni dum bu bcu gnyis so //
translated: Again, the twelve vowels are the twelve sections.

original: gnam la yang khyim bcu gnyis te //
analyzed: gnam la yang khyim bcu gnyis te //
translated: In the sky, there are twelve houses.

original: nyi zla dang gza' skar gyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: nyi zla dang gza' skar gyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: It is adorned with the sun, moon, planets, and stars.

original: der yang zab pa'i don cir yang ma grub pa las rgya che ba cir yang snang du rung bar shar ba don dam par na rdo rje 'chang gi sku'o //
analyzed: der yang zab pa'i don cir yang ma grub pa las rgya che ba cir yang snang du rung bar shar ba don dam par na rdo rje 'chang gi sku'o //
translated: That is the kāya of Vajradhara in the ultimate sense.

original: de yang dus 'khor las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang dus 'khor las gsungs pa /
translated: That is also stated in the Kālacakra Tantra:

original: dus las stong pa las ni rlung dang me dang chu dang sa dang gling dang rgya mtsho dang // rgyu skar zla ba nyi ma skar ma'i tshogs dang drang srong rnams dang 'byung po klu rnams dang // byol song skye gnas rnam bzhi sna tshogs sa yi steng na mi rnams dang ni dmyal ba rnams //
analyzed: dus las stong pa las ni rlung dang me dang chu dang sa dang gling dang rgya mtsho dang // rgyu skar zla ba nyi ma skar ma'i tshogs dang drang srong rnams dang 'byung po klu rnams dang // byol song skye gnas rnam bzhi sna tshogs sa yi steng na mi rnams dang ni dmyal ba rnams //
translated: From the emptiness of time, the wind, fire, water, and earth, the continents and oceans, the lunar mansions, moon, sun, and hosts of stars, the sages, bhūtas, and nāgas, the four types of animal birth, and humans and hell beings on the surface of the earth

original: stong pa'i dbus nas yang dag 'byung ba chu las lan tshva bzhin du sgo nga'i nang nas skyes pa rnams ;
analyzed: stong pa'i dbus nas yang dag 'byung ba chu las lan tshva bzhin du sgo nga'i nang nas skyes pa rnams ;
translated: arise from the center of emptiness, like salt from water, born from the interior of the egg.

original: / sku dang ye shes nam mkha' nges par rlung me chu sa rnams te brtan pa rnams dang g-yo ba dang // mthong ba med par skyes pa'i lha ste rnam pa bcu po sa yi steng du rdo rje'i skur gsungs pa /
analyzed: / sku dang ye shes nam mkha' nges par rlung me chu sa rnams te brtan pa rnams dang g-yo ba dang // mthong ba med par skyes pa'i lha ste rnam pa bcu po sa yi steng du rdo rje'i skur gsungs pa /
translated: Body, gnosis, space, wind, fire, water, earth, the stable, the moving, and the gods who are born without seeing—these ten aspects are said to be the vajra body on the face of the earth.

original: sngags kyi skye gnas las ni skye bar 'gyur pa mi yi bdag po slar yang 'di dag 'jig par 'gyur //
analyzed: sngags kyi skye gnas las ni skye bar 'gyur pa mi yi bdag po slar yang 'di dag 'jig par 'gyur //
translated: Born from the womb of mantra, O lord of men, they will perish again.

original: de ltar gang gis yang dag kun du rtogs pas grol zhing phyugs kyi sems su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gang gis yang dag kun du rtogs pas grol zhing phyugs kyi sems su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one who realizes this completely will be liberated and will not become an animal.

original: zhes pas gsal lo //
analyzed: zhes pas gsal lo //
translated: This is clear.

original: de nas rang rgyal ba'i theg pa ni slob dpon mi 'dod pas sangs rgyas med pa'i zhing du smon lam btab nas /
analyzed: de nas rang rgyal ba'i theg pa ni slob dpon mi 'dod pas sangs rgyas med pa'i zhing du smon lam btab nas /
translated: Next, the pratyekabuddha vehicle: Without a teacher, one makes a prayer to be born in a buddha-less realm.

original: der skyes pa dang dur khrod du phyin nas rol brtags pas /
analyzed: der skyes pa dang dur khrod du phyin nas rol brtags pas /
translated: After being born there, one goes to a charnel ground and examines a corpse.

original: skye ba las byung de srid pa las byung /
analyzed: skye ba las byung de srid pa las byung /
translated: It is born from birth, and that is born from existence.

original: de yang de bzhin du gong ma gong ma las byung bas /
analyzed: de yang de bzhin du gong ma gong ma las byung bas /
translated: That also is born from the preceding, and so on.

original: ma rig pa las byung bar shes pas rten 'brel lugs 'byung dang lugs las bzlog pas sangs rgyas thob pas na dbyangs bcu gnyis ni rten 'brel bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: ma rig pa las byung bar shes pas rten 'brel lugs 'byung dang lugs las bzlog pas sangs rgyas thob pas na dbyangs bcu gnyis ni rten 'brel bcu gnyis so //
translated: Since one attains buddhahood by means of the forward and reverse sequences of dependent origination, the twelve vowels are the twelve links of dependent origination.

original: de la brten nas sangs rgyas pas bse ru lta bur gcig tu gnas pas na buddho buddh'a'o //
analyzed: de la brten nas sangs rgyas pas bse ru lta bur gcig tu gnas pas na buddho buddh'a'o //
translated: Since one becomes a buddha in dependence on that, one abides alone like a rhinoceros, and therefore there is buddho buddhā.

original: sngags drug ni ne tso ltar khyu lding ba'o //
analyzed: sngags drug ni ne tso ltar khyu lding ba'o //
translated: The six mantras are like a flock of parrots.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa ni dang po sems bskyed nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la longs spyod pas sa bcu gnyis rim gyis bgrod nas sangs rgyas pa'i don mtshon te @197b dbyangs bcu gnyis sa bcu gnyis te aa sbyor ba'i lam /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa ni dang po sems bskyed nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la longs spyod pas sa bcu gnyis rim gyis bgrod nas sangs rgyas pa'i don mtshon te @197b dbyangs bcu gnyis sa bcu gnyis te aa sbyor ba'i lam /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva vehicle is indicated by the twelve vowels, the twelve stages, from first generating bodhicitta, enjoying the six perfections, and gradually traversing the twelve stages to buddhahood.

original: a'a ring po tshogs kyi lam /
analyzed: a'a ring po tshogs kyi lam /
translated: The long ā is the path of accumulation.

original: ai mthong ba'i lam sa dang po'o //
analyzed: ai mthong ba'i lam sa dang po'o //
translated: The i is the path of seeing, the first stage.

original: de nas rim gyis bgrod nas sa bcu 'das nas gnas 'og min du sangs rgyas pa'i buddho buddh'a'o //
analyzed: de nas rim gyis bgrod nas sa bcu 'das nas gnas 'og min du sangs rgyas pa'i buddho buddh'a'o //
translated: Having traversed those stages, after passing through the ten stages, one becomes a buddha in Akaniṣṭha, and therefore there is buddho buddhā.

original: sngags drug ni pha rol tu phyin pa mthar phyin pa'i sku dang ye shes so /
analyzed: sngags drug ni pha rol tu phyin pa mthar phyin pa'i sku dang ye shes so /
translated: The six seed syllables are the bodies and pristine awarenesses of the perfection of the transcendent state.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba sngags kyi lam 'bras bu dang sbyor bas /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba sngags kyi lam 'bras bu dang sbyor bas /
translated: The other is the path of mantra, which is connected with the result.

original: dang po sbyar bya glo bur gyi dri ma drug ni /🔽aa a'a ni nam mkha'i khams zhe sdang ngo /
analyzed: dang po sbyar bya glo bur gyi dri ma drug ni / aa a'a ni nam mkha'i khams zhe sdang ngo /
translated: The first is the six stains to be purified.🔽A ā are the space element and anger.

original: ai a'i ni rlung gi khams phrag dog go //
analyzed: ai a'i ni rlung gi khams phrag dog go //
translated: I ī are the wind element and jealousy.

original: au a'u ni chu'i khams 'dod chags so //
analyzed: au a'u ni chu'i khams 'dod chags so //
translated: U ū are the water element and desire.

original: ae aee ni lus rlung yin dang bsam pa me'i khams nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: ae aee ni lus rlung yin dang bsam pa me'i khams nga rgyal lo //
translated: E ai are the wind element of the body and the fire element of the thoughts and pride.

original: ao aoo ni lus chu yin dang bsam pa sa'i khams gti mug go //
analyzed: ao aoo ni lus chu yin dang bsam pa sa'i khams gti mug go //
translated: O au are the water element of the body and the earth element of the thoughts and ignorance.

original: aam aa: ni ye shes kyi khams nyon mongs pa cha mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: aam aa: ni ye shes kyi khams nyon mongs pa cha mnyam pa'o //
translated: Aṃ aḥ are the element of pristine consciousness and the afflictions in equal measure.

original: de nyid gnyen por dkyil 'khor drug ni /🔽aa a'a ni me long lta bu ye shes mi bskyod pa'i lha'i dkyil 'khor ro /
analyzed: de nyid gnyen por dkyil 'khor drug ni / aa a'a ni me long lta bu ye shes mi bskyod pa'i lha'i dkyil 'khor ro /
translated: The six maṇḍalas are the antidotes to those.🔽A ā is the maṇḍala of Akṣobhya and the mirror-like pristine consciousness.

original: ai a'i ni bya ba grub pa'i ye shes don yod grub pa'i lha dang dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: ai a'i ni bya ba grub pa'i ye shes don yod grub pa'i lha dang dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: I ī is the maṇḍala and deity of Amoghasiddhi and the pristine consciousness of successful activities.

original: au a'u ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes snang ba mtha' yas kyi lha dang dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: au a'u ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes snang ba mtha' yas kyi lha dang dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: AU is the wisdom of discernment, the deity and mandala of Amitābha.

original: ae aee ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes rin chen 'byung ldan gyi lha dang dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: ae aee ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes rin chen 'byung ldan gyi lha dang dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: AI is the wisdom of equality, the deity and mandala of Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: ao aoo ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i ye shes rnam par snang mdzad kyi lha dang dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: ao aoo ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i ye shes rnam par snang mdzad kyi lha dang dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: AU is the wisdom of the pure sphere of reality, the deity and mandala of Vairocana.

original: aam aa: ni ye shes lnga'i ngo bo nyid rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor dang rdo rje 'chang gi sku'o //
analyzed: aam aa: ni ye shes lnga'i ngo bo nyid rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor dang rdo rje 'chang gi sku'o //
translated: AḤ is the nature of the five wisdoms, the realm of Vajradhātu and the body of Vajradhara.

original: sthi to hri di ni lha rnams kyi thugs ka'o //
analyzed: sthi to hri di ni lha rnams kyi thugs ka'o //
translated: Sthito hṛdi is the heart of the deities.

original: dzny'a na m'u rti ni ye shes pa'o //
analyzed: dzny'a na m'u rti ni ye shes pa'o //
translated: Jñānamūrti is the wisdom being.

original: ra ham nga'o //
analyzed: ra ham nga'o //
translated: Raham is “I.”

original: buddho buddh'a n'am ni sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: buddho buddh'a n'am ni sangs rgyas so //
translated: Budho buddhānām is “the Buddha.”

original: trya dhva brti n'am ni dus gsum sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: trya dhva brti n'am ni dus gsum sangs rgyas so //
translated: Tryadhva-vartināṃ is “the Buddhas of the three times.”

original: badzra t'i kshna ni snang ba mtha' yas thugs kar rdo rje rnon po /
analyzed: badzra t'i kshna ni snang ba mtha' yas thugs kar rdo rje rnon po /
translated: Vajra-tīkṣṇa is Vajra-sharp at the heart of Amitābha.

original: du: khatstshe da ni mi bskyod pa'i thugs kar sdug bsngal kun gcod do //
analyzed: du: khatstshe da ni mi bskyod pa'i thugs kar sdug bsngal kun gcod do //
translated: Duḥkha-ccheda is “the cutter of all suffering” at the heart of Akṣobhya.

original: pradzny'a dzny'a na ni rnam snang gi thugs kar shes rab ye shes so //
analyzed: pradzny'a dzny'a na ni rnam snang gi thugs kar shes rab ye shes so //
translated: Prajñājñāna is the wisdom of discernment at the heart of Vairocana.

original: dzny'a na k'a ya ni don yod grub pa'i thugs kar ye shes kyi sku can no //
analyzed: dzny'a na k'a ya ni don yod grub pa'i thugs kar ye shes kyi sku can no //
translated: Jñānakāya is the one who has the body of wisdom at the heart of Amoghasiddhi.

original: p'a g'i shva ri ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi thugs kar ngag gi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: p'a g'i shva ri ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi thugs kar ngag gi dbang phyug go //
translated: Pāragaśrī is the lord of speech at the heart of Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: aa ra pa tsa na zhes pa rdo rje sems dpa'i thugs kar ye shes bsdus pa bsgom mo //
analyzed: aa ra pa tsa na zhes pa rdo rje sems dpa'i thugs kar ye shes bsdus pa bsgom mo //
translated: Arpaṇa is the collected wisdom at the heart of Vajrasattva.

original: sngags 'di rnams brda yin pas don rnams mtshon //
analyzed: sngags 'di rnams brda yin pas don rnams mtshon //
translated: Since these mantras are symbolic, they represent the meanings.

original: sa bon yin pas lha rnams bskyed /
analyzed: sa bon yin pas lha rnams bskyed /
translated: Since they are seeds, they generate the deities.

original: srog bskul ba yin pas snying po zlos /
analyzed: srog bskul ba yin pas snying po zlos /
translated: Since they are life-force incantations, they are the essence mantras.

original: bsgom bya yin pas @198a * //
analyzed: bsgom bya yin pas @198a * //
translated: Since they are the objects of meditation,

original: thugs kar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: thugs kar gnas pa'o //
translated: they abide at the heart.

original: de'i dbyibs kyi rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: de'i dbyibs kyi rnal 'byor ro //
translated: That is the yoga of their shapes.

original: da ni sngags kyi rnal 'byor la /
analyzed: da ni sngags kyi rnal 'byor la /
translated: Now, in the mantra yoga,

original: lte ba'i 'khor lo la khyim bcu gnyis nas 'pho ba bcu gnyis su nyin mtshan bcu gnyis phrugs gcig la rgyu //
analyzed: lte ba'i 'khor lo la khyim bcu gnyis nas 'pho ba bcu gnyis su nyin mtshan bcu gnyis phrugs gcig la rgyu //
translated: the twelve transits occur in a single day-and-night cycle of twelve parts in the twelve houses of the navel cakra.

original: grangs nyi khri tshig stong drug brgya rgyu /
analyzed: grangs nyi khri tshig stong drug brgya rgyu /
translated: The number is twenty-four thousand.

original: dbyu gu drug cu tham pa'o //
analyzed: dbyu gu drug cu tham pa'o //
translated: There are sixty moments.

original: de la aa ni rtsa g-yas nas nam mkha'i rlung stong brgyad brgya rgyu /🔽a'a ni rtsa g-yon nas nam mkha'i rlung stong brgyad brgya rgyu /
analyzed: de la aa ni rtsa g-yas nas nam mkha'i rlung stong brgyad brgya rgyu / a'a ni rtsa g-yon nas nam mkha'i rlung stong brgyad brgya rgyu /
translated: In this regard, a is the movement of the wind of space in the right channel, in units of one thousand and eight.🔽Ā is the movement of the wind of space in the left channel, in units of one thousand and eight.

original: ai a'i ni rtsa g-yas dang g-yon nas rlung gi rlung stong brgyad brgya brgyad brgya rgyu //
analyzed: ai a'i ni rtsa g-yas dang g-yon nas rlung gi rlung stong brgyad brgya brgyad brgya rgyu //
translated: I and i are the movement of the wind of wind in the right and left channels, in units of one thousand and eight.

original: au a'u ni rtsa g-yas dang g-yon nas chu'i rlung stong brgyad brgya brgyad brgya rgyu'o //
analyzed: au a'u ni rtsa g-yas dang g-yon nas chu'i rlung stong brgyad brgya brgyad brgya rgyu'o //
translated: U and ū are the movement of the wind of water in the right and left channels, in units of one thousand and eight.

original: ae aee ni rtsa g-yas dang g-yon nas me'i rlung stong brgyad brgya brgyad brgya rgyu'o //
analyzed: ae aee ni rtsa g-yas dang g-yon nas me'i rlung stong brgyad brgya brgyad brgya rgyu'o //
translated: E and ai are the movement of the wind of fire in the right and left channels, in units of one thousand and eight.

original: ao aoo ni rtsa g-yas dang g-yon nas sa'i rlung stong brgyad brgya brgyad brgya rgyu'o //
analyzed: ao aoo ni rtsa g-yas dang g-yon nas sa'i rlung stong brgyad brgya brgyad brgya rgyu'o //
translated: O and au are the movement of the wind of earth in the right and left channels, in units of one thousand and eight.

original: aom aa: ni rtsa g-yas dang g-yon nas gong gi grangs rnams kyi kha nas 'pho ba'i bar du lnga bcu rtsa drug dang rkang pa re re ye shes kyi rlung rgyu bas /
analyzed: aom aa: ni rtsa g-yas dang g-yon nas gong gi grangs rnams kyi kha nas 'pho ba'i bar du lnga bcu rtsa drug dang rkang pa re re ye shes kyi rlung rgyu bas /
translated: Oṃ and aḥ are the movement of the wisdom wind in the right and left channels, in units of fifty-six, with one unit added to each leg.

original: spyir bsdams pas drug brgya dang bdun cu rtsa lnga ni nyin zhag gcig pa'o //
analyzed: spyir bsdams pas drug brgya dang bdun cu rtsa lnga ni nyin zhag gcig pa'o //
translated: In general, the total of six hundred and seventy-five is one day and night.

original: sthi to ni gnas yin pas rtsa dbus mar ro //
analyzed: sthi to ni gnas yin pas rtsa dbus mar ro //
translated: Sthita means “abiding,” so it is in the central channel.

original: hri di ni snying po yin pas dbu ma'i gzugs so //
analyzed: hri di ni snying po yin pas dbu ma'i gzugs so //
translated: Hridi means “essence,” so it is the form of the central channel.

original: dzny'a na m'u rti ni des ye shes skye bas buddho buddh'a n'am sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: dzny'a na m'u rti ni des ye shes skye bas buddho buddh'a n'am sangs rgyas so //
translated: Jnanamurti means “arising of gnosis,” so it is the buddhas.

original: trya dhva brti n'am ni rtsa dbus mar sdom pa'o //
analyzed: trya dhva brti n'am ni rtsa dbus mar sdom pa'o //
translated: Tryadhavatimanam means “binding in the three channels.”

original: de 'khor lo drug na gnas pas sngags te ye shes sems dpa' drug go //
analyzed: de 'khor lo drug na gnas pas sngags te ye shes sems dpa' drug go //
translated: Since that abides in the six cakras, it is the mantra, the six gnosis beings.

original: da ni chos kyi rnal 'byor la 'khor lo drug ni /
analyzed: da ni chos kyi rnal 'byor la 'khor lo drug ni /
translated: Now, in the yoga of phenomena, the six cakras are as follows:

original: aa a'a ni spyi bor nam mkha'i 'khor lo /
analyzed: aa a'a ni spyi bor nam mkha'i 'khor lo /
translated: A and ah are the space cakra in the head.

original: au a'u ni dpral ba chu'i 'khor lo /
analyzed: au a'u ni dpral ba chu'i 'khor lo /
translated: U and uh are the water cakra in the forehead.

original: ae aee ni mgrin pa me'i 'khor lo /🔽ai a'i ni snying ga rlung gi 'khor lo //
analyzed: ae aee ni mgrin pa me'i 'khor lo / ai a'i ni snying ga rlung gi 'khor lo //
translated: E and ai are the fire cakra in the throat.🔽O and au are the air cakra in the heart.

original: ao aoo ni lte ba sa'i 'khor lo //
analyzed: ao aoo ni lte ba sa'i 'khor lo //
translated: Om and ah are the earth cakra in the navel.

original: aam aa: ni gsang gnas ye shes kyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: aam aa: ni gsang gnas ye shes kyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: Am and ha are the gnosis cakra in the secret place.

original: de la steng 'og gi rtsa drug ni aam aa: steng gi rtsa dbus ma'o //
analyzed: de la steng 'og gi rtsa drug ni aam aa: steng gi rtsa dbus ma'o //
translated: Among them, the six upper and lower nāḍīs are a aḥ.

original: ae aee g-yas kyi rtsa ro ma'o //
analyzed: ae aee g-yas kyi rtsa ro ma'o //
translated: The central nāḍī above is a aḥ.🔽The rasanā to the right is e ai.

original: ai a'i ni g-yon gyi rtsa brkyang ma'o //
analyzed: ai a'i ni g-yon gyi rtsa brkyang ma'o //
translated: The lalanā to the left is i ī.

original: 'og gi gsum la ao aoo ni g-yas bshad pa 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: 'og gi gsum la ao aoo ni g-yas bshad pa 'bab pa'o //
translated: The three below are o au.

original: au a'u ni g-yon dri chu 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: au a'u ni g-yon dri chu 'bab pa'o //
translated: The lalanā to the left is u ū.

original: aam aa: ni dbus dung can ma byang chub kyi sems 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: aam aa: ni dbus dung can ma byang chub kyi sems 'bab pa'o //
translated: The central nāḍī, the “white conch,” is a aḥ.

original: khams drug ni sa dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang / ye shes kyi lam rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis nas 'bab pa /
analyzed: khams drug ni sa dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang / ye shes kyi lam rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis nas 'bab pa /
translated: The six elements are earth, fire, air, space, water, and gnosis.

original: 'khor lo drug @198b tu 'dzin pa ni sangs rgyas yin te ye shes sems dpa' drug go //
analyzed: 'khor lo drug @198b tu 'dzin pa ni sangs rgyas yin te ye shes sems dpa' drug go //
translated: The one who holds the six cakras is the buddha, the six gnosis sattvas.

original: de bzhin nyid sbyor ba'i yan lag drug tu sbyar nas /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid sbyor ba'i yan lag drug tu sbyar nas /
translated: Having applied the six branches of union to reality,

original: aam aa: ni so sor bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: aam aa: ni so sor bsdus pa'o //
translated: a aḥ is the branch of total withdrawal.

original: aa a'a ni bsam gtan no //
analyzed: aa a'a ni bsam gtan no //
translated: A ā is concentration.

original: ai a'i ni srog rtsol lo //🔽ae aee ni 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ai a'i ni srog rtsol lo // ae aee ni 'dzin pa'o //
translated: I ī is vitality and exertion.🔽E ai is retention.

original: au a'u ni rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: au a'u ni rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: O au is recollection.

original: ao aoo ni ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: ao aoo ni ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: AUM is meditative concentration.

original: de las 'bras bu 'byung ba ni nam mkha' chos kyi 'byung gnas su thugs rdo rje rab tu bzhag nas /
analyzed: de las 'bras bu 'byung ba ni nam mkha' chos kyi 'byung gnas su thugs rdo rje rab tu bzhag nas /
translated: From that, the result arises. Having placed the mind vajra in the sky, the source of phenomena,

original: bsnyen pas dus kyi thog mar so sor bsdus pa la sogs pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bshad pas /
analyzed: bsnyen pas dus kyi thog mar so sor bsdus pa la sogs pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bshad pas /
translated: one should cultivate the withdrawal, etc., at the beginning of the time of approach.

original: des sa bcu gnyis pa rim gyis bgrod pa'i brdar dbyangs yig bcu gnyis sngar bshad do //
analyzed: des sa bcu gnyis pa rim gyis bgrod pa'i brdar dbyangs yig bcu gnyis sngar bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the twelve vowels were explained previously as the symbols for the stages of the twelve stages.

original: 'di la mtshan ma yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'di la mtshan ma yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Here, the signs are also of three kinds:

original: dang po'i mtshan ma dang / bar ma'i mtshan ma dang / tha ma'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: dang po'i mtshan ma dang / bar ma'i mtshan ma dang / tha ma'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: the sign of the beginning, the sign of the middle, and the sign of the end.

original: dang po'i mtshan ma ni du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma ste //
analyzed: dang po'i mtshan ma ni du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma ste //
translated: The sign of the beginning is the sign of smoke, etc.

original: yan lag drug gi sbyor ba las gzugs yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur pa'i skad cig ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag drug gi sbyor ba las gzugs yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur pa'i skad cig ma thob pa'o //
translated: It is the attainment of the moment when the form is not fully accomplished by the application of the six branches.

original: bar ma'i mtshan ma ni lugs las byung bas mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i skad cig la rlung brgya phrag bco brgyad 'gags pas sa dang po thob bo //
analyzed: bar ma'i mtshan ma ni lugs las byung bas mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i skad cig la rlung brgya phrag bco brgyad 'gags pas sa dang po thob bo //
translated: The sign of the middle is the attainment of the first stage by the reversal of eighteen hundred energies in the moment of the supreme, which is in the natural order.

original: mngon par shes pa lngas ma mthong ba'i don yang dag par mthong ba 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lngas ma mthong ba'i don yang dag par mthong ba 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The attainment of mundane powers is called “seeing the meaning that was not seen by the five superknowledges.”

original: tha ma'i mtshan ma ni 'khor lo re re la sa gnyis gnyis rim gyis thob /
analyzed: tha ma'i mtshan ma ni 'khor lo re re la sa gnyis gnyis rim gyis thob /
translated: The sign of the end is the attainment of the two stages in sequence on each cakra.

original: rlung brgya phrag sum cu so drug 'gags nas sangs rgyas rdo rje 'chang nyid mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i skad cig gis sa bcu gnyis thob pa ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ces bya'o //
analyzed: rlung brgya phrag sum cu so drug 'gags nas sangs rgyas rdo rje 'chang nyid mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i skad cig gis sa bcu gnyis thob pa ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ces bya'o //
translated: The attainment of the supreme power of the great seal is called “the attainment of the stage of Vajradhara Buddha in the instant of the supreme immutable through the cessation of thirty-six hundred winds.”

original: de ltar le'u bzhi pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: de ltar le'u bzhi pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the fourth chapter.

original: // / da ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the great maṇḍala of the vajra realm will be explained.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das //
translated: Thus, the Bhagavān Buddha

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas aa las byung //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas aa las byung //
translated: arises from the perfect buddha A.🔽A is the supreme of all syllables,

original: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / don chen yi ge dam pa yin //
analyzed: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / don chen yi ge dam pa yin //
translated: the sublime syllable of great meaning.

original: zhes pa gang du dbyangs yig la dbyibs kyi rnal 'byor dang / sngags kyi rnal 'byor dang / chos kyi rnal 'byor dang / de bzhin nyid kyi rnal 'byor mdor bstan pa las 'dir ji ltar 'byung ba snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa'i 'khor rnams la 'di lta ste zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa gang du dbyangs yig la dbyibs kyi rnal 'byor dang / sngags kyi rnal 'byor dang / chos kyi rnal 'byor dang / de bzhin nyid kyi rnal 'byor mdor bstan pa las 'dir ji ltar 'byung ba snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa'i 'khor rnams la 'di lta ste zhes pa'o //
translated: Here, in the brief indication of the yoga of shape, the yoga of mantra, the yoga of Dharma, and the yoga of thatness with respect to the vowels, one should think, How is it? to the retinue that has the conception.

original: sangs rgyas zhes pa spangs pa dang thob pa gnyis yod pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes pa spangs pa dang thob pa gnyis yod pa'o //
translated: Buddha has both abandonment and attainment.

original: @199a * // 'o na sangs rgyas kyi mchog pa la bcom ldan 'das cis she na /
analyzed: @199a * // 'o na sangs rgyas kyi mchog pa la bcom ldan 'das cis she na /
translated: Well then, why is the Bhagavān the supreme buddha?

original: sangs rgyas ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la yang yod pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la yang yod pas /
translated: Since buddhahood also exists for śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: de las khyad par du bcom ldan 'das ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: de las khyad par du bcom ldan 'das ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
translated: one should know that the Bhagavān is superior to them in being omniscient.

original: yang bcom ldan 'das rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin na rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes pa zlos so snyam pa rigs lnga'i de bzhin gshegs pa las khyad par dpal rdo rje sems dpa' rdo rje 'chang kho na'o //
analyzed: yang bcom ldan 'das rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin na rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes pa zlos so snyam pa rigs lnga'i de bzhin gshegs pa las khyad par dpal rdo rje sems dpa' rdo rje 'chang kho na'o //
translated: Again, if one thinks, “If the Lord is omniscient, then the word ‘perfect buddha’ is redundant,” the Tathāgata of the five families is distinguished by the glorious Vajrasattva alone, Vajradhara.

original: de gang na aa las byung zhes pas ae'i rnam pa chos 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de gang na aa las byung zhes pas ae'i rnam pa chos 'byung ngo //
translated: That is from a, which is the source of phenomena, in the form of e.

original: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / ces pa bam yig go //
analyzed: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / ces pa bam yig go //
translated: A is the supreme of all letters, which is the syllable bam.

original: don chen yi ge dam pa yin /
analyzed: don chen yi ge dam pa yin /
translated: It is the holy letter of great meaning.

original: zhes pa aa ksha ra ste mi 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa aa ksha ra ste mi 'gyur pa'o //
translated: That is the aksara, which is unchanging.

original: de ltar yang stong phrag drug cu pa sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i tantra las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang stong phrag drug cu pa sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i tantra las gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said in the Ṣaṭkaṣaṇṭikāmāyājāla tantra:

original: sngags kyi skye gnas yi ge med //
analyzed: sngags kyi skye gnas yi ge med //
translated: The source of mantra is the letterless.

original: gsang sngags chen po rigs gsum pa //
analyzed: gsang sngags chen po rigs gsum pa //
translated: The great mantra is the three families.

original: stong pa chen po yi ge lnga //
analyzed: stong pa chen po yi ge lnga //
translated: The great emptiness is the five letters.

original: thig le stong pa yi ge drug /
analyzed: thig le stong pa yi ge drug /
translated: The empty drop is the six letters.

original: ces pa la 'di brda rnam pa gnyis te gcig ni ngag gi brda dang / gnyis pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi brda'o //
analyzed: ces pa la 'di brda rnam pa gnyis te gcig ni ngag gi brda dang / gnyis pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi brda'o //
translated: Here there are two kinds of symbols: one is the symbol of speech, and the second is the symbol of suchness.

original: sngags kyi brda ni ngag gi brjod pa ste 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi brda ni ngag gi brjod pa ste 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: The symbolic meaning of mantra is the expression of speech, which is mundane.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi brda ni don dam pa ste brjod pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi brda ni don dam pa ste brjod pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The symbolic meaning of suchness is the ultimate, which is free from expression.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sngags kyi theg pa las gsungs so ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sngags kyi theg pa las gsungs so ;
translated: The Blessed One taught this in the Mantra Vehicle.

original: / de ltar na mya ngan las 'das pa ye shes kyi khams gzhal du med cing brjod du med pa ste /
analyzed: / de ltar na mya ngan las 'das pa ye shes kyi khams gzhal du med cing brjod du med pa ste /
translated: Thus, nirvana is the immeasurable and inexpressible element of wisdom.

original: dbyangs dang gsal byed kyi mtshan nyid brjod du med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbyangs dang gsal byed kyi mtshan nyid brjod du med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “inexpressible” because it is characterized by vowels and consonants.

original: nam mkha'i khams la sogs sngags kyi brdas ni ngag gi brjod pa'i mtshan nyid mgrin pa la sogs pa nas brjod pa'i chos rnams bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams la sogs sngags kyi brdas ni ngag gi brjod pa'i mtshan nyid mgrin pa la sogs pa nas brjod pa'i chos rnams bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'o //
translated: The element of space and so forth are the symbolic meaning of mantra. The Blessed One taught that the phenomena expressed by speech and so forth are characterized by expression.

original: de la stong pa chen po yi ge lnga ni rnam par shes pa'i khams aa gri gug lta bu dbus su'o //
analyzed: de la stong pa chen po yi ge lnga ni rnam par shes pa'i khams aa gri gug lta bu dbus su'o //
translated: In that regard, the five syllables of great emptiness are the consciousness element, which is like a curved knife, in the center.

original: steng du 'du byed rlung gi khams aa dbyug pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: steng du 'du byed rlung gi khams aa dbyug pa lta bu'o //
translated: Above that is the formation element, which is like a wind flag.

original: g-yas su tshor ba me'i khams aa tsheg drag lta bu'o //
analyzed: g-yas su tshor ba me'i khams aa tsheg drag lta bu'o //
translated: To the right is the feeling element, which is like a fire stick.🔽To the left is the discrimination element, which is like a lotus.

original: g-yon du 'du shes chu'i khams las thig le lta bu'o //
analyzed: g-yon du 'du shes chu'i khams las thig le lta bu'o //
translated: On the left, the water element, which is the discernment aggregate, is like a drop.

original: 'og tu gzugs sa'i khams aa thong gshol lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'og tu gzugs sa'i khams aa thong gshol lta bu'o //
translated: Below, the earth element, which is the form aggregate, is like a plow.

original: de ltar lnga ni bam yig rdo rje sems dpa'i rang bzhin mtshon par byed pa'i brda'o //
analyzed: de ltar lnga ni bam yig rdo rje sems dpa'i rang bzhin mtshon par byed pa'i brda'o //
translated: Thus, these five are the symbols that indicate the syllable vaṃ, which is the nature of Vajrasattva.

original: sngar gyi mtshan ma lnga'i steng du rnam par shes pa la sogs pa mtshon par byed pa'i gsal byed ka'i @199b sde tshan nam mkha'i khams so //
analyzed: sngar gyi mtshan ma lnga'i steng du rnam par shes pa la sogs pa mtshon par byed pa'i gsal byed ka'i @199b sde tshan nam mkha'i khams so //
translated: Above the five signs mentioned previously, the syllable ka, which is the symbol of consciousness, and so on, is the space element.

original: shar du 'du byed la sogs pa mtshon par byed pa tsa'i sde tshan rlung gi khams so //
analyzed: shar du 'du byed la sogs pa mtshon par byed pa tsa'i sde tshan rlung gi khams so //
translated: In the east, the syllable ca, which is the symbol of formation, and so on, is the wind element.

original: lho ru tshor ba la sogs pa mtshon par byed pa ta'i sde tshan me'i khams so /
analyzed: lho ru tshor ba la sogs pa mtshon par byed pa ta'i sde tshan me'i khams so /
translated: In the south, the syllable ṭa, which is the symbol of feeling, and so on, is the fire element.

original: byang du 'du shes mtshon par byed pa'i sde tshan chu'i khams so //
analyzed: byang du 'du shes mtshon par byed pa'i sde tshan chu'i khams so //
translated: In the north, the syllable ta, which is the symbol of discernment, is the water element.

original: de'i nub tu gzugs la sogs pa mtshon par byed pa ta'i sde tshan sa'i khams so //
analyzed: de'i nub tu gzugs la sogs pa mtshon par byed pa ta'i sde tshan sa'i khams so //
translated: In the west of that, the syllable ṭa, which is the symbol of form, and so on, is the earth element.

original: 'og tu ye shes khams la sogs pa mtshon par byed pa sa'i sde tshan ye shes kyi khams so //
analyzed: 'og tu ye shes khams la sogs pa mtshon par byed pa sa'i sde tshan ye shes kyi khams so //
translated: Below, the section on the earth, which is the element of wisdom, and so on, is indicated.

original: de rnams gcig tu gyur pa ni ae yig chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: de rnams gcig tu gyur pa ni ae yig chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: Their unity is the syllable E, the realm of phenomena.

original: 'di stong pa chen po yi ge lnga ni dbyangs yig gi tshogs te khu ba dang zla ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di stong pa chen po yi ge lnga ni dbyangs yig gi tshogs te khu ba dang zla ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the five-syllable great emptiness, the collection of vowels, called semen and moon.

original: thig le stong pa yi ge drug ni gsal byed 'dus pa ste khrag dang nyi ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thig le stong pa yi ge drug ni gsal byed 'dus pa ste khrag dang nyi ma zhes bya'o //
translated: The six-syllable empty drop is the collection of consonants, called blood and sun.

original: 'dir khu ba dang rdo rje ni wam yig ste rdo rje'o //
analyzed: 'dir khu ba dang rdo rje ni wam yig ste rdo rje'o //
translated: Here, semen and vajra are the syllable VAM, which is the vajra.

original: khrag dang nyi ma ni ae yig ste padma'o //
analyzed: khrag dang nyi ma ni ae yig ste padma'o //
translated: Blood and sun are the syllable E, which is the lotus.

original: rdo rje dang padma ni 'di dag gi ngag gcig pa nyid ni rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya //
analyzed: rdo rje dang padma ni 'di dag gi ngag gcig pa nyid ni rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya //
translated: The vajra and lotus are one voice of these, called Vajrasattva.

original: de mi 'gyur pas na aa ksha ra'o //
analyzed: de mi 'gyur pas na aa ksha ra'o //
translated: Since that is unchanging, it is Aksara.

original: dbyangs dang gsal byed kyi dang po dang / tha ma 'dus pas gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: dbyangs dang gsal byed kyi dang po dang / tha ma 'dus pas gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: The first and last of the vowels and consonants are united, so there is no duality.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' de yang gnyid dang rmi lam dang / sad pa dang bzhi pa'i gnas skabs bzhi dag pa'i sku bzhi ste //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' de yang gnyid dang rmi lam dang / sad pa dang bzhi pa'i gnas skabs bzhi dag pa'i sku bzhi ste //
translated: That Vajrasattva is the four bodies purified of the four states of waking, dreaming, deep sleep, and the fourth.

original: sku bzhi la dag bya gnas skabs bzhi /
analyzed: sku bzhi la dag bya gnas skabs bzhi /
translated: In the four bodies, there are four states to be purified,

original: dag byed rnal 'byor bzhi /
analyzed: dag byed rnal 'byor bzhi /
translated: four yogas that purify,

original: dag pa mngon byang bzhi /
analyzed: dag pa mngon byang bzhi /
translated: four manifest awakenings that are the purification,

original: ngag pa'i 'bras bu mkhyen pa bzhi /
analyzed: ngag pa'i 'bras bu mkhyen pa bzhi /
translated: four knowledges that are the result of the purification,

original: ngag pa'i mtshan nyid rnam thar bzhi /
analyzed: ngag pa'i mtshan nyid rnam thar bzhi /
translated: four liberations that are the characteristics of the purification,

original: dag pa'i ngo bo rdo rje bzhi'o //
analyzed: dag pa'i ngo bo rdo rje bzhi'o //
translated: and four vajras that are the essence of the purification.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i sku de nyid stong pa nyid kyi rnam par thar pa dang // yongs su dag pa'i ye shes rdo rje dang / thams cad mkhyen pa dang / thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid rnam par dag pa'i rnal 'byor zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i sku de nyid stong pa nyid kyi rnam par thar pa dang // yongs su dag pa'i ye shes rdo rje dang / thams cad mkhyen pa dang / thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid rnam par dag pa'i rnal 'byor zhes bya'o //
translated: That very coemergent body is called the liberation of emptiness, the vajra of completely pure exalted wisdom, omniscience, and the pure yoga of the nature of method and wisdom.

original: chos kyi sku de nyid mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par thar pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i thugs rdo rje dang / ye shes kyi sku dang thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid chos kyi rnal 'byor zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: chos kyi sku de nyid mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par thar pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i thugs rdo rje dang / ye shes kyi sku dang thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid chos kyi rnal 'byor zhes bya'o ;
translated: That very dharmakāya is called the liberation of signlessness, the mind-vajra of purity, the wisdom-kāya, and the yoga of phenomena, which is the nature of method and wisdom.

original: / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku smon pa med pa rnam par thar pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i gsung rdo rje dang / nyi ma'i sku dang thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid sngags kyi rnal 'byor ces bya'o //🔽sprul pa'i sku de nyid mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa dang // yongs su @200a * //
analyzed: / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku smon pa med pa rnam par thar pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i gsung rdo rje dang / nyi ma'i sku dang thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid sngags kyi rnal 'byor ces bya'o // sprul pa'i sku de nyid mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa dang // yongs su @200a * //
translated: The saṃbhogakāya is called the liberation of wishlessness, the speech-vajra of purity, the sun-kāya, and the mantra-yoga, which is the nature of method and wisdom.

original: dag pa'i sku rdo rje dang / padma'i 'dab ma bzhin du yangs pa'i spyan dang / thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid dbyibs kyi rnal 'byor zhes bya bar gsungs so //
analyzed: dag pa'i sku rdo rje dang / padma'i 'dab ma bzhin du yangs pa'i spyan dang / thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid dbyibs kyi rnal 'byor zhes bya bar gsungs so //
translated: That very nirmāṇakāya is called the liberation of non-conditioning, the body-vajra of purity, the eyes that are as vast as lotus petals, and the yoga of shape, which is the nature of method and wisdom.

original: de la ae wam gyi don ni dbyibs dang sngags dang // chos dang de bzhin nyid dang bzhi la 'jug ste /
analyzed: de la ae wam gyi don ni dbyibs dang sngags dang // chos dang de bzhin nyid dang bzhi la 'jug ste /
translated: The meaning of E-VAM is fourfold: shape, mantra, Dharma, and reality.

original: gzhung dkyil 'khor drug rnams brjod bya 'di rnams la la ni rgyas par ston //
analyzed: gzhung dkyil 'khor drug rnams brjod bya 'di rnams la la ni rgyas par ston //
translated: The six maṇḍalas of the treatise are the topics to be explained.

original: la la ni bsdus par ston /
analyzed: la la ni bsdus par ston /
translated: Some are taught extensively,🔽some are taught concisely,

original: la la ni shin tu bsdus par ston to //
analyzed: la la ni shin tu bsdus par ston to //
translated: and some are taught very concisely.

original: de la rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor 'di dang po la dbyibs kyi rnal 'byor rgyas par bstan to //
analyzed: de la rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor 'di dang po la dbyibs kyi rnal 'byor rgyas par bstan to //
translated: In this Vajra Realm Maṇḍala, the yoga of shape is taught extensively in the first [chapter].

original: ae ni gzhal yas khang yin la /
analyzed: ae ni gzhal yas khang yin la /
translated: E is the celestial mansion,

original: wam ni rigs drug gi lha rnams so //
analyzed: wam ni rigs drug gi lha rnams so //
translated: and VAM is the deities of the six families.

original: de ji ltar grub ce na dpal dus kyi 'khor lo las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ji ltar grub ce na dpal dus kyi 'khor lo las gsungs pa /
translated: How is that accomplished? It is stated in the glorious Kālacakra:

original: 'khor lo'i snying por gyur pa mi yi bdag po dkyil 'khor gyi ni nges par sum cha'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i snying por gyur pa mi yi bdag po dkyil 'khor gyi ni nges par sum cha'o //
translated: The lord of humans, the essence of the wheel, is one-third of the maṇḍala.

original: phung po khams kyi lhag pa'i lha dang slar yang snam bu phyi mar rdo rje sgra ma la sogs brgyad //
analyzed: phung po khams kyi lhag pa'i lha dang slar yang snam bu phyi mar rdo rje sgra ma la sogs brgyad //
translated: The remaining aggregates and elements are the deities, and again, on the outer platform, the eight such as Vajra Melody.

original: phyi rim 'khor lor gnas pa nges par phyogs bcur 'khod pa nyi mar bzhugs pa'i khro bo'i tshogs rnams so //
analyzed: phyi rim 'khor lor gnas pa nges par phyogs bcur 'khod pa nyi mar bzhugs pa'i khro bo'i tshogs rnams so //
translated: The hosts of wrathful deities who reside in the outer wheel, definitely arranged in the ten directions, are on the sun.

original: de yi rtsig pa ra ba la ni chu gter bzhi yis bskur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ma lus pa //
analyzed: de yi rtsig pa ra ba la ni chu gter bzhi yis bskur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ma lus pa //
translated: On the wall of that, the four oceans, are all the bodhisattvas.

original: sgyu 'phrul dra bas rnam pa gsum ste lus kyi dbye bas lha ni zhal gsum pa la phyag drug pa ;
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra bas rnam pa gsum ste lus kyi dbye bas lha ni zhal gsum pa la phyag drug pa ;
translated: The net of illusion is threefold, and the deities are differentiated by body, with three faces and six arms.

original: / rmongs pa'i sems kyi dbang las g-yon gyi zhal nas cho ga la sogs ma lus pa rnams spro //🔽zhes pa de bsgom bar bya ba'i rim pa ni dang po'i sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: / rmongs pa'i sems kyi dbang las g-yon gyi zhal nas cho ga la sogs ma lus pa rnams spro // zhes pa de bsgom bar bya ba'i rim pa ni dang po'i sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Through the power of the deluded mind, all the rites and so on are emanated from the left face.

original: gnas khang la sogs sngon du 'gro bas nam smad gnyid sad pa dang / bdag thun mtshams kyi rdo rje 'chang zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa g-yas rdo rje g-yon dril bu 'dzin pa cig tu bsam /
analyzed: gnas khang la sogs sngon du 'gro bas nam smad gnyid sad pa dang / bdag thun mtshams kyi rdo rje 'chang zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa g-yas rdo rje g-yon dril bu 'dzin pa cig tu bsam /
translated: The stage of meditation on that is as follows: The preliminary practice is as follows: Having prepared the dwelling place, and so on, when one awakens in the morning, imagine oneself as Vajradhara of the session break, with one face and two arms, holding a vajra in the right hand and a bell in the left hand.

original: khrus byas stan bde ba la 'dug la spyi bor aom dkar po /
analyzed: khrus byas stan bde ba la 'dug la spyi bor aom dkar po /
translated: Having washed, sit on a comfortable seat. In the head, there is a white oṃ.

original: mgrin pa a'a: dmar po //
analyzed: mgrin pa a'a: dmar po //
translated: At the throat is a red āḥ.

original: snying gar h'um mthing nag / lte bar ho ser po /
analyzed: snying gar h'um mthing nag / lte bar ho ser po /
translated: At the heart is a dark-blue hūṃ, at the navel a yellow hoḥ,

original: gsang bar ksha sngon po /
analyzed: gsang bar ksha sngon po /
translated: and at the perineum a blue kṣa.🔽At the crown of the head is a green kṣa.

original: spyi gtsug tu ham ljang gu rnams bsams la 'khor lo rtsa ba'i grangs bzhin du rdo rje kha dogs drug tu gyur nas pa spu'i bu ga rnams nas 'thon nas gnod par byed pa rnams phyir ded nas /
analyzed: spyi gtsug tu ham ljang gu rnams bsams la 'khor lo rtsa ba'i grangs bzhin du rdo rje kha dogs drug tu gyur nas pa spu'i bu ga rnams nas 'thon nas gnod par byed pa rnams phyir ded nas /
translated: Imagine that the wheels transform into six-colored vajras, the number of spokes, which emerge from the pores of your body and chase away any interferences.

original: dpag tshad mang por bsgral /
analyzed: dpag tshad mang por bsgral /
translated: They are liberated at a distance of many leagues.

original: de nas rdo rje rab dang sa gzhi dang gur du gyur nas 'dus pa las lus la ba spu'i bu ga re re yang rdo rje re rer gyur pa ni @200b bsrung ba bya ba dang lus dag pa rdo rjer bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje rab dang sa gzhi dang gur du gyur nas 'dus pa las lus la ba spu'i bu ga re re yang rdo rje re rer gyur pa ni @200b bsrung ba bya ba dang lus dag pa rdo rjer bya'o //
translated: Then the vajras merge and become the ground and the enclosure.

original: aom sarba dharm'a bh'a wa sva bh'a wa bi shuddha badzra tsakshu aam aa: zhes lan cig brjod pas dag dag gnyis dang gsum bzlas pas sems dag par bya'o //
analyzed: aom sarba dharm'a bh'a wa sva bh'a wa bi shuddha badzra tsakshu aam aa: zhes lan cig brjod pas dag dag gnyis dang gsum bzlas pas sems dag par bya'o //
translated: Recite oṃ sarva dharma bhāva svabhāva viśuddha vajra cakṣu aṃ aḥ once, twice, or three times to purify your mind.

original: de nas thugs ka'i h'um las 'od 'phros pas /
analyzed: de nas thugs ka'i h'um las 'od 'phros pas /
translated: Then light radiates from the hūṃ at the heart.

original: rang bzhin gyi gnas nas sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i lha rnams dang bla ma dang bcas pa mdun gyi nam mkha' la spyan drangs la lha mo rnams kyis mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gnas nas sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i lha rnams dang bla ma dang bcas pa mdun gyi nam mkha' la spyan drangs la lha mo rnams kyis mchod par bya'o //
translated: The deities of the Magical Net together with the guru are invited from their natural abode into the space in front. The goddesses make offerings.

original: thog ma med pa nas bsags pa'i sdig pa bshags so /
analyzed: thog ma med pa nas bsags pa'i sdig pa bshags so /
translated: One confesses the evil accumulated from beginningless time.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dge ba byas pa la rjes su yi rang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dge ba byas pa la rjes su yi rang bar bya'o //
translated: One rejoices in the virtue performed by the buddhas, bodhisattvas, and so forth.

original: lha de dag la skyabs su 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: lha de dag la skyabs su 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: One goes for refuge to those deities.

original: bdag gi dngos po dbul ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po dbul ba'o //
translated: One offers one's body.

original: byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed do //
translated: One generates the mind of supreme enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi lam bsten to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam bsten to //
translated: One relies on the path of enlightenment.

original: tshad med pa bzhi bsgom mo //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi bsgom mo //
translated: One cultivates the four immeasurables.

original: aom sarba dharm'a la sogs pa lan gsum bzlas pas dngos po thams cad stong par bsam mo //
analyzed: aom sarba dharm'a la sogs pa lan gsum bzlas pas dngos po thams cad stong par bsam mo //
translated: One imagines that all things are empty by reciting three times Oṃ śūnyatā... and so forth.

original: de'i rjes la stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang // smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du mi byed par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang // smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du mi byed par bsam par bya'o //
translated: After that, one imagines emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, and non-conditioning.

original: dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog la /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog la /
translated: The supreme king of maṇḍalas.

original: de nas stong pa nyid las 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phung po gzung bar bya ba'i phyir 'byung ba rim brtsegs bskyed pa ni nam mkha' chos kyi 'byung gnas gru gsum pa nam mkha' khyab par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas stong pa nyid las 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phung po gzung bar bya ba'i phyir 'byung ba rim brtsegs bskyed pa ni nam mkha' chos kyi 'byung gnas gru gsum pa nam mkha' khyab par bsam par bya'o //
translated: Then, in order to take up the supramundane aggregates from emptiness, the creation of the stacked-up world is as follows: Imagine that the space of the source of phenomena is a triangle that pervades space.

original: rnam par shes pa n'a da'i tshul du gnas pa las yam nag po cig 'og tu chad pas de gyur pa las rlung gi dkyil 'khor nag po zla ba phyed pa lta bu rgya chen po la steng dan 'og tu rdo rje gnyis dang / mtha'i rtse mo la rlung gi ba dan gyis mtshan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa n'a da'i tshul du gnas pa las yam nag po cig 'og tu chad pas de gyur pa las rlung gi dkyil 'khor nag po zla ba phyed pa lta bu rgya chen po la steng dan 'og tu rdo rje gnyis dang / mtha'i rtse mo la rlung gi ba dan gyis mtshan pa'o //
translated: From the consciousness abiding in the form of nāda, a black yaṃ breaks off below and becomes a black air maṇḍala in the shape of a half-moon, vast and with two vajras above and below, marked with air pennants on the edges.

original: de'i steng du ram dmar po cig chad pas de gyur pa las me'i dkyil 'khor dmar po gru gsum rgya chen po cig bsam ste /
analyzed: de'i steng du ram dmar po cig chad pas de gyur pa las me'i dkyil 'khor dmar po gru gsum rgya chen po cig bsam ste /
translated: Above that, a red raṃ breaks off and becomes a vast, red, triangular fire maṇḍala.

original: steng 'og tu sna tshogs rdo rje gnyis dang / mtha' ma'i zur gsum la g-yung drung ris dmar pos mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: steng 'og tu sna tshogs rdo rje gnyis dang / mtha' ma'i zur gsum la g-yung drung ris dmar pos mtshon pa'o //
translated: Above and below are two crossed vajras, and the three outer corners are marked with red swastikas.

original: de'i steng du bam dkar po cig chad pas de gyur pa las chu'i dkyil 'khor dkar po zlum po rgya chen cig bsam /
analyzed: de'i steng du bam dkar po cig chad pas de gyur pa las chu'i dkyil 'khor dkar po zlum po rgya chen cig bsam /
translated: On top of that, a white baṃ is severed. That becomes a vast, round white water maṇḍala.

original: steng dang 'og tu sna tshogs rdo rje gnyis dang mtha' mar padma dkar po 'dab ma lngas mtshan pa'o //🔽de'i steng du lam ser po cig chad pas de gyur pa las sa'i dkyil 'khor ser po rgya che ba la steng dang 'og tu sna tshogs @201a * //
analyzed: steng dang 'og tu sna tshogs rdo rje gnyis dang mtha' mar padma dkar po 'dab ma lngas mtshan pa'o // de'i steng du lam ser po cig chad pas de gyur pa las sa'i dkyil 'khor ser po rgya che ba la steng dang 'og tu sna tshogs @201a * //
translated: Above and below are two crossed vajras, and the outer edge is marked with a white lotus with five petals.

original: rdo rje gnyis dang zur bzhi la rdo rje rtse mo lnga pas mtshan pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gnyis dang zur bzhi la rdo rje rtse mo lnga pas mtshan pa'o //
translated: On top of that, a yellow laṃ is severed. That becomes a vast yellow earth maṇḍala. Above and below are two crossed vajras. The four corners are marked with five-tined vajras.

original: de'i steng du mam sna tshogs pa'i mdog can cig chad pa de gyur pa las dbus kyi ri rab shar nag po //🔽lho dmar po /
analyzed: de'i steng du mam sna tshogs pa'i mdog can cig chad pa de gyur pa las dbus kyi ri rab shar nag po // lho dmar po /
translated: On top of that, a multicolored maṃ is severed. That becomes the central Meru: black in the east,🔽red in the south,

original: nub ser po //
analyzed: nub ser po //
translated: yellow in the west,

original: byang dkar po /
analyzed: byang dkar po /
translated: and white in the north.

original: dbus mthing ga zlum po dpangs su dpag tshad 'bum phrag gcig pa //
analyzed: dbus mthing ga zlum po dpangs su dpag tshad 'bum phrag gcig pa //
translated: The center is blue, round, and one hundred thousand yojanas high.

original: 'og gi rgyal dpag tshad stong phrag bcu drug pa /
analyzed: 'og gi rgyal dpag tshad stong phrag bcu drug pa /
translated: The lower circumference is sixteen thousand yojanas.

original: steng gi rgya la dpag tshad stong phrag lnga bcu pa /
analyzed: steng gi rgya la dpag tshad stong phrag lnga bcu pa /
translated: The upper circumference is fifty thousand yojanas.

original: steng gi phyogs bzhin lcog bzhis mtshan pa'o //
analyzed: steng gi phyogs bzhin lcog bzhis mtshan pa'o //
translated: The upper part is marked with four turrets in the four directions.

original: de'i steng du ksha yig chad pas de gyur pa las sna tshogs padma dpag tshad stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga pa gcig bsam par bya'o ;
analyzed: de'i steng du ksha yig chad pas de gyur pa las sna tshogs padma dpag tshad stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga pa gcig bsam par bya'o ;
translated: Above that, from the broken syllable kṣa, one should imagine a multicolored lotus twenty-five thousand yojanas wide.

original: / de'i steng du ham dkar po la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dpag tshad stong phrag phyed dang bcu gsum pa cig bsam mo //🔽de'i steng du tsheg drag dmar po las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dmar po zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang rgya mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: / de'i steng du ham dkar po la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dpag tshad stong phrag phyed dang bcu gsum pa cig bsam mo // de'i steng du tsheg drag dmar po las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dmar po zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang rgya mnyam pa'o //
translated: Above that, from a white haṃ, one should imagine a moon maṇḍala thirteen and a half thousand yojanas wide.🔽Above that, from a red visarga, one should imagine a red sun maṇḍala the same size as the moon maṇḍala.

original: de'i steng du thig le sngon po las sgra gcan gyi dkyil 'khor sngon po nyi zla dang rgya mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du thig le sngon po las sgra gcan gyi dkyil 'khor sngon po nyi zla dang rgya mnyam pa'o //
translated: Above that, from a blue bindu, one should imagine a blue Rāhu maṇḍala the same size as the sun and moon.

original: de las aam ham yam ram bam lam badzra a'a k'a sha b'a yu te dza au da ka pri thi b'i badzra sva bh'a ba pa nytsa dh'a tvo badzra mandala ni ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: de las aam ham yam ram bam lam badzra a'a k'a sha b'a yu te dza au da ka pri thi b'i badzra sva bh'a ba pa nytsa dh'a tvo badzra mandala ni ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: From that, say: aṃ haṃ yaṃ raṃ vaṃ laṃ vajra ākāśa-bhavan tri-pratītya-vajra-sva-bhāva-pūja-dhātu vajra-maṇḍala kuru kuru svāhā.

original: zhes brjod pas brtan par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes brjod pas brtan par bya'o //
translated: By saying that, it becomes stable.

original: de'i steng du h'um yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje'i ra ba dang gur dang sa gzhir gyur par bsam mo //
analyzed: de'i steng du h'um yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje'i ra ba dang gur dang sa gzhir gyur par bsam mo //
translated: Above that, think that from hūṃ completely transformed, there is a vajra fence, a tent, and a ground.

original: de'i steng du bhr'um mam yang na aom las byung ba'i gzhal yas khang gru bzhi pa sgo bzhi pa sgo gnyis brtsegs pa /
analyzed: de'i steng du bhr'um mam yang na aom las byung ba'i gzhal yas khang gru bzhi pa sgo bzhi pa sgo gnyis brtsegs pa /
translated: Above that, from bhrūṃ or also from oṃ, there is a celestial mansion with four sides and four gates, with two-tiered doors,🔽marked with archways, ledges, half-halos,

original: rta babs dang snam bu dang dra ba phyed pa dang // dril bu dang / rnga yab dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ri dags kyis mtshan pa /
analyzed: rta babs dang snam bu dang dra ba phyed pa dang // dril bu dang / rnga yab dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ri dags kyis mtshan pa /
translated: bells, yak-tail whisks, victory banners, and deer.

original: gzhal yas khang gi phyi rol rdo rje ra ba'i nang du dur khrod brgyad dang bcas pa rin po che'i rtsig pa lngas phyi rim dkyil 'khor la yod pa nang pho brang dkyil 'khor gru bzhi la le tshe dgu pa ka ba bcu drug rgyan dang ldan pa
analyzed: gzhal yas khang gi phyi rol rdo rje ra ba'i nang du dur khrod brgyad dang bcas pa rin po che'i rtsig pa lngas phyi rim dkyil 'khor la yod pa nang pho brang dkyil 'khor gru bzhi la le tshe dgu pa ka ba bcu drug rgyan dang ldan pa
translated: The inner palace is a square mandala with nine chambers and sixteen pillars, complete with ornaments.

original: sum cha la gtso bo'i gdan ni pam las gyur pa'i gdan 'dab ma brgyad pa //
analyzed: sum cha la gtso bo'i gdan ni pam las gyur pa'i gdan 'dab ma brgyad pa //
translated: One-third of the palace is the seat of the principal figure, which arises from paṃ and has eight petals.

original: de'i steng du zla ba dang nyi ma dang sgra gcan gyi gdan dang bcas par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du zla ba dang nyi ma dang sgra gcan gyi gdan dang bcas par bsam par bya'o //
translated: Upon that, one should imagine the seats of the moon, sun, and Rāhu.

original: de nas yab yum bskyed pa ni //
analyzed: de nas yab yum bskyed pa ni //
translated: Next, the creation of the father and mother is as follows.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das //
translated: Thus, the blessed buddhas

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas aa las byung //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas aa las byung //
translated: arise from the perfect buddha A.🔽A is the supreme of all syllables,
