analyzed: rgyas pa las /
translated: In the extensive explanation,

original: phyir mi ldog pa phyir mi 'ong //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa phyir mi 'ong //
translated: the nonreturner is the irreversible empowerment.

original: zhes pa dbang bdun pa rim gyis thob pa'i rjes la brgyad pa bum pa'i dbang bskur bas brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa dbang bdun pa rim gyis thob pa'i rjes la brgyad pa bum pa'i dbang bskur bas brgyad pa'o //
translated: This is the eighth empowerment, the vase empowerment, which is conferred after the seven empowerments have been obtained in sequence.

original: 'dren pa rang rgyal ni slob ma'i tshogs sdud pas 'dren pa'i rang rgyal lo //
analyzed: 'dren pa rang rgyal ni slob ma'i tshogs sdud pas 'dren pa'i rang rgyal lo //
translated: The pratyekabuddha who guides is the pratyekabuddha who gathers a group of disciples.

original: bse ru'i tshul ni slob ma mang po yang slob dpon gcig gis grol bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bse ru'i tshul ni slob ma mang po yang slob dpon gcig gis grol bar byed pa'o //
translated: The rhinoceros-like is the master who liberates many disciples.

original: nges 'byung sna tshogs las byung ba //
analyzed: nges 'byung sna tshogs las byung ba //
translated: Arising from various renunciations,

original: 'byung ba chen po rgyu gcig po //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po rgyu gcig po //
translated: the single cause of the great elements,

original: zhes pa gsang ba'i dbang ste /
analyzed: zhes pa gsang ba'i dbang ste /
translated: This is the secret empowerment.

original: nges 'byung sna tshogs ni slob dpon dang slob ma rig pa'i khams sna tshogs pa rnams nges par rtsa'i lam nas byung nas slob ma'i ngag la bskur ba'o //
analyzed: nges 'byung sna tshogs ni slob dpon dang slob ma rig pa'i khams sna tshogs pa rnams nges par rtsa'i lam nas byung nas slob ma'i ngag la bskur ba'o //
translated: Various renunciations are the various elements of the disciples and the master that definitely arise through the path of the nāḍīs and are conferred on the disciple’s voice.

original: 'byung ba ni sa la sogs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni sa la sogs pa lnga'o //
translated: The elements are the five, earth, and so on.

original: chen po ni ye shes kyi lam mo //
analyzed: chen po ni ye shes kyi lam mo //
translated: The great elements are the path of pristine consciousness.

original: kun rdzob byang chub sems la brten nas don dam pa'i byang chub thob pa'i rgyu yin pas rgyu gcig bu'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob byang chub sems la brten nas don dam pa'i byang chub thob pa'i rgyu yin pas rgyu gcig bu'o //
translated: Since the ultimate awakening is attained in dependence on the relative awakening, it is the single cause.

original: dge slong dgra bcom zag pa zad //
analyzed: dge slong dgra bcom zag pa zad //
translated: The monk is an arhat, his defilements exhausted.

original: 'dod chags bral bas dbang po thul //
analyzed: 'dod chags bral bas dbang po thul //
translated: Free from desire, he has subdued his senses.

original: zhes ba dbang gsum pa ste dge slong ni thig le mi 'dzag pas so //
analyzed: zhes ba dbang gsum pa ste dge slong ni thig le mi 'dzag pas so //
translated: The third initiation. The monk is so called because the bindu does not drip.

original: dgra bcom pa ni thig le 'dzin pa'i khrag 'dzag pa yin pas de ni dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni thig le 'dzin pa'i khrag 'dzag pa yin pas de ni dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa'o //
translated: The arhat is so called because he holds the bindu and stops the bleeding. He is an arhat, his defilements exhausted.

original: 'dod chags bral ba ni 'dzag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags bral ba ni 'dzag pa'o //
translated: Free from desire is the dripping.

original: des na dbang po rnams thul ba'o //
analyzed: des na dbang po rnams thul ba'o //
translated: Therefore, he has subdued his senses.

original: bde ba rnyed pas 'jigs med thob //
analyzed: bde ba rnyed pas 'jigs med thob //
translated: He has attained bliss, and so is fearless.

original: bsil bar gyur pas rnyog pa med //
analyzed: bsil bar gyur pas rnyog pa med //
translated: He has become cool, and so is unmuddied.

original: ces pa dbang bzhi pa ste bde ba rnyed pa ni mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: ces pa dbang bzhi pa ste bde ba rnyed pa ni mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The fourth initiation. He has attained bliss is the unchanging gnosis.

original: des 'dzag pa'i 'jigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: des 'dzag pa'i 'jigs pa med pa'o //
translated: By that, he is fearless of dripping.

original: bsil bar gyur pa ni sa bcu gcig pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: bsil bar gyur pa ni sa bcu gcig pa'i ye shes so //
translated: He has become cool is the gnosis of the eleventh stage.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i rnyog pa med pas med pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i rnyog pa med pas med pa'o //
translated: On that, there is no worldly mud, and so he is unmuddied.

original: da ni sku bzhi la de'i rgyu lam dang ngo bo dang mjug bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: da ni sku bzhi la de'i rgyu lam dang ngo bo dang mjug bsdus pa'o //
translated: Now, the four bodies are the cause of that, the path, the essence, and the conclusion.

original: dang po thob pa'i rgyu ni /
analyzed: dang po thob pa'i rgyu ni /
translated: First, the cause of attainment is:

original: bdag gir mi 'dzin ngar mi 'dzin //
analyzed: bdag gir mi 'dzin ngar mi 'dzin //
translated: He does not grasp as mine, nor does he grasp as I.

original: bden pa gnyis kyi tshul la gnas //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis kyi tshul la gnas //
translated: Abiding in the way of the two truths.

original: zhes pa bdag gir mi 'dzin pa ni yul rnams la'o //
analyzed: zhes pa bdag gir mi 'dzin pa ni yul rnams la'o //
translated: Not grasping as mine is with regard to objects.

original: ngar mi 'dzin pa ni 'dzin pa'i sems stong par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ngar mi 'dzin pa ni 'dzin pa'i sems stong par rtogs pa'o //
translated: Not grasping as I is realizing the empty nature of the mind that grasps.🔽The two truths are appearance and🔽emptiness.

original: bden pa gnyis ni snang ba dang // lha kun rdzob kyi bden pa @212a * //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis ni snang ba dang // lha kun rdzob kyi bden pa @212a * //
translated: The appearance of all deities is the relative truth.

original: rang bzhin med pa don dam pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa don dam pa'o //
translated: The absence of intrinsic existence is the ultimate truth.🔽Those who have these are on the first ground.

original: de su la yod na sa dang po la yod pas shes pa 'ba' zhig las byung ba zhes pa gnyis te shes pa ni sa dang po pa'o //
analyzed: de su la yod na sa dang po la yod pas shes pa 'ba' zhig las byung ba zhes pa gnyis te shes pa ni sa dang po pa'o //
translated: The two lines “Arisen from consciousness alone” refer to consciousness, which is the first ground.

original: shes rab mtshon chen rnams 'joms pa //
analyzed: shes rab mtshon chen rnams 'joms pa //
translated: The great weapon of wisdom destroys.

original: zhes pas sa dang po'o //
analyzed: zhes pas sa dang po'o //
translated: This is the first ground.

original: shes rab des nyon mongs pa mngon du gyur pa rnams bcom pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab des nyon mongs pa mngon du gyur pa rnams bcom pa'o //
translated: By that wisdom, manifest afflictions are destroyed.

original: des sa bcu rim gyis brgyud nas sangs rgyas pas /
analyzed: des sa bcu rim gyis brgyud nas sangs rgyas pas /
translated: Through that, one gradually passes through the ten grounds and becomes a buddha.

original: 'khor ba'i pha rol mthar son pa //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i pha rol mthar son pa //
translated: Having reached the end of the far shore of samsara.

original: zhes pas sa bcu pa yang las dbang min te /
analyzed: zhes pas sa bcu pa yang las dbang min te /
translated: The tenth ground is not under the power of karma.

original: smon lam gyi dbang gis sems can gyi don la bzhugs la sangs rgyas de'i mthar son pa'o //
analyzed: smon lam gyi dbang gis sems can gyi don la bzhugs la sangs rgyas de'i mthar son pa'o //
translated: Through the power of aspiration, one remains for the welfare of sentient beings and reaches the end of buddhahood.

original: bya ba ni sems can don yin la byas pa ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du'o //
analyzed: bya ba ni sems can don yin la byas pa ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du'o //
translated: The action is for the sake of sentient beings, and the performance is for three incalculable aeons.

original: de byas nas skam sa ni sa bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: de byas nas skam sa ni sa bcu gnyis so //
translated: Having performed that, the dry land is the twelve stages.

original: sa bcu gnyis pa'i ngo bo la sku bzhi ste /
analyzed: sa bcu gnyis pa'i ngo bo la sku bzhi ste /
translated: In the nature of the twelve stages, there are four kayas.

original: dang po sprul pa'i sku ni /
analyzed: dang po sprul pa'i sku ni /
translated: First, the nirmanakaya:

original: rig pa dang ni rkang bar ldan //
analyzed: rig pa dang ni rkang bar ldan //
translated: Endowed with knowledge and feet,🔽The Sugata, supreme knower of the world.

original: bde gshegs 'jig rten rig pa'i mchog / ces pa rig pa ni sems can gyi don bya ba la rig cing mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: bde gshegs 'jig rten rig pa'i mchog / ces pa rig pa ni sems can gyi don bya ba la rig cing mkhas pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is being skilled in acting for the sake of sentient beings.

original: rkang pa ni sku'i khyad par yin la ldan pa ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: rkang pa ni sku'i khyad par yin la ldan pa ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: Feet are the special body, and endowment is the nirmanakaya.

original: bde bar gshegs pa ni 'jig rten ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa ni 'jig rten ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'o //
translated: Sugata is the world, the great trichiliocosm.

original: rig pa'i mchog ni de na gnas pa'i don to //
analyzed: rig pa'i mchog ni de na gnas pa'i don to //
translated: Supreme knower is the meaning of abiding there.

original: dam chos chos rgyal gsal bar ldan //
analyzed: dam chos chos rgyal gsal bar ldan //
translated: The holy Dharma, the king of Dharma, is clear.🔽The supreme illuminator of the world,

original: 'jig rten snang bar byed pa'i mchog / chos kyi dbang phyug chos kyi rgyal //
analyzed: 'jig rten snang bar byed pa'i mchog / chos kyi dbang phyug chos kyi rgyal //
translated: the lord of Dharma, the king of Dharma,

original: legs pa'i lam ni ston pa po //
analyzed: legs pa'i lam ni ston pa po //
translated: the teacher of the excellent path.

original: zhes pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: zhes pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste /
translated: This is the sambhogakaya.

original: dam chos ni bstan pa'i chos so //
analyzed: dam chos ni bstan pa'i chos so //
translated: The holy Dharma is the Dharma of teaching.

original: chos rgyal gsal bar ldan ni zhi ba'i chos so //
analyzed: chos rgyal gsal bar ldan ni zhi ba'i chos so //
translated: The Dharma King, the Illuminator, is the Dharma of peace.

original: 'jig rten ni ma rig pa'i snang ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten ni ma rig pa'i snang ba'o //
translated: The world is the appearance of ignorance.

original: snang bar byed pa'i mchog ni ye shes te des gsal bar byed pa'o ;
analyzed: snang bar byed pa'i mchog ni ye shes te des gsal bar byed pa'o ;
translated: The supreme illuminator is wisdom, which illuminates with it.

original: / chos kyi dbang phyug chos kyi rgyal ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste //
analyzed: / chos kyi dbang phyug chos kyi rgyal ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste //
translated: The Lord of Dharma, the King of Dharma, is the enjoyment body,

original: chos kyi dbang phyug dang chos kyi rgyal por 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbang phyug dang chos kyi rgyal por 'gyur pa'o //
translated: because he becomes the Lord of Dharma and the King of Dharma.

original: des byang chub sems dpa' rnams la chos ston pas na /
analyzed: des byang chub sems dpa' rnams la chos ston pas na /
translated: Because he teaches the Dharma to the bodhisattvas,

original: legs pa'i lam ni ston pa po //
analyzed: legs pa'i lam ni ston pa po //
translated: he is the one who shows the good path.

original: zhes pa'o // chos kyi sku ni /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // chos kyi sku ni /
translated: The Dharma body is as follows:

original: don grub bsam pa grub pa ste //
analyzed: don grub bsam pa grub pa ste //
translated: The accomplished meaning, the accomplished thought,

original: kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs //🔽rnam par mi rtog dbyings mi zad //
analyzed: kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs // rnam par mi rtog dbyings mi zad //
translated: having abandoned all conceptual thoughts,🔽the nonconceptual realm is inexhaustible.

original: chos dbyings dam pa zad mi shes //
analyzed: chos dbyings dam pa zad mi shes //
translated: The holy realm of phenomena is inexhaustible.

original: zhes pa don grub ni sems can gyi'o //
analyzed: zhes pa don grub ni sems can gyi'o //
translated: The accomplished meaning is that of sentient beings.

original: bsam pa grub pa ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: bsam pa grub pa ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi'o //
translated: The accomplished thought is that of buddhahood.

original: kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs pa ni chos kyi sku las so //
analyzed: kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs pa ni chos kyi sku las so //
translated: The abandonment of all conceptual thoughts is from the dharmakāya.

original: rnam bar mi rtog @212b pa'i chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam bar mi rtog @212b pa'i chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature of the nonconceptual dharmakāya.

original: dbyings mi zad pa ni ngo bo'o //
analyzed: dbyings mi zad pa ni ngo bo'o //
translated: The inexhaustible dhātu is the essence.

original: rnam par mi rtog dbyings mi zad //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog dbyings mi zad //
translated: The inexhaustible dhātu is nonconceptual.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: chos dbyings dam pa zad mi shes //
analyzed: chos dbyings dam pa zad mi shes //
translated: The supreme dhātu of phenomena is inexhaustible.

original: zhes pa chos kyi sku la skye ba med pas zad pa yang med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa chos kyi sku la skye ba med pas zad pa yang med pa'o //
translated: Since there is no arising in the dharmakāya, there is also no exhaustion.

original: ye shes sku ni /
analyzed: ye shes sku ni /
translated: The jñānakāya is as follows:

original: bsod nams ldan pa bsod nams tshogs //
analyzed: bsod nams ldan pa bsod nams tshogs //
translated: Endowed with merit, the accumulation of merit,

original: ye shes ye shes 'byung gnas che //
analyzed: ye shes ye shes 'byung gnas che //
translated: the great source of the pristine consciousness of wisdom,

original: ye shes ldan pa yod mi shes //
analyzed: ye shes ldan pa yod mi shes //
translated: the possessor of wisdom is not known to exist.

original: tshogs gnyis tshogs ni bsags pa po //
analyzed: tshogs gnyis tshogs ni bsags pa po //
translated: The one who accumulates the two accumulations

original: zhes pa bsod nams ldan pa ni sngar byas pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: zhes pa bsod nams ldan pa ni sngar byas pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: Endowed with merit is the result of what was previously done.

original: bsod nams tshogs ni thabs dge ba'i las so //
analyzed: bsod nams tshogs ni thabs dge ba'i las so //
translated: The accumulation of merit is the method, virtuous karma.

original: ye shes ni sngar stong pa las mos par byas pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni sngar stong pa las mos par byas pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is the previous interest in emptiness.

original: de phyis 'byung ba'i ye shes kyi 'byung ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: de phyis 'byung ba'i ye shes kyi 'byung ba'i gnas so //
translated: Later, it is the source of the arising of pristine consciousness.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni ye shes che zhes pa mi 'gyur pa'i zhes so //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni ye shes che zhes pa mi 'gyur pa'i zhes so //
translated: Its result is “great intuition,” which is unchanging.

original: ye shes ldan pa ni de'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: ye shes ldan pa ni de'i ngo bo'o //
translated: “Endowed with intuition” is its essence.

original: yod med shes pa ni de'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: yod med shes pa ni de'i rang bzhin no //
translated: “Knowing existence and nonexistence” is its nature.

original: tshogs gnyis tshogs ni bsags pa po //
analyzed: tshogs gnyis tshogs ni bsags pa po //
translated: “The one who has accumulated the two stores”

original: zhes pa ni 'bras bu longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'bras bu longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: is the result, the body of complete enjoyment.

original: de'i mjug bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: de'i mjug bsdu ba ni /
translated: The summary of that is:

original: mchog gi dang po sku gsum 'chang ;
analyzed: mchog gi dang po sku gsum 'chang ;
translated: The supreme first one, the bearer of the three bodies,

original: / sangs rgyas sku lnga'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: / sangs rgyas sku lnga'i bdag nyid can //
translated: The one with the nature of the five buddha bodies,🔽The all-pervading lord, the one with the nature of the five intuitions,

original: khyab bdag ye shes lnga yi bdag / sangs rgyas lnga bdag cod pan can //
analyzed: khyab bdag ye shes lnga yi bdag / sangs rgyas lnga bdag cod pan can //
translated: The one with the nature of the five buddhas, the one with the crown,

original: spyan lnga chags pa med pa 'chang /
analyzed: spyan lnga chags pa med pa 'chang /
translated: The one who bears the five eyes without attachment.

original: zhes pa mchog gi dang po ni ye shes kyi sku'o //
analyzed: zhes pa mchog gi dang po ni ye shes kyi sku'o //
translated: The supreme first one is the intuition body.

original: de la gzhan sku gsum dang bzhi ru gnas pas na 'chang zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de la gzhan sku gsum dang bzhi ru gnas pas na 'chang zhes pa'o //
translated: The other three bodies are present in it, so it is called “the bearer.”

original: sku bzhi dang ldan ba'i /
analyzed: sku bzhi dang ldan ba'i /
translated: The one endowed with the four bodies

original: sangs rgyas sku lnga'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sku lnga'i bdag nyid can //
translated: The one with the nature of the five buddha bodies

original: zhes pa rdo rje rigs la sogs pa rigs lnga'i de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa rdo rje rigs la sogs pa rigs lnga'i de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: is the five Tathāgatas of the five buddha families, such as the Vajra family.

original: khyab bdag ni rigs lnga'o //
analyzed: khyab bdag ni rigs lnga'o //
translated: The all-pervading lord is the five clans.

original: ye shes lnga yi bdag ces pa rigs lnga la ye shes lngas khyab pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes lnga yi bdag ces pa rigs lnga la ye shes lngas khyab pa'o //
translated: The five gnoses are the nature of the five clans.

original: sangs rgyas lnga bdag gcod pan can ni rigs mtshon par byed pa'i rigs gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga bdag gcod pan can ni rigs mtshon par byed pa'i rigs gnas pa'o //
translated: The five buddhas are the nature of the five clans.

original: spyan lnga ni sha'i spyan dang // lha'i spyan dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyan dang / chos kyi spyan dang / ye shes kyi spyan no //
analyzed: spyan lnga ni sha'i spyan dang // lha'i spyan dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyan dang / chos kyi spyan dang / ye shes kyi spyan no //
translated: The five eyes are the flesh eye, the deva eye, the buddha eye, the dharma eye, and the gnosis eye.

original: chags pa med par 'chang ba ni de ltar yul rnams gzigs kyang dngos por mi 'dzin pa dang ma chags pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa med par 'chang ba ni de ltar yul rnams gzigs kyang dngos por mi 'dzin pa dang ma chags pa'o //
translated: The one who holds without attachment is the one who, although seeing the objects in that way, does not apprehend them as things and is not attached.

original: da ni sbyor ba'i yan lag drug brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni sbyor ba'i yan lag drug brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the six branches of yoga will be explained.

original: ye shes kyi sku'i grub pa'i rten dang / yan lag drug so so'i mtshan nyid dang / rtags dang ye shes kyi sku'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku'i grub pa'i rten dang / yan lag drug so so'i mtshan nyid dang / rtags dang ye shes kyi sku'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The basis for the accomplishment of the gnosis body, the characteristics of the individual six branches, and the essence of the gnosis body.

original: phyag rgya chen po'i lam 'di snod dag mi ldan pa bla ma'i bka' dang mi ldan par rang zhugs su gzhan la ston pa ma 'ongs pa'i dus su 'byung ba'i phyir @213a * //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i lam 'di snod dag mi ldan pa bla ma'i bka' dang mi ldan par rang zhugs su gzhan la ston pa ma 'ongs pa'i dus su 'byung ba'i phyir @213a * //
translated: This path of the great seal will be taught to others by those who are not fit vessels, who do not have the teacher's permission, and who have entered into it on their own in the future.

original: dkrugs nas bstan to //
analyzed: dkrugs nas bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught in a mixed way.🔽The basis is as follows:

original: rten ni // sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pa po //
analyzed: rten ni // sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pa po //
translated: The mother of all buddhas,🔽the supreme son of the buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas sras po dam pa'i mchog / rtag pa kun rgyal rnal 'byor can //🔽zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras po dam pa'i mchog / rtag pa kun rgyal rnal 'byor can // zhes sbyar ro //
translated: the constant one, the universal conqueror, the yogin.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pa ni dam tshig dang sdom pa dang // theg pa gsum ka 'dzin pa sgrub pa la brtson pa'o ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pa ni dam tshig dang sdom pa dang // theg pa gsum ka 'dzin pa sgrub pa la brtson pa'o ;
translated: The mother of all buddhas is the one who practices the commitments, vows, and the three vehicles.

original: / skyed pa po ni sgrub pa po'o //
analyzed: / skyed pa po ni sgrub pa po'o //
translated: The one who generates is the practitioner.

original: sangs rgyas sras ni sa dang po'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras ni sa dang po'o //
translated: The son of the buddhas is the first ground.

original: dam pa ni sa brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa ni sa brgyad pa'o //
translated: The supreme one is the eighth ground.

original: mchog ni sa bcu pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ni sa bcu pa'o //
translated: The best one is the tenth ground.

original: rtag pa ni mi 'gyur pa ste ye shes kyi sku'o //
analyzed: rtag pa ni mi 'gyur pa ste ye shes kyi sku'o //
translated: The constant one is the unchanging body of wisdom.

original: kun rgyal ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa las so //
analyzed: kun rgyal ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa las so //
translated: The universal conqueror is the one who is victorious over samsara and nirvana.

original: rnal 'byor ni de bzhin nyid kyi rnal 'byor te nyin mo dang mtshan mo'i ste de su la yod pa ni can no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni de bzhin nyid kyi rnal 'byor te nyin mo dang mtshan mo'i ste de su la yod pa ni can no //
translated: Yoga is the yoga of suchness, and he who has that day and night is the possessor.

original: yan lag drug la grangs nges pa dang / go rims nges pa ni dpal 'dus pa phyi ma las gsungs pa /
analyzed: yan lag drug la grangs nges pa dang / go rims nges pa ni dpal 'dus pa phyi ma las gsungs pa /
translated: The ascertainment of the number of the six branches and the ascertainment of their sequence are taught in the Shri Samputa Tantra:

original: so sor sdud dang bsam gtan dang // srog rtsol de bzhin 'dzin pa dang // rjes su 'dzin dang ting nge 'dzin //🔽sbyor ba yan lag drug tu bshad ;
analyzed: so sor sdud dang bsam gtan dang // srog rtsol de bzhin 'dzin pa dang // rjes su 'dzin dang ting nge 'dzin // sbyor ba yan lag drug tu bshad ;
translated: The withdrawal, the concentration, the life-force control, the retention, the post-concentration, and the samadhi,

original: / ces pa'o //
analyzed: / ces pa'o //
translated: these are explained as the six branches of the yoga.

original: dang po so sor sdud pa la //
analyzed: dang po so sor sdud pa la //
translated: The first is the withdrawal.

original: gtsug tor chen po rmad byung gtsug / nam mkha'i bdag po sna tshogs ston //
analyzed: gtsug tor chen po rmad byung gtsug / nam mkha'i bdag po sna tshogs ston //
translated: The great uhnha, the marvelous uhnha, the lord of the sky, the various displays,

original: zhes pa gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur pa'i lta stangs te steng du lta ba yin /
analyzed: zhes pa gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur pa'i lta stangs te steng du lta ba yin /
translated: is the uhnha chakravartin gaze, which is looking upward.

original: chen po ni sgrub pa po yang don chen po'i rmad du 'byung ba'i lta stangs spyi bo'i gtsug tu'o ;
analyzed: chen po ni sgrub pa po yang don chen po'i rmad du 'byung ba'i lta stangs spyi bo'i gtsug tu'o ;
translated: The great is the practitioner's great purpose, the marvelous gaze at the uhnha on the crown of the head.

original: / de yang sprin med pa'i nam mkha' la lta bas nam mkha'i bdag po'o //
analyzed: / de yang sprin med pa'i nam mkha' la lta bas nam mkha'i bdag po'o //
translated: Also, since one looks at the cloudless sky, it is the lord of the sky.

original: sna tshogs ton pas na rtags rim pa snang ba'o //🔽gong du / so sor rnag rig mi g-yo ba //
analyzed: sna tshogs ton pas na rtags rim pa snang ba'o // gong du / so sor rnag rig mi g-yo ba //
translated: Since it is the appearance of the stages of the signs, it is the sign of the stages.🔽As it was said above,

original: zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Individual knowledge is unwavering.

original: so so ni yul gzugs la sog spa'o //
analyzed: so so ni yul gzugs la sog spa'o //
translated: Individual means the objects, such as form.

original: rang rig ni yul can mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang rig ni yul can mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is the subjective eye consciousness, and so on.

original: mi g-yo ba ni yul la yul can mi 'jug par gnas so //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba ni yul la yul can mi 'jug par gnas so //
translated: Unwavering means the object does not engage the subject.

original: de nas bsam gtan ni /
analyzed: de nas bsam gtan ni /
translated: Then, concentration:🔽The supreme intelligent one is the concentration of the one without🔽concentration.

original: bsam gtan pas ma bya blo ldan mchog / ces pa bsam gtan ni sems rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan pas ma bya blo ldan mchog / ces pa bsam gtan ni sems rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: Concentration is the one-pointed mind.

original: bsam bya ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsam bya ni bzhi ste /
translated: The object of concentration is fourfold:

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba'o //
translated: conception, discernment, joy, and bliss.

original: blo ldan mchog ni mi g-yo ba'i don to //
analyzed: blo ldan mchog ni mi g-yo ba'i don to //
translated: The supreme intelligent one is the meaning of unwavering.

original: de la srog rtsol ni /
analyzed: de la srog rtsol ni /
translated: In that respect, prāṇa and āyāma:

original: rigs gsum 'chang ba gsang sngags 'chang //
analyzed: rigs gsum 'chang ba gsang sngags 'chang //
translated: The holder of the three families is the holder of secret mantra.

original: dam tshig chen po gsang sngags 'dzin //
analyzed: dam tshig chen po gsang sngags 'dzin //
translated: The holder of the great pledge is the holder of secret mantra.

original: zhes pa rtsa gsum na rlung gsum gnas pa nas rgyu ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa rtsa gsum na rlung gsum gnas pa nas rgyu ba ste /
translated: The three families are the three nāḍīs. The three winds are the three families.

original: g-yon zla ba ste sku /
analyzed: g-yon zla ba ste sku /
translated: The left is the moon, the body.

original: g-yas nyi ma ste gsung /
analyzed: g-yas nyi ma ste gsung /
translated: The right is the sun, speech.

original: dbus sgra gcan te thugs kyi rigs te rigs gsum mo //
analyzed: dbus sgra gcan te thugs kyi rigs te rigs gsum mo //
translated: In the center is Rāhu, the mind family, the three families.

original: de sgrub @213b pa po'i lus la gnas pas na 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: de sgrub @213b pa po'i lus la gnas pas na 'chang ba'o //
translated: Since they abide in the body of the practitioner, they are “held.”

original: gsang sngags 'chang ni rlung 'byung ba dang 'jug pa dang gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gsang sngags 'chang ni rlung 'byung ba dang 'jug pa dang gnas pa'o //
translated: The mantra holder is the exhalation, inhalation, and retention of the vāyu.

original: dam tshig chen po ni de bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig chen po ni de bsgom pa'o //
translated: The great pledge is meditating on that.

original: gsang sngags 'dzin ni rlung 'jug pa aom /
analyzed: gsang sngags 'dzin ni rlung 'jug pa aom /
translated: The mantra holder is the inhalation of the vāyu, oṃ;

original: 'byung ba h'um /🔽gnas pa a'a: / de 'dzin pas na gsang sngags 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba h'um / gnas pa a'a: / de 'dzin pas na gsang sngags 'dzin pa'o //
translated: the exhalation, hūṃ;🔽and the retention, āḥ.

original: 'dzin pa ni /🔽don yod zhags pa rnam par rgyal //🔽'dzin pa chen po rdo rje zhags //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni / don yod zhags pa rnam par rgyal // 'dzin pa chen po rdo rje zhags //
translated: Since one holds that, one is a mantra holder.🔽The vajra noose is the great holder.

original: rdo rje lcags kyu zhags pa che //
analyzed: rdo rje lcags kyu zhags pa che //
translated: The great noose is the vajra hook.

original: zhes par sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes par sbyar ro //
translated: Apply those.

original: 'di la phyi dang nang du sbyar te /
analyzed: 'di la phyi dang nang du sbyar te /
translated: This is applied externally and internally.

original: phyi ni bskyed rim la ye shes pa spyan 'dren pa'i sgo ba bzhi la /
analyzed: phyi ni bskyed rim la ye shes pa spyan 'dren pa'i sgo ba bzhi la /
translated: Externally, the four door-holding awareness beings who invite the awareness beings into the creation stage are as follows:

original: don yod zhags pa rnam par rgyal ni lho ru zhags pa /
analyzed: don yod zhags pa rnam par rgyal ni lho ru zhags pa /
translated: The Amoghapāśavijaya is the noose in the south.

original: nang du me'i rlung /
analyzed: nang du me'i rlung /
translated: Internally, it is the fire vāyu.

original: 'dzin pa chen po ni byang du lcags sgrog / nang du chu'i rlung /
analyzed: 'dzin pa chen po ni byang du lcags sgrog / nang du chu'i rlung /
translated: The mahādhara is the iron chain in the north.

original: rdo rje zhags ni shar du rdo rje dril bu /
analyzed: rdo rje zhags ni shar du rdo rje dril bu /
translated: The vajra noose is the vajra bell in the east.

original: nang du rlung gi rlung /
analyzed: nang du rlung gi rlung /
translated: Inside, it is the wind vāyu.

original: rdo rje lcags kyu zhags pa che ni nub tu lcags kyu /
analyzed: rdo rje lcags kyu zhags pa che ni nub tu lcags kyu /
translated: The great vajra hook and noose is the iron hook in the west.

original: nang du sa'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: nang du sa'i rlung ngo //
translated: Inside, it is the earth vāyu.

original: phyi ru ni sgo ba bzhis dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dgyes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi ru ni sgo ba bzhis dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dgyes par bya ba'o //
translated: Externally, the four doors are the activities of summoning, inducting, binding, and delighting.

original: nang du ni spyi bo'i khams rlung bzhis 'khor lo rim par dgug gzhug byas nas /
analyzed: nang du ni spyi bo'i khams rlung bzhis 'khor lo rim par dgug gzhug byas nas /
translated: Internally, the four elements at the crown are summoned and inducted into the cakras in sequence.

original: 'dzin pa chen po rdo rje zhags //
analyzed: 'dzin pa chen po rdo rje zhags //
translated: The great binding is the vajra noose.

original: zhes so // rjes su dran pa ni /
analyzed: zhes so // rjes su dran pa ni /
translated: The recollection is

original: gtso bo dkon mchog gsum 'dzin pa //
analyzed: gtso bo dkon mchog gsum 'dzin pa //
translated: the principal one who holds the three jewels.

original: zhes pa phyi ru ni dkon mchog gsum rjes su dran pa yin la //
analyzed: zhes pa phyi ru ni dkon mchog gsum rjes su dran pa yin la //
translated: Externally, this is the recollection of the three jewels.

original: nang du dkon mchog gsum ni pha'i cha dang ma'i cha dang rnam par shes pa dang gsum mo //
analyzed: nang du dkon mchog gsum ni pha'i cha dang ma'i cha dang rnam par shes pa dang gsum mo //
translated: Internally, the three jewels are the paternal aspect, the maternal aspect, and the consciousness.

original: de gsum rlung gi stobs kyis gcig tu tshogs pa ni dkon pa'i mchog go //
analyzed: de gsum rlung gi stobs kyis gcig tu tshogs pa ni dkon pa'i mchog go //
translated: Those three gathered into one through the power of the vāyu is the supreme jewel.

original: de las bde ba skyes pas theg pa gsum mchog go //
analyzed: de las bde ba skyes pas theg pa gsum mchog go //
translated: Since bliss arises from that, it is the supreme vehicle.

original: ston pa po ni mngon du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa po ni mngon du rtogs pa'o //
translated: The teacher is the manifest realization.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin ni /
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin ni /
translated: Here, the samadhi is

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi sku yi mchog /'gro kun dga' ba'i mig dang ldan //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi sku yi mchog /'gro kun dga' ba'i mig dang ldan //
translated: the supreme body of all buddhas, endowed with the eyes that delight all migrating beings,

original: sna tshogs gzugs can skyed pa po //
analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs can skyed pa po //
translated: the creator of various forms,

original: mchod cing rjed pa drang srong che //
analyzed: mchod cing rjed pa drang srong che //
translated: the one to be worshiped and revered, the great sage.

original: zhes pa sangs rgyas kun gyi sku yi mchog ni ye shes kyi sku'o //
analyzed: zhes pa sangs rgyas kun gyi sku yi mchog ni ye shes kyi sku'o //
translated: The supreme body of all buddhas is the jnanakaya.

original: 'gro kun dga' ba'i mig dang ldan ni ye shes kyi spyan gyis thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro kun dga' ba'i mig dang ldan ni ye shes kyi spyan gyis thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
translated: Endowed with the eyes that delight all migrating beings is the omniscience of the eyes of wisdom.

original: sna tshogs gzugs can ni nam mkha' dag pa'i 'od kyi lus dangs ma'i rang bzhin no /
analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs can ni nam mkha' dag pa'i 'od kyi lus dangs ma'i rang bzhin no /
translated: Various forms is the nature of the pure light of the sky.

original: skyed pa po ni ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: skyed pa po ni ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: The creator is samadhi.

original: mchod cing rjed pa dang drang srong che ni g-yas dang g-yon gyi rlung bcu 'gags pas drang srong chen po kun gyis mchod pa'i gnas su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mchod cing rjed pa dang drang srong che ni g-yas dang g-yon gyi rlung bcu 'gags pas drang srong chen po kun gyis mchod pa'i gnas su gyur pa'o //
translated: Worshiped and revered, the great sage, is the state of being the object of worship of all great sages because the ten right and left winds have ceased.

original: de'i rtags ni /
analyzed: de'i rtags ni /
translated: The sign of that is

original: nam mkha' las byung rang byung ba //
analyzed: nam mkha' las byung rang byung ba //
translated: arising from space, self-arisen.

original: @214a * // zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: @214a * // zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: And so on.

original: nam mkha' las byung ni gzugs brnyan yin bas rang byung ba ni rgyu med pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' las byung ni gzugs brnyan yin bas rang byung ba ni rgyu med pa'o //
translated: Arisen from space is the reflection, so self-arisen is causeless.

original: shes rab ye shes me bo che ni me 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab ye shes me bo che ni me 'bar ba'o //
translated: The great fire of wisdom-gnosis is the blazing fire.

original: 'od chen rnam par snang mdzad che ni zla ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'od chen rnam par snang mdzad che ni zla ba lta bu'o //
translated: The great illuminator, the great illuminator, is like the moon.

original: ye shes snang ba lam me ba ni nyi ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: ye shes snang ba lam me ba ni nyi ma lta bu'o //
translated: The shining light of gnosis is like the sun.

original: 'gro ba'i mar me ye shes sgron ni rdo rje sra gcan lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i mar me ye shes sgron ni rdo rje sra gcan lta bu'o //
translated: The lamp of gnosis, the butter lamp of migrators, is like the vajra meteor.

original: gzi brjid chen po 'od gsal ba ni glog lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzi brjid chen po 'od gsal ba ni glog lta bu'o //
translated: The great splendor, the clear light, is like lightning.

original: sngags mchog mnga' bdag rig sngags rgyal ni thig le stong pa ste nyin mo'i rtags drug go //
analyzed: sngags mchog mnga' bdag rig sngags rgyal ni thig le stong pa ste nyin mo'i rtags drug go //
translated: The lord of supreme mantra, the king of awareness mantras, is the empty drop. Those are the six signs of the day.

original: de'i nang du rtags can ye shes sku ni /
analyzed: de'i nang du rtags can ye shes sku ni /
translated: The sign of the gnosis body within that is:

original: gsang sngags rgyal po don chen byed //
analyzed: gsang sngags rgyal po don chen byed //
translated: The king of secret mantras performs the great purpose.

original: ces pa'o // de ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: ces pa'o // de ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: That is the saṃbhogakāya.

original: ye shes sku'i ngo bo ni /
analyzed: ye shes sku'i ngo bo ni /
translated: The essence of the jñānakāya is:

original: shes pas srid 'byung skye gnas med //
analyzed: shes pas srid 'byung skye gnas med //
translated: Consciousness does not arise in existence.

original: ces pa la sogs te /
analyzed: ces pa la sogs te /
translated: And so on.

original: shes pas ni lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: shes pas ni lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: Consciousness is connate.

original: srid 'byung ni 'khor ba las yid 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: srid 'byung ni 'khor ba las yid 'byung ba'o //
translated: The emergence of existence is the disgust with cyclic existence.

original: skye gnas par ni 'khor bar ro //
analyzed: skye gnas par ni 'khor bar ro //
translated: The birth of cyclic existence is the disgust with cyclic existence.

original: chos las 'byung ba ni zag med bde ba'o //
analyzed: chos las 'byung ba ni zag med bde ba'o //
translated: The emergence of the Dharma is the undefiled bliss.

original: srid pa sel ba ni de 'khor ba'o //🔽gcig pu sra mkhregs ni gcig pu ni ye shes sku yin la /
analyzed: srid pa sel ba ni de 'khor ba'o // gcig pu sra mkhregs ni gcig pu ni ye shes sku yin la /
translated: The removal of existence is the disgust with cyclic existence.

original: sra mkhregs ni 'dus ma byas pa'i rdo rje'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: sra mkhregs ni 'dus ma byas pa'i rdo rje'i bdag nyid do //

analyzed: // / da ni me long lta bu'i ye shes la bstod pa brjod par bya ste /

original: rdo rje 'jigs byed 'jigs par byed //
analyzed: rdo rje 'jigs byed 'jigs par byed //

original: ces pa la sogs pa /

analyzed: rim gyis par bsgom pa la gtso bo 'pho ba ni /

analyzed: sangs rgyas spyan rlung gi mtshams su bzhugs pa'o //

original: rdo rje skyil krung du bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje skyil krung du bzhugs pa'o //

analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor chen po de la don dam pa'i sgo nas bstod pa la /
translated: In that way, the praise from the perspective of the ultimate is as follows.

analyzed: sku'i sgo nas bstod pa dang / gsung gi dang / thugs kyi dang / phrin las kyi dang / yon tan gyi sgo nas bstod pa'o //

analyzed: de la sku'i sgo nas bstod pa la / rdo rje 'jigs byed 'jigs par byed //

analyzed: rdo rje ral gri ma lus gcod pa ni spang bya thams cad do //

analyzed: rdo rje kun 'chang ni ye shes lnga'i'o //

analyzed: rdo rje can ni de dang ldan pa'o //

analyzed: rdo rje 'bar ba mig mi bzang ni phyi ru ye shes la spyan 'dren pa'o //

original: nang du lta stangs kyis ye shes skye ba'o ;
analyzed: nang du lta stangs kyis ye shes skye ba'o ;
translated: The eye of gnosis arises internally through the gaze.

analyzed: / rdo rje 'bebs pa 'bebs pa che ni ye shes so // mig brgya pa ste rdo rje'i mig / ces pa mig brgya pa rigs yin /
translated: The vajra descent is the great descent of gnosis.🔽The hundred eyes is the vajra eye.

original: rdo rje'i mig ni ye shes skye ba'i lta stangs so //
analyzed: rdo rje'i mig ni ye shes skye ba'i lta stangs so //
translated: The hundred eyes is the family. The vajra eye is the gaze that gives rise to gnosis.

analyzed: de ltar phrin las spyi'i sgo nas bstod pa ni / skra yang rdo rje 'bar ba ste //
translated: Thus the praise from the perspective of the general activities🔽is connected to the following:🔽The hair is the blazing vajra.

original: lus ni rdo rje'i ba spu can //🔽zhes par 'brel te ;
analyzed: lus ni rdo rje'i ba spu can //🔽zhes par 'brel te ;
translated: The body has vajra body hairs.

original: / rdo rje'i sku de la yon tan gyi khyad par ni lus dang skra dang spu dang pags pa dang / sen mo rdo rjer byas pas shin tu sra ba dang mkhregs pa'o //
analyzed: / rdo rje'i sku de la yon tan gyi khyad par ni lus dang skra dang spu dang pags pa dang / sen mo rdo rjer byas pas shin tu sra ba dang mkhregs pa'o //
translated: The special qualities of that vajra body are that the body, hair, pores, nails, and so on are made of vajra, and thus are very hard and solid.🔽Therefore,

original: des na / rdo rje phring  thogs dpal dang ldan //
analyzed: des na / rdo rje phring  thogs dpal dang ldan //
translated: He is glorious, holding a vajra chain.

original: zhes pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs pa'o //
translated: This means that the accumulations of merit and wisdom are complete.

original: des na rdo rje rgyan gyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: des na rdo rje rgyan gyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, he is adorned with vajra ornaments.

original: yi ge drug pa ni phyi'i skye mched yul drug dang / nang gi skye mched dbang po drug rdo rje ste dbyer mi phyed pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge drug pa ni phyi'i skye mched yul drug dang / nang gi skye mched dbang po drug rdo rje ste dbyer mi phyed pa'o //
translated: The six syllables are the six outer sense fields and the six inner sense faculties, which are vajra, meaning inseparable.

original: 'jam dbyangs chen po ni yul thams cad bde bar snang bas na 'jam pa'i dbyangs so //
analyzed: 'jam dbyangs chen po ni yul thams cad bde bar snang bas na 'jam pa'i dbyangs so //
translated: Great Mañjughoṣa is Mañjughosa because all objects appear as bliss.

original: sgra che ba ni ci snang ba de las ma 'das pa'o //
analyzed: sgra che ba ni ci snang ba de las ma 'das pa'o //
translated: Great sound means that nothing appears that is beyond that.

original: 'jig rten gsum na sgra gcig pa ni @215b srid pa gsum dang de las ma 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum na sgra gcig pa ni @215b srid pa gsum dang de las ma 'das pa'o //
translated: The single sound in the three worlds is the three existences, which are not beyond that.

original: nam mkha'i mtha' las sgra sgrogs pa ni rdo rje lhan cig skyes pa'i sku des kun la khyab pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtha' las sgra sgrogs pa ni rdo rje lhan cig skyes pa'i sku des kun la khyab pa'o //
translated: The sound that resounds from the end of space is that the vajra coemergent body pervades all.

original: sgra dang ldan pa rnams kyi mchog / ces pa lhan cig skyes pa'i sgra de sgra thams cad kyi mchog go //
analyzed: sgra dang ldan pa rnams kyi mchog / ces pa lhan cig skyes pa'i sgra de sgra thams cad kyi mchog go //
translated: The best of those endowed with sound is that the sound of the coemergent is the best of all sounds.

original: de ltar le'u bdun ba'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: de ltar le'u bdun ba'i bshad pa'o /
translated: Thus, the explanation of the seventh chapter.

original: // / da ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes la bstod pa brjod par bya ste //
analyzed: // / da ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes la bstod pa brjod par bya ste //
translated: Now, the praise of the individually discriminating gnosis will be stated.

original: dang po dbyibs kyi rnal 'byor ni rang rkyang par bsgoms nas /
analyzed: dang po dbyibs kyi rnal 'byor ni rang rkyang par bsgoms nas /
translated: First, the yoga of shape is meditating on the solitary one.

original: dang po srung ba nas dbang bskur ba yan chad rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dang po srung ba nas dbang bskur ba yan chad rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: First, from the protection up to the empowerment, one should complete it.

original: rim par bsgom ba gtso bo 'pho ba ste /
analyzed: rim par bsgom ba gtso bo 'pho ba ste /
translated: The main transference is meditating in stages.

original: sngar gyi snang ba mtha' yas yab yum byang dang dbang ldan gyi le tshe la bzhugs pa'i dbus kyi le tshe la bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: sngar gyi snang ba mtha' yas yab yum byang dang dbang ldan gyi le tshe la bzhugs pa'i dbus kyi le tshe la bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The previous Amitābha couple resides in the square of the north and northeast.

original: de la mi bskyod pa byang du /
analyzed: de la mi bskyod pa byang du /
translated: Akṣobhya resides in the square of the north.

original: rdo rje dbyings phyug ma dbang ldan gyi mtshams su bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings phyug ma dbang ldan gyi mtshams su bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Vajradhātvīśvarī resides in the square of the northeast.

original: snang ba mtha' yas kyi thugs kar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la ye shes sems pa'i rdo rje rnon po zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa sku mdog dkar po g-yas na ral gri g-yon na padma bsnams pa rdo rje skyil krung gis bzhugs pa'o //

translated: At the heart of Amitābha is a sun mandala, upon which is a sharp wisdom being vajra, white, with one face and two arms, holding a sword in the right hand and a lotus in the left hand, seated in vajra posture.

original: de'i thugs kar 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa la aom badzra t'i ksha  ya te na ma: zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i thugs kar 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa la aom badzra t'i ksha  ya te na ma: zhes pa'o //
translated: At his heart is an eight-spoked wheel, on which is oṃ vajra-tīkṣṇa-yathā te naḥ.

original: de'i lte ba la aa dkar po gnas par bsam mo //
analyzed: de'i lte ba la aa dkar po gnas par bsam mo //
translated: In its center is a white a.

original: byang phyogs pa'i lha gzhan dang mi bskyod pa gzhan sku mdog dang phyag mtshan du gyur pa bsam mo //
analyzed: byang phyogs pa'i lha gzhan dang mi bskyod pa gzhan sku mdog dang phyag mtshan du gyur pa bsam mo //
translated: Imagine that the other deities of the north and the other Akṣobhyas transform into the color and implements of the principal.

original: de ltar dbyibs kyi rnal 'byor bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar dbyibs kyi rnal 'byor bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the yoga of shape,

original: de rnal 'byor gzhan lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa la mdor bstan pa dang / rgyas par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de rnal 'byor gzhan lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa la mdor bstan pa dang / rgyas par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: the other yogas are the summary, extensive explanation, and conclusion of the path with its result.

original: dang bo ye shes kyi sku mngon sum du bsgom pa dang / dbang bzhi dang / de'i 'bras bu'o ;
analyzed: dang bo ye shes kyi sku mngon sum du bsgom pa dang / dbang bzhi dang / de'i 'bras bu'o ;
translated: The first is the meditation on the direct perception of the jñānakāya, the four empowerments, and the result of that.

original: / yang dag bdag med yi ge med //
analyzed: / yang dag bdag med yi ge med //
translated: The true absence of self, the absence of syllables,

original: yang dag mtha' ste yi ge med //
analyzed: yang dag mtha' ste yi ge med //
translated: The limit of reality, the absence of syllables.

original: ces pa 'di ltar bsgom pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: ces pa 'di ltar bsgom pa ni gnyis te /
translated: This is the meditation on the absence of syllables. There are two kinds:

original: rjes dpag dang / mngon sum du bsgom pa'o //🔽dang po ni rtog pa dang bcas pa sngar shi ba'i mi /🔽rang gis ma mthong ba /
analyzed: rjes dpag dang / mngon sum du bsgom pa'o // dang po ni rtog pa dang bcas pa sngar shi ba'i mi / rang gis ma mthong ba /
translated: inferential and direct perception.🔽The first is meditation on the basis of what one has heard from others,

original: gzhan gyis bshad nas bsgom pa'o ;
analyzed: gzhan gyis bshad nas bsgom pa'o ;
translated: without having seen for oneself a dead person🔽who has already decomposed.

original: / mngon sum du bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: / mngon sum du bsgom pa ni /
translated: The meditation on direct perception is

original: nam mkha' la du ba la sogs pa rim gyis mngon sum du mthong ba'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la du ba la sogs pa rim gyis mngon sum du mthong ba'o //
translated: the direct perception of smoke and so forth in the sky.

original: yang dag pa ni yang dag par ram don dam pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ni yang dag par ram don dam pa'o //
translated: The true is the ultimate reality.

original: bdag med pa ni gang zag dang chos gnyis so //
analyzed: bdag med pa ni gang zag dang chos gnyis so //
translated: The absence of self is the absence of the two kinds of self, the personal and the phenomenal.

original: de bzhin nyid ni de'i rnal 'byor yin ma bcos pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni de'i rnal 'byor yin ma bcos pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Suchness is the nature of the uncontrived yoga.

original: @216a * // yang dag pa'i mtha' ste ni thob par bya ba'i 'bras bu yang dag pa'i don to //
analyzed: @216a * // yang dag pa'i mtha' ste ni thob par bya ba'i 'bras bu yang dag pa'i don to //
translated: The limit of reality is the ultimate reality, the goal to be attained.

original: yi ge med pa la skyed par byed pa'i yi ge h'um la sogs pa'i sa bon med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge med pa la skyed par byed pa'i yi ge h'um la sogs pa'i sa bon med par byed pa'o //
translated: The absence of syllables is the absence of the seed syllables such as hūṃ, which are the syllables that generate.

original: de med pas de bskyed pa'i lha'i zhal dang phyag dang sku mdog dang phyag mtshan med pa'o //
analyzed: de med pas de bskyed pa'i lha'i zhal dang phyag dang sku mdog dang phyag mtshan med pa'o //
translated: Since that does not exist, the face, hands, body color, and hand implements of the deity that generate that do not exist.

original: yi ge med pa de rtsa ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa /
analyzed: yi ge med pa de rtsa ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa /
translated: That absence of syllables is stated in the Root Tantra:

original: mi 'dzag pa dang mi g-yo ba //
analyzed: mi 'dzag pa dang mi g-yo ba //
translated: Not dripping, not moving,

original: gzhan gyi gnas su mi 'gro bas //
analyzed: gzhan gyi gnas su mi 'gro bas //
translated: not going to another place,

original: yi ge'i sgra ni dbyangs su brjod //
analyzed: yi ge'i sgra ni dbyangs su brjod //
translated: the sound of syllables is expressed as melody.

original: ces mi g-yo ba'i sgra ni mi g-yo ba'i ye shes la rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ces mi g-yo ba'i sgra ni mi g-yo ba'i ye shes la rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: The sound of “not moving” is the gnosis of nonmoving, which is called “Vajrasattva.”

original: de bzhin du yid skyob par 'gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du yid skyob par 'gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, because it protects the mind,

original: sngags kyi mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes la brjod do //
analyzed: sngags kyi mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes la brjod do //
translated: it is called “the supreme mantra,” which is the gnosis of the unchanging.

original: de bzhin du nang gi bdag nyid can gyi rig pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du nang gi bdag nyid can gyi rig pa /
translated: Similarly, the inner-awareness

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma /
translated: is Prajñāpāramitā,

original: rang gi 'od gsal ba /
analyzed: rang gi 'od gsal ba /
translated: self-luminous,

original: phyag rgya chen po //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po //
translated: mahāmudrā,

original: lhan cig skyes pa dga' ba'i gzugs //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa dga' ba'i gzugs //
translated: the form of connate joy.

original: zhes rgyal ba rnams kyis brjod do //
analyzed: zhes rgyal ba rnams kyis brjod do //
translated: Thus it is expressed by the victors.

original: de bsgom pa'i man ngag ni nyin mo dang mtshan mo'i rnal 'byor te /
analyzed: de bsgom pa'i man ngag ni nyin mo dang mtshan mo'i rnal 'byor te /
translated: The esoteric instructions for meditating on that are the yogas of day and night.

original: 'og nas / nam mkha'i lam la rab gnas pa //
analyzed: 'og nas / nam mkha'i lam la rab gnas pa //
translated: The following verse, “Abiding in the path of space,🔽”

original: zhes pa nyin mo'i rnal 'byor yin te de'i rnal 'byor la me 'bar ba la sogs pa'i rtags drug gong du bshad pa dang 'brel te /
analyzed: zhes pa nyin mo'i rnal 'byor yin te de'i rnal 'byor la me 'bar ba la sogs pa'i rtags drug gong du bshad pa dang 'brel te /
translated: is the yoga of the daytime, and the yoga of that is the six signs of the blazing fire, and so on, which are related to the above.

original: thig le'i nang du ye shes kyi gzugs brnyan snang ba ste /
analyzed: thig le'i nang du ye shes kyi gzugs brnyan snang ba ste /
translated: The images of gnosis appear inside the bindu.

original: rtags drug ni sha'i spyan gyis mthong ngo //
analyzed: rtags drug ni sha'i spyan gyis mthong ngo //
translated: The six signs are seen with the fleshly eye.

original: lha'i spyan gyis ye shes kyi gzugs brnyan mthong ste /
analyzed: lha'i spyan gyis ye shes kyi gzugs brnyan mthong ste /
translated: The images of gnosis are seen with the divine eye.

original: gzugs med gzugs bzang dam pa ste //
analyzed: gzugs med gzugs bzang dam pa ste //
translated: The formless is the excellent form.

original: sna tshogs gzugs can yid las skyes //🔽gzugs rnams thams cad snang ba'i dpal //
analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs can yid las skyes // gzugs rnams thams cad snang ba'i dpal //
translated: The various forms are born from the mind.🔽The glory of the appearance of all forms

original: gzugs brnyan ma lus 'chang ba po //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan ma lus 'chang ba po //
translated: holds all images without exception.

original: zhes pa ni gzugs med pa ni rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i gzugs med pa ste //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gzugs med pa ni rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i gzugs med pa ste //
translated: The formless is the absence of form that is a composite of subtle particles.

original: gzugs bzang ba ni 'ja' tshon lta bu'i kha dog dang gzugs su ldan ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs bzang ba ni 'ja' tshon lta bu'i kha dog dang gzugs su ldan ba'o //
translated: The excellent form is endowed with the color and form of a rainbow.

original: sna tshogs gzugs can ni kha dog drug dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs can ni kha dog drug dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The various forms are endowed with the six colors.

original: pha rol ni yul grub pa med pas yid las bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol ni yul grub pa med pas yid las bskyed pa'o //
translated: The other shore is generated from the mind, since the country is not established.

original: gzugs rnams thams cad snang ba'i dpal //🔽zhes pa rdul gcig gi steng na rdul snyed kyi sangs rgyas bzhugs pa'o //🔽gzugs brnyan ma lus 'chang ba po //
analyzed: gzugs rnams thams cad snang ba'i dpal // zhes pa rdul gcig gi steng na rdul snyed kyi sangs rgyas bzhugs pa'o // gzugs brnyan ma lus 'chang ba po //
translated: The glory of the appearance of all forms

original: zhes pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: zhes pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste /
translated: is the enjoyment body, since the enjoyment body is the appearance of all forms.

original: sprul pa'i sku zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku zhes bya'o //
translated: The emanation body is the emanation body.

original: de yang 'byung ba las 'byung ba ma yin te rang byung ba'i sku'o //
analyzed: de yang 'byung ba las 'byung ba ma yin te rang byung ba'i sku'o //
translated: Moreover, it is not produced from the elements, but is a self-originated body.

original: de yang dus kyi 'khor @216b lo las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang dus kyi 'khor @216b lo las gsungs pa /
translated: That is also stated in the Kālacakra Tantra:

original: sra ba min par sa'i rnam pa dang ni gsher ba med pa'i chu yi lus te chu ma yin //
analyzed: sra ba min par sa'i rnam pa dang ni gsher ba med pa'i chu yi lus te chu ma yin //
translated: The form of earth is not solid, the body of water is not wet,

original: me ma yin pa me yi rnam pa gang zhig g-yo ba med pa'i rlung gi lus te rlung ma yin //
analyzed: me ma yin pa me yi rnam pa gang zhig g-yo ba med pa'i rlung gi lus te rlung ma yin //
translated: the form of fire is not hot, the body of wind is not moving.

original: mthong ba'i stong ba'i rnam pa dang ni mdog med pa yi dkar po ljang gu sna tshogs chen po rnams //
analyzed: mthong ba'i stong ba'i rnam pa dang ni mdog med pa yi dkar po ljang gu sna tshogs chen po rnams //
translated: The form of space is empty, the color of earth is yellow, the color of water is white, the color of fire is red, the color of wind is black, and the color of space is green.

original: kun gyi rnam pa yang ni rang gi sems kyi rnyog ma nyon mongs bdud kyi mthu yis mthong ma yin //🔽zhes pas so //
analyzed: kun gyi rnam pa yang ni rang gi sems kyi rnyog ma nyon mongs bdud kyi mthu yis mthong ma yin // zhes pas so //
translated: The forms of all are seen by the power of the mind’s own defilements, not by the power of the demons.

original: gzugs brnyan de las lha'i rna bas chos thos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan de las lha'i rna bas chos thos par 'gyur te /
translated: From that reflected form, the Dharma is heard by the divine ear.

original: stong nyid smra ba'i khyu mchog ste //
analyzed: stong nyid smra ba'i khyu mchog ste //
translated: The best of speakers on emptiness

original: zhes pa stong pa nyid las 'byung ba'i gzugs de chos smra ba'i khyu mchog ste /
analyzed: zhes pa stong pa nyid las 'byung ba'i gzugs de chos smra ba'i khyu mchog ste /
translated: The reflected form that arises from emptiness is the best of speakers on the Dharma.

original: zab cing rgya che'i sgra sgrogs pa //
analyzed: zab cing rgya che'i sgra sgrogs pa //
translated: The sound of the profound and vast

original: zhes pa zab pa ni mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes pa zab pa ni mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The profound is unchanging wisdom.

original: rgya che ba ni theg pa gsum gyi chos kyi sgra sgrogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgya che ba ni theg pa gsum gyi chos kyi sgra sgrogs pa'o //
translated: The vast is the sound of the Dharma of the three vehicles.

original: de chos kyi dung dang gand'i dang / chos kyi rnga bo che'i sgra sgrogs pa'o //
analyzed: de chos kyi dung dang gand'i dang / chos kyi rnga bo che'i sgra sgrogs pa'o //
translated: That is the sound of the Dharma conch, the Dharma drum, and the great Dharma drum.

original: de ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: de ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i sku'o //
translated: That is the body of nonabiding nirvana.

original: tshugs pa med cing che bar grags //🔽zhes par sbyar te /
analyzed: tshugs pa med cing che bar grags // zhes par sbyar te /
translated: Unassailable, renowned as great

original: tshugs pa med pa ni gzugs sku gsung ba la bdud dang mu stegs kyis so //
analyzed: tshugs pa med pa ni gzugs sku gsung ba la bdud dang mu stegs kyis so //
translated: Unassailable means that the form body is not assailed by demons and tirthikas.

original: che bar grags pa ni bsod nams zad mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: che bar grags pa ni bsod nams zad mi shes pa'o //
translated: Great fame is inexhaustible merit.

original: des khams gsum la dbang sgyur pas dbang phyug chen po'o //
analyzed: des khams gsum la dbang sgyur pas dbang phyug chen po'o //
translated: Since he controls the three realms, he is the great lord.

original: 'phags lam shin tu mtho la gnas pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: 'phags lam shin tu mtho la gnas pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: Abiding in the exalted path is the enjoyment body.

original: dar ba chen po ni sku bzhi las gzugs skur snang ba dar phyar bar rin po che'i tog gtsugs  pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dar ba chen po ni sku bzhi las gzugs skur snang ba dar phyar bar rin po che'i tog gtsugs  pa lta bu'o //
translated: Great prosperity is the appearance of the form body from among the four bodies, like a banner of prosperity with a jewel crest.

original: de ltar ye shes kyi sku mngon sum du bsgom pa la sngon du dbang dgos pas dbang bstan pa la //
analyzed: de ltar ye shes kyi sku mngon sum du bsgom pa la sngon du dbang dgos pas dbang bstan pa la //
translated: Thus, since empowerment is necessary beforehand for the direct cultivation of the body of pristine consciousness, the explanation of empowerment is as follows.

original: 'jig rten gsum na gzhon lus gcig / ces pa la 'jig rten gsum lus ngag yid gsum dag par byed pa'i dbang gsum mo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum na gzhon lus gcig / ces pa la 'jig rten gsum lus ngag yid gsum dag par byed pa'i dbang gsum mo //
translated: The single youthful body in the three worlds is the three empowerments that purify the three worlds of body, speech, and mind.

original: gzhon lus gcig ni chu'i la sogs bdun bskur nas bum pa'i rdo rje slob dpon rgyal tshab gzhon nu zhes bya ste lus dag pa'o //
analyzed: gzhon lus gcig ni chu'i la sogs bdun bskur nas bum pa'i rdo rje slob dpon rgyal tshab gzhon nu zhes bya ste lus dag pa'o //
translated: The single youthful body is the youthful regent vase empowerment conferred with the seven water empowerments and so on, called the vajra master.

original: de ni sa brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sa brgyad pa'o //
translated: That is the eighth stage.

original: gnas brtan rgan po ni gzhon nu las gong mar gyur pas rgan po ste gsang ba'i dbang gis gang ba'i skye dgu'i bdag po sa dgu pa'o //
analyzed: gnas brtan rgan po ni gzhon nu las gong mar gyur pas rgan po ste gsang ba'i dbang gis gang ba'i skye dgu'i bdag po sa dgu pa'o //
translated: The elder is superior to the youth, so the elder is the lord of beings filled with the secret empowerment, the ninth stage.

original: / sum cu rtsa gnyis mtshan 'chang ba //
analyzed: / sum cu rtsa gnyis mtshan 'chang ba //
translated: Bearing the thirty-two marks

original: zhes pa shes rab ye shes kyi dbang ste /🔽rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis nas byang chub sems rim gyis gsang gnas su 'bab pa'i bde ba lhan cig skyes @217a * //
analyzed: zhes pa shes rab ye shes kyi dbang ste / rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis nas byang chub sems rim gyis gsang gnas su 'bab pa'i bde ba lhan cig skyes @217a * //
translated: is the empowerment of the gnosis of the wisdom consort.

original: pa'i rtog pas sa bcu pa shes rab ye shes dbang ngo //
analyzed: pa'i rtog pas sa bcu pa shes rab ye shes dbang ngo //
translated: The bodhicitta gradually descends from the thirty-two nāḍīs to the secret place, and the bliss is the realization of the connate gnosis, the tenth stage.

original: sdu gu 'jig rten gsum na mdzes //
analyzed: sdu gu 'jig rten gsum na mdzes //
translated: Handsome, beautiful in the three worlds
